content: 1 How happy the man Who hath not walked in the counsel of the lawless,— And in the way of sinners hath not stood, And in the seat of scoffers hath not sat;
content_old: 1 How happy the man Who hath not walked in the counsel of the lawless,— And in the way of sinners hath not stood, And in the seat of scoffers hath not sat;

content: 2 But in the law of Yahweh is his delight,— And in his law doth he talk with himself day and night.
content_old: 2 But in the law of Yahweh is his delight,— And in his law doth he talk with himself day and night.

content: 3 So doth he become like a tree planted by streams of waters,— That yieldeth its fruit in its season､ Whose leaf also doth not wither, And whatsoever he doeth prospereth.
content_old: 3 So doth he become like a tree planted by streams of waters,— That yieldeth its fruit in its season､ Whose leaf also doth not wither, And whatsoever he doeth prospereth.

content: 4 Not so the lawless,— But as chaff which is driven about by the wind:
content_old: 4 Not so the lawless,— But as chaff which is driven about by the wind:

content: 5 For this cause shall the lawless not stand in the judgment,— Nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
content_old: 5 For this cause shall the lawless not stand in the judgment,— Nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.

content: 1 Wherefore have nations assembled in tumult? Or should peoples mutter an empty thing?
content_old: 1 Wherefore have nations assembled in tumult? Or should peoples mutter an empty thing?

content: 2 The kings of earth take their station､ And grave men have met by appointment together,— Against Yahweh And against his Anointed One saying:
content_old: 2 The kings of earth take their station､ And grave men have met by appointment together,— Against Yahweh And against his Anointed One saying:

content: 3 Let us break asunder their bonds,— And cast from us their cords!
content_old: 3 Let us break asunder their bonds,— And cast from us their cords!

content: 4 He that sitteth in the heavens will laugh,— My Lord will mock at them:
content_old: 4 He that sitteth in the heavens will laugh,— My Lord will mock at them:

content: 5 Then will he speak unto them in his anger, And in his Wrath confound them:
content_old: 5 Then will he speak unto them in his anger, And in his Wrath confound them:

content: 6 Yet I have installed my king,— On Zion my holy mountain.
content_old: 6 Yet I have installed my king,— On Zion my holy mountain.

content: 7 Let me tell of a decree,— Yahweh hath said unto me､ My son thou art, I to-day have begotten thee:
content_old: 7 Let me tell of a decree,— Yahweh hath said unto me､ My son thou art, I to-day have begotten thee:

content: 8 Ask of me､ and let me give Nations as thine inheritance, And as thy possession the ends of the earth:
content_old: 8 Ask of me､ and let me give Nations as thine inheritance, And as thy possession the ends of the earth:

content: 9 Thou shalt shepherd them with a sceptre of iron,— As a potter’s vessel shalt thou dash them in pieces.
content_old: 9 Thou shalt shepherd them with a sceptre of iron,— As a potter’s vessel shalt thou dash them in pieces.

content: 10 Now therefore､ ye kings､ shew your prudence, Be admonished､ ye judges of earth:
content_old: 10 Now therefore､ ye kings､ shew your prudence, Be admonished､ ye judges of earth:

content: 11 Serve Yahweh with reverence, And exult with trembling:
content_old: 11 Serve Yahweh with reverence, And exult with trembling:

content: A Melody of David, when he fled from before Absolom his son.
content_old: A Melody of David, when he fled from before Absolom his son.

content: 1 Yahweh! how have mine adversaries multiplied, Multitudes are rising against me;
content_old: 1 Yahweh! how have mine adversaries multiplied, Multitudes are rising against me;

content: 2 Multitudes are saying of my soul,— No salvation for him in God. Selah.
content_old: 2 Multitudes are saying of my soul,— No salvation for him in God. Selah.

content: 3 But thou､ Yahweh art a shield about me, My glory､ and the lifter up of my head.
content_old: 3 But thou､ Yahweh art a shield about me, My glory､ and the lifter up of my head.

content: 4 With my voice—unto Yahweh do I cry, And he hath answered me out of his holy mountain. Selah.
content_old: 4 With my voice—unto Yahweh do I cry, And he hath answered me out of his holy mountain. Selah.

content: 5 I laid me down and slept,—I awoke, Surely Yahweh sustaineth me!
content_old: 5 I laid me down and slept,—I awoke, Surely Yahweh sustaineth me!

content: 6 I will not be afraid of myriads of people, Who round about have set themselves against me.
content_old: 6 I will not be afraid of myriads of people, Who round about have set themselves against me.

content: 7 Rise! Yahweh､ Save me､ my God. Surely thou hast smitten all my foes on the cheekbone, The teeth of the lawless hast thou broken.
content_old: 7 Rise! Yahweh､ Save me､ my God. Surely thou hast smitten all my foes on the cheekbone, The teeth of the lawless hast thou broken.

content: To the Chief Musician: with stringed instruments. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician: with stringed instruments. A Melody of David.

content: 1 When I cry answer me､ O mine own righteous God, In a strait place thou hast made room for me, Shew me favour､ and hear my prayer.
content_old: 1 When I cry answer me､ O mine own righteous God, In a strait place thou hast made room for me, Shew me favour､ and hear my prayer.

content: 2 Ye sons of the great! how long､ turning my glory to contempt､ Will ye love emptiness, will ye seek falsehood? Selah.
content_old: 2 Ye sons of the great! how long､ turning my glory to contempt､ Will ye love emptiness, will ye seek falsehood? Selah.

content: 3 Know ye､ then､ that Yahweh hath set apart the man of lovingkindness for himself: Yahweh will hear､ when I cry to him.
content_old: 3 Know ye､ then､ that Yahweh hath set apart the man of lovingkindness for himself: Yahweh will hear､ when I cry to him.

content: 4 Be deeply moved､ but do not sin,— Ponder in your own heart upon your bed､ and be silent. Selah.
content_old: 4 Be deeply moved､ but do not sin,— Ponder in your own heart upon your bed､ and be silent. Selah.

content: 5 Sacrifice the sacrifices of righteousness; And put your trust in Yahweh.
content_old: 5 Sacrifice the sacrifices of righteousness; And put your trust in Yahweh.

content: 6 Multitudes are saying､ Who will shew us prosperity? Lift thou upon us the light of thy countenance､ O Yahweh.
content_old: 6 Multitudes are saying､ Who will shew us prosperity? Lift thou upon us the light of thy countenance､ O Yahweh.

content: 7 Thou hast put gladness in my heart,— Beyond the season when their corn and their new wine have increased.
content_old: 7 Thou hast put gladness in my heart,— Beyond the season when their corn and their new wine have increased.

content: To the Chief Musician. For the Flutes. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. For the Flutes. A Melody of David.

content: 1 To my words give ear､ O Yahweh, Understand thou my softly murmured prayer:
content_old: 1 To my words give ear､ O Yahweh, Understand thou my softly murmured prayer:

content: 2 Attend to the voice of my cry､ my King and my God, For unto thee do I pray.
content_old: 2 Attend to the voice of my cry､ my King and my God, For unto thee do I pray.

content: 3 O Yahweh! in the morning shalt thou hear my voice, In the morning will I set in order unto thee､ and keep watch;
content_old: 3 O Yahweh! in the morning shalt thou hear my voice, In the morning will I set in order unto thee､ and keep watch;

content: 4 For not a GOD finding pleasure in lawlessness art thou, And wrong can be no guest of thine:
content_old: 4 For not a GOD finding pleasure in lawlessness art thou, And wrong can be no guest of thine:

content: 5 Boasters shall not station themselves before thine eyes,— Thou hatest all workers of iniquity:
content_old: 5 Boasters shall not station themselves before thine eyes,— Thou hatest all workers of iniquity:

content: 6 Thou wilt destroy them who speak falsehood,— The man of bloodshed and of deceit Yahweh abhorreth.
content_old: 6 Thou wilt destroy them who speak falsehood,— The man of bloodshed and of deceit Yahweh abhorreth.

content: 7 But I in the abounding of thy lovingkindness will enter thy house, I will bow down towards thy holy temple､ in reverence of thee.
content_old: 7 But I in the abounding of thy lovingkindness will enter thy house, I will bow down towards thy holy temple､ in reverence of thee.

content: 8 O Yahweh! lead me in thy righteousness､ because of mine adversaries, Make even､ before me､ thy way:
content_old: 8 O Yahweh! lead me in thy righteousness､ because of mine adversaries, Make even､ before me､ thy way:

content: 9 For in his mouth is nothing worthy of trust, Their inward purpose is engulphing ruin,— An opened sepulchre is their throat, With their tongue speak they smooth things.
content_old: 9 For in his mouth is nothing worthy of trust, Their inward purpose is engulphing ruin,— An opened sepulchre is their throat, With their tongue speak they smooth things.

content: 10 Declare them guilty､ O God､ Let them fall by their own counsels,— Into the throng of their own transgressions thrust them down, For they have rebelled against thee:—
content_old: 10 Declare them guilty､ O God､ Let them fall by their own counsels,— Into the throng of their own transgressions thrust them down, For they have rebelled against thee:—

content: 11 That all may rejoice who seek refuge in thee, To times age-abiding may shout in triumph､ that thou wilt protect them, And they may leap for joy in thee who are lovers of thy Name.
content_old: 11 That all may rejoice who seek refuge in thee, To times age-abiding may shout in triumph､ that thou wilt protect them, And they may leap for joy in thee who are lovers of thy Name.

content: To the Chief Musician, with stringed Instruments upon the eighth. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician, with stringed Instruments upon the eighth. A Melody of David.

content: 1 O Yahweh! do not in thine anger correct me, Nor in thy wrath chastise me.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh! do not in thine anger correct me, Nor in thy wrath chastise me.

content: 2 Shew me favour､ O Yahweh, for languishing am I: Heal me､ O Yahweh,—for dismayed are my bones:
content_old: 2 Shew me favour､ O Yahweh, for languishing am I: Heal me､ O Yahweh,—for dismayed are my bones:

content: 3 Yea my soul is dismayed greatly, Thou､ then､ O Yahweh—how long?
content_old: 3 Yea my soul is dismayed greatly, Thou､ then､ O Yahweh—how long?

content: 4 Return､ O Yahweh､ deliver my soul, Save me､ for the sake of thy lovingkindness;
content_old: 4 Return､ O Yahweh､ deliver my soul, Save me､ for the sake of thy lovingkindness;

content: 5 For in death is no remembrance of thee,— In hades who shall give thanks unto thee?
content_old: 5 For in death is no remembrance of thee,— In hades who shall give thanks unto thee?

content: 6 I am weary with my sighing､ I flood､ through the whole night､ my couch,— With my tears I cause my bed to dissolve:
content_old: 6 I am weary with my sighing､ I flood､ through the whole night､ my couch,— With my tears I cause my bed to dissolve:

content: 7 My face is all sunken with sorrow,— It hath aged､ because of all mine adversaries.
content_old: 7 My face is all sunken with sorrow,— It hath aged､ because of all mine adversaries.

content: 8 Depart from me､ all ye workers of iniquity, For Yahweh hath heard the voice of my weeping:
content_old: 8 Depart from me､ all ye workers of iniquity, For Yahweh hath heard the voice of my weeping:

content: 9 Yahweh hath heard my supplication, Yahweh will receive my prayer.
content_old: 9 Yahweh hath heard my supplication, Yahweh will receive my prayer.

content: An Ode of David: which he sang unto Yahweh, on account of the words of Cush the Benjamite.
content_old: An Ode of David: which he sang unto Yahweh, on account of the words of Cush the Benjamite.

content: 1 O Yahweh my God､ in thee have I sought refuge,— Save me from all my pursuers､ and deliver me:
content_old: 1 O Yahweh my God､ in thee have I sought refuge,— Save me from all my pursuers､ and deliver me:

content: 2 Lest one tear､ as a lion､ my soul,— And there be no deliverer to rescue.
content_old: 2 Lest one tear､ as a lion､ my soul,— And there be no deliverer to rescue.

content: 3 O Yahweh my God If I have done this, If there hath been perversity in my hands:
content_old: 3 O Yahweh my God If I have done this, If there hath been perversity in my hands:

content: 4 If I have requited my friend with wrong,— Or have oppressed mine adversary without need
content_old: 4 If I have requited my friend with wrong,— Or have oppressed mine adversary without need

content: 5 Let an enemy pursue my soul､ and overtake it, That he may tread down､ to the earth､ my life,— And mine honour—in the dust he may cause to dwell Selah.
content_old: 5 Let an enemy pursue my soul､ and overtake it, That he may tread down､ to the earth､ my life,— And mine honour—in the dust he may cause to dwell Selah.

content: 6 Rise! Yahweh! in thine anger､ Lift thyself up､ because of the haughty outbursts of mine adversaries, Stir up for me the justice thou hast commanded:
content_old: 6 Rise! Yahweh! in thine anger､ Lift thyself up､ because of the haughty outbursts of mine adversaries, Stir up for me the justice thou hast commanded:

content: 7 When the assembly of peoples gather round thee Then above it—on high do thou return!
content_old: 7 When the assembly of peoples gather round thee Then above it—on high do thou return!

content: 8 Yahweh will judge the peoples,— Do me justice､ O Yahweh, According to my righteousness､ And according to mine integrity upon me,
content_old: 8 Yahweh will judge the peoples,— Do me justice､ O Yahweh, According to my righteousness､ And according to mine integrity upon me,

content: 9 Let the wrong of the lawless､ I pray thee､ come to an end, And establish thou him that is righteous,— For a trier of hearts and reins is God the righteous one.
content_old: 9 Let the wrong of the lawless､ I pray thee､ come to an end, And establish thou him that is righteous,— For a trier of hearts and reins is God the righteous one.

content: 10 My shield is held by God, Who is ready to save the upright in heart:
content_old: 10 My shield is held by God, Who is ready to save the upright in heart:

content: 11 A God to vindicate the righteous,— And yet a GOD to be indignant throughout every day.
content_old: 11 A God to vindicate the righteous,— And yet a GOD to be indignant throughout every day.

content: 12 If he turn not his sword will he whet,— His bow hath he bent､ and made ready:
content_old: 12 If he turn not his sword will he whet,— His bow hath he bent､ and made ready:

content: 13 But for himself hath he made ready the weapons so deadly, His arrows he so fiery would make:
content_old: 13 But for himself hath he made ready the weapons so deadly, His arrows he so fiery would make:

content: 14 Lo! he gendereth trouble, And conceiveth mischief､ But giveth birth to a disappointment:
content_old: 14 Lo! he gendereth trouble, And conceiveth mischief､ But giveth birth to a disappointment:

content: 15 A pit he cut out､ and digged it, And then fell into the ditch he had made:
content_old: 15 A pit he cut out､ and digged it, And then fell into the ditch he had made:

content: 16 His mischief turneth back on his own head,— And on his own crown his violence descendeth.
content_old: 16 His mischief turneth back on his own head,— And on his own crown his violence descendeth.

content: To the Chief Musician On “the Gittith.” A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician On “the Gittith.” A Melody of David.

content: 1 O Yahweh､ our Lord! How majestic is thy Name､ in all the earth, Who hast set thy splendour upon the heavens.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh､ our Lord! How majestic is thy Name､ in all the earth, Who hast set thy splendour upon the heavens.

content: 2 Out of the mouth of children and sucklings hast thou laid a foundation of strength,— Because of thine adversaries, To make foe and avenger be still.
content_old: 2 Out of the mouth of children and sucklings hast thou laid a foundation of strength,— Because of thine adversaries, To make foe and avenger be still.

content: 3 When I view thy heavens､ the work､ of thy fingers, Moon and stars､ which thou hast established
content_old: 3 When I view thy heavens､ the work､ of thy fingers, Moon and stars､ which thou hast established

content: 4 What was weak man､ that thou shouldst make mention of him? Or the son of the earthborn､ that thou shouldst set him in charge?
content_old: 4 What was weak man､ that thou shouldst make mention of him? Or the son of the earthborn､ that thou shouldst set him in charge?

content: 5 That thou shouldst make him little less than messengers of God, With glory and honour shouldst crown him?
content_old: 5 That thou shouldst make him little less than messengers of God, With glory and honour shouldst crown him?

content: 6 Shouldst give him dominion over the works of thy hands,— All things shouldst have put under his feet:
content_old: 6 Shouldst give him dominion over the works of thy hands,— All things shouldst have put under his feet:

content: 7 Sheep and oxen､ all of them,— Yea even the beasts of the field;
content_old: 7 Sheep and oxen､ all of them,— Yea even the beasts of the field;

content: 8 The bird of the heavens､ and the fishes of the sea,— The passer-by on the paths of the seas?
content_old: 8 The bird of the heavens､ and the fishes of the sea,— The passer-by on the paths of the seas?

content: To the Chief Musician. On “Muthlabben.” A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On “Muthlabben.” A Melody of David.

content: 1 I will praise Yahweh with all my heart, I will recount all thy wonderful doings:
content_old: 1 I will praise Yahweh with all my heart, I will recount all thy wonderful doings:

content: 2 I will rejoice and exult in thee, I will praise in song､ thy Name､ O most High.
content_old: 2 I will rejoice and exult in thee, I will praise in song､ thy Name､ O most High.

content: 3 When mine enemies turned back They stumbled and perished from before thee;
content_old: 3 When mine enemies turned back They stumbled and perished from before thee;

content: 4 For thou hast executed my right and my cause, Thou hast sat on the throne､ judging righteously:
content_old: 4 For thou hast executed my right and my cause, Thou hast sat on the throne､ judging righteously:

content: 5 Thou hast rebuked the nations､ Thou hast destroyed the lawless one, Their name hast thou wiped out､ to times age-abiding and beyond.
content_old: 5 Thou hast rebuked the nations､ Thou hast destroyed the lawless one, Their name hast thou wiped out､ to times age-abiding and beyond.

content: 6 O enemy! complete are the desolations､ evermore,— Even cities hast thou uprooted, The memory of them hath perished.
content_old: 6 O enemy! complete are the desolations､ evermore,— Even cities hast thou uprooted, The memory of them hath perished.

content: 7 But Yahweh unto times age-abiding will sit, Ready for judgment is his throne;
content_old: 7 But Yahweh unto times age-abiding will sit, Ready for judgment is his throne;

content: 8 And he will judge the world in righteousness, He will minister judgment to peoples､ in uprightness.
content_old: 8 And he will judge the world in righteousness, He will minister judgment to peoples､ in uprightness.

content: 9 Thus be Yahweh a refuge for the crushed one, A refuge for times of destitution:
content_old: 9 Thus be Yahweh a refuge for the crushed one, A refuge for times of destitution:

content: 10 Thus let them who know thy Name put confidence in thee, That thou hast not forsaken the searchers for thee､ O Yahweh.
content_old: 10 Thus let them who know thy Name put confidence in thee, That thou hast not forsaken the searchers for thee､ O Yahweh.

content: 11 Sing ye praise to Yahweh､ who is seated in Zion, Tell among the peoples his doings.
content_old: 11 Sing ye praise to Yahweh､ who is seated in Zion, Tell among the peoples his doings.

content: 12 When he was making inquisition for blood Of them had he remembrance, He forgat not the outcry of the oppressed.
content_old: 12 When he was making inquisition for blood Of them had he remembrance, He forgat not the outcry of the oppressed.

content: 13 Shew me favour､ O Yahweh! Behold my humiliation due to them who hate me, Lift me on high out of the gates of death;
content_old: 13 Shew me favour､ O Yahweh! Behold my humiliation due to them who hate me, Lift me on high out of the gates of death;

content: 14 That I may recount all thy praises, In the gates of the daughter of Zion may exult in thy salvation.
content_old: 14 That I may recount all thy praises, In the gates of the daughter of Zion may exult in thy salvation.

content: 15 The nations have sunk in the pit they had made, In the net which they had hidden is caught their own foot.
content_old: 15 The nations have sunk in the pit they had made, In the net which they had hidden is caught their own foot.

content: 16 To be known is Yahweh by the sentence he hath executed, By the doing of his own hands is he about to strike down the lawless one. Resounding music. Selah.
content_old: 16 To be known is Yahweh by the sentence he hath executed, By the doing of his own hands is he about to strike down the lawless one. Resounding music. Selah.

content: 17 The lawless shall return to hades, All nations forgetful of God.
content_old: 17 The lawless shall return to hades, All nations forgetful of God.

content: 18 For not always shall the needy be forgotten,— Nor the hope of the oppressed perish for ever.
content_old: 18 For not always shall the needy be forgotten,— Nor the hope of the oppressed perish for ever.

content: 19 Rise! Yahweh! let man not prevail, Let the nations be judged before thee.
content_old: 19 Rise! Yahweh! let man not prevail, Let the nations be judged before thee.

content: 1 Wherefore､ O Yahweh､ shouldst thou stand afar off? Wherefore hide thyself､ in times of destitution?
content_old: 1 Wherefore､ O Yahweh､ shouldst thou stand afar off? Wherefore hide thyself､ in times of destitution?

content: 2 In the pride of the lawless one he hotly pursueth the poor, Let them be caught in the plots which they have devised!
content_old: 2 In the pride of the lawless one he hotly pursueth the poor, Let them be caught in the plots which they have devised!

content: 3 For the lawless one hath boasted over the longing of his soul, And the robber hath blasphemed Yahweh.
content_old: 3 For the lawless one hath boasted over the longing of his soul, And the robber hath blasphemed Yahweh.

content: 4 The lawless one in the loftiness of his countenance will not enquire, God is not in any of his plots:
content_old: 4 The lawless one in the loftiness of his countenance will not enquire, God is not in any of his plots:

content: 5 His ways are firm at all times､ On high are thy righteous regulations､ out of his sight, As for all his adversaries he puffeth at them:
content_old: 5 His ways are firm at all times､ On high are thy righteous regulations､ out of his sight, As for all his adversaries he puffeth at them:

content: 6 He hath said in his heart､ I shall not be shaken,— From generation to generation shall I be in no misfortune.
content_old: 6 He hath said in his heart､ I shall not be shaken,— From generation to generation shall I be in no misfortune.

content: 7 With cursing his mouth is full､ and with deceptions and oppression, Under his tongue are trouble and mischief:
content_old: 7 With cursing his mouth is full､ and with deceptions and oppression, Under his tongue are trouble and mischief:

content: 8 He abideth in the lurking-place of villages､ In the hiding-places he murdereth the innocent,— His eyes for the unfortunate are on the watch:
content_old: 8 He abideth in the lurking-place of villages､ In the hiding-places he murdereth the innocent,— His eyes for the unfortunate are on the watch:

content: 9 He lieth in wait in a hiding-place､ like a lion in his covert､ He lieth in wait to catch the humbled, He catcheth the humbled､ by drawing him into his net:
content_old: 9 He lieth in wait in a hiding-place､ like a lion in his covert､ He lieth in wait to catch the humbled, He catcheth the humbled､ by drawing him into his net:

content: 10 He croucheth､ he lieth down, Then falleth he with his strong claws upon the unfortunate.
content_old: 10 He croucheth､ he lieth down, Then falleth he with his strong claws upon the unfortunate.

content: 11 He hath said in his heart､ GOD hath forgotten,— He hath veiled his face､ Oh he hath never seen!
content_old: 11 He hath said in his heart､ GOD hath forgotten,— He hath veiled his face､ Oh he hath never seen!

content: 12 Arise! Yahweh! O GOD! raise thy hand,— Do not forget the patient!
content_old: 12 Arise! Yahweh! O GOD! raise thy hand,— Do not forget the patient!

content: 13 Wherefore hath the lawless one blasphemed God? He hath said in his heart､ Thou wilt not require it!
content_old: 13 Wherefore hath the lawless one blasphemed God? He hath said in his heart､ Thou wilt not require it!

content: 14 Thou hast seen! For thou mischief and misery dost discern, To requite with thine own hand, Unto thee doth the unfortunate one give himself up､ To the fatherless thou thyself hast become a helper.
content_old: 14 Thou hast seen! For thou mischief and misery dost discern, To requite with thine own hand, Unto thee doth the unfortunate one give himself up､ To the fatherless thou thyself hast become a helper.

content: 15 Shatter thou the arm of the lawless one, And as for the wrongful wilt thou not enquire for his lawlessness—wilt thou not find it?
content_old: 15 Shatter thou the arm of the lawless one, And as for the wrongful wilt thou not enquire for his lawlessness—wilt thou not find it?

content: 16 Yahweh is king､ to times age-abiding and beyond, The nations have perished out of his land.
content_old: 16 Yahweh is king､ to times age-abiding and beyond, The nations have perished out of his land.

content: 17 The longing of the patient thou hast heard､ O Yahweh, Thou wilt establish their heart､ Thou wilt make attentive thine ear:
content_old: 17 The longing of the patient thou hast heard､ O Yahweh, Thou wilt establish their heart､ Thou wilt make attentive thine ear:

content: To the Chief Musician. David’s.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. David’s.

content: 1 In Yahweh have I sought refuge､ How can ye say to my soul, Flee to a mountain､ like a little bird;
content_old: 1 In Yahweh have I sought refuge､ How can ye say to my soul, Flee to a mountain､ like a little bird;

content: 2 For lo! the lawless bend the bow､ They have fixed their arrow upon the string, To shoot､ in the darkness､ at the upright in heart:
content_old: 2 For lo! the lawless bend the bow､ They have fixed their arrow upon the string, To shoot､ in the darkness､ at the upright in heart:

content: 3 When the pillars are overthrown What could a righteous man do?
content_old: 3 When the pillars are overthrown What could a righteous man do?

content: 4 Yahweh is in his holy temple､ As for Yahweh in the heavens is his throne, His eyes behold— His eyelashes test the sons of men.
content_old: 4 Yahweh is in his holy temple､ As for Yahweh in the heavens is his throne, His eyes behold— His eyelashes test the sons of men.

content: 5 Yahweh putteth the righteous to the test,— But the lawless one and the lover of violence his soul doth hate.
content_old: 5 Yahweh putteth the righteous to the test,— But the lawless one and the lover of violence his soul doth hate.

content: 6 He will rain､ upon the lawless､ live-coals,— Fire and brimstone､ and a burning wind are the portion of their cup.
content_old: 6 He will rain､ upon the lawless､ live-coals,— Fire and brimstone､ and a burning wind are the portion of their cup.

content: To the Chief Musician. On the Octave. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On the Octave. A Melody of David.

content: 1 O save､ Yahweh､ For the man of lovingkindness is no more, For the faithful have vanished from among the sons of men.
content_old: 1 O save､ Yahweh､ For the man of lovingkindness is no more, For the faithful have vanished from among the sons of men.

content: 2 Deception speak they､ every one with his neighbour,— With lips uttering smooth things—with a heart and a heart do they speak.
content_old: 2 Deception speak they､ every one with his neighbour,— With lips uttering smooth things—with a heart and a heart do they speak.

content: 3 May Yahweh cut off All the lips that utter smooth things,— The tongue that speaketh swelling words;
content_old: 3 May Yahweh cut off All the lips that utter smooth things,— The tongue that speaketh swelling words;

content: 4 Them who say— With our tongue will we prevail Our lips are our own, Who is our master?
content_old: 4 Them who say— With our tongue will we prevail Our lips are our own, Who is our master?

content: 5 Because of violence done to the poor､ Because of the crying of the needy Now will I arise! O may Yahweh say,— I will place him in safety—let him puff at him!
content_old: 5 Because of violence done to the poor､ Because of the crying of the needy Now will I arise! O may Yahweh say,— I will place him in safety—let him puff at him!

content: 6 The words of Yahweh are words, that are pure, Silver refined in a crucible of earth､ Purified seven times!
content_old: 6 The words of Yahweh are words, that are pure, Silver refined in a crucible of earth､ Purified seven times!

content: 7 Thou､ O Yahweh wilt keep them,— Thou wilt guard him, from this generation unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 7 Thou､ O Yahweh wilt keep them,— Thou wilt guard him, from this generation unto times age-abiding.

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.

content: 1 How long, O Yahweh､ wilt thou wholly forget me? How long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
content_old: 1 How long, O Yahweh､ wilt thou wholly forget me? How long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

content: 2 How long shall I lay up cares within my soul､ Sorrow in my heart､ day by day? How long shall mine enemy lift himself up over me?
content_old: 2 How long shall I lay up cares within my soul､ Sorrow in my heart､ day by day? How long shall mine enemy lift himself up over me?

content: 3 Have regard! answer me､ O Yahweh my God,— Light up mine eyes､ lest I sleep on into death:
content_old: 3 Have regard! answer me､ O Yahweh my God,— Light up mine eyes､ lest I sleep on into death:

content: 4 Lest mine enemy say I have prevailed over him! And mine adversaries exult､ that I totter.
content_old: 4 Lest mine enemy say I have prevailed over him! And mine adversaries exult､ that I totter.

content: 5 But I in thy lovingkindness have put my trust､ My heart shall exult in thy salvation:
content_old: 5 But I in thy lovingkindness have put my trust､ My heart shall exult in thy salvation:

content: To the Chief Musician. David s.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. David s.

content: 1 The impious hath said in his heart— There is no God! They have acted corruptly､ They have done an abominable deed, There is none that doeth good.
content_old: 1 The impious hath said in his heart— There is no God! They have acted corruptly､ They have done an abominable deed, There is none that doeth good.

content: 2 Yahweh out of the heavens looked down over the sons of men,— To see whether there was one that shewed wisdom, Enquiring after God:—
content_old: 2 Yahweh out of the heavens looked down over the sons of men,— To see whether there was one that shewed wisdom, Enquiring after God:—

content: 3 The whole have turned aside, Together have they become tainted,— There is none that doeth good, Not so much as one!
content_old: 3 The whole have turned aside, Together have they become tainted,— There is none that doeth good, Not so much as one!

content: 4 Are all the workers of iniquity without knowledge? Devouring my people､ as they devour food! Upon Yahweh have they not called.
content_old: 4 Are all the workers of iniquity without knowledge? Devouring my people､ as they devour food! Upon Yahweh have they not called.

content: 5 There have they been in great dread, Because God is in the circle of the righteous man.
content_old: 5 There have they been in great dread, Because God is in the circle of the righteous man.

content: 6 The purpose of the poor ye would put to shame, Because Yahweh is his refuge.
content_old: 6 The purpose of the poor ye would put to shame, Because Yahweh is his refuge.

content: A Melody of David.
content_old: A Melody of David.

content: 1 O Yahweh! Who shall be a guest in thy tent? Who shall abide in thy holy mountain?
content_old: 1 O Yahweh! Who shall be a guest in thy tent? Who shall abide in thy holy mountain?

content: 2 He that walketh without blame､ And doeth what is right, And speaketh truth with his heart;
content_old: 2 He that walketh without blame､ And doeth what is right, And speaketh truth with his heart;

content: 3 Hath not carried slander on his tongue､ Hath not done his friend a wrong, Nor a reproach taken up against his neighbour;
content_old: 3 Hath not carried slander on his tongue､ Hath not done his friend a wrong, Nor a reproach taken up against his neighbour;

content: 4 Despised in his sight is the reprobate､ But them who revere Yahweh he doth honour, He hath sworn to his neighbour､ and will not change;
content_old: 4 Despised in his sight is the reprobate､ But them who revere Yahweh he doth honour, He hath sworn to his neighbour､ and will not change;

content: A Precious Psalm of David.
content_old: A Precious Psalm of David.

content: 1 Preserve me､ O GOD For I have sought refuge in thee.
content_old: 1 Preserve me､ O GOD For I have sought refuge in thee.

content: 2 Thou hast said unto Yahweh､ My Lord art thou! My goodness mounteth not unto thee.
content_old: 2 Thou hast said unto Yahweh､ My Lord art thou! My goodness mounteth not unto thee.

content: 3 It belongeth unto the holy ones､ Whom in his own land Yahweh ennobleth, In whom is all his delight.
content_old: 3 It belongeth unto the holy ones､ Whom in his own land Yahweh ennobleth, In whom is all his delight.

content: 4 They multiply their idols､—another have they purchased! I will not pour out their drink-offerings of blood, Nor will I take up their names on my lips.
content_old: 4 They multiply their idols､—another have they purchased! I will not pour out their drink-offerings of blood, Nor will I take up their names on my lips.

content: 5 Yahweh is mine allotted portion and my cup, Thou art maintaining my lot.
content_old: 5 Yahweh is mine allotted portion and my cup, Thou art maintaining my lot.

content: 6 The lines have fallen unto me､ in pleasant places, Verily an inheritance that delighteth me.
content_old: 6 The lines have fallen unto me､ in pleasant places, Verily an inheritance that delighteth me.

content: 7 I will bless Yahweh､ who hath counselled me,— Surely by night shall mine impulses admonish me.
content_old: 7 I will bless Yahweh､ who hath counselled me,— Surely by night shall mine impulses admonish me.

content: 8 I have set Yahweh before me continually, Because he is on my right hand I shall not be shaken!
content_old: 8 I have set Yahweh before me continually, Because he is on my right hand I shall not be shaken!

content: 9 Therefore hath my heart rejoiced､ And mine honour exulted, Yea my flesh shall settle down securely;
content_old: 9 Therefore hath my heart rejoiced､ And mine honour exulted, Yea my flesh shall settle down securely;

content: 10 For thou wilt not abandon my soul to hades, Neither wilt thou suffer thy man of loving､ kindness､ to see corruption:
content_old: 10 For thou wilt not abandon my soul to hades, Neither wilt thou suffer thy man of loving､ kindness､ to see corruption:

content: A Prayer of David.
content_old: A Prayer of David.

content: 1 Hear､ O Yahweh､ the right､ Attend to my loud cry､ Give ear unto my prayer, On lips that would not deceive:
content_old: 1 Hear､ O Yahweh､ the right､ Attend to my loud cry､ Give ear unto my prayer, On lips that would not deceive:

content: 2 From before thee let my sentence come forth, Thine eyes behold with equity.
content_old: 2 From before thee let my sentence come forth, Thine eyes behold with equity.

content: 3 Thou hast tested my heart､ Hast made inspection by night､ Hast refined me until thou couldst find nothing, Had I devised evil my mouth should not have transgressed:
content_old: 3 Thou hast tested my heart､ Hast made inspection by night､ Hast refined me until thou couldst find nothing, Had I devised evil my mouth should not have transgressed:

content: 4 As for the workings of men By the word of thy lips have I taken heed of the paths of the violent one.
content_old: 4 As for the workings of men By the word of thy lips have I taken heed of the paths of the violent one.

content: 5 Thou hast held fast my goings on to thy ways, My footsteps have not been shaken:
content_old: 5 Thou hast held fast my goings on to thy ways, My footsteps have not been shaken:

content: 6 I have called upon thee､ for thou wilt answer me､ O GOD,— Incline thine ear unto me､ Hear thou my speech:
content_old: 6 I have called upon thee､ for thou wilt answer me､ O GOD,— Incline thine ear unto me､ Hear thou my speech:

content: 7 Let thy lovingkindness be distinguished､ thou Saviour of such as seek refuge From them who lift themselves up against thy right hand.
content_old: 7 Let thy lovingkindness be distinguished､ thou Saviour of such as seek refuge From them who lift themselves up against thy right hand.

content: 8 Guard me､ as the pupil of the eye,— Under the shadow of thy wings wilt thou hide me:
content_old: 8 Guard me､ as the pupil of the eye,— Under the shadow of thy wings wilt thou hide me:

content: 9 From the face of lawless ones who have treated me with violence, The foes of my soul､ who come round against me:
content_old: 9 From the face of lawless ones who have treated me with violence, The foes of my soul､ who come round against me:

content: 10 Their own fat heart have they shut up,— With their mouth have they spoken proudly.
content_old: 10 Their own fat heart have they shut up,— With their mouth have they spoken proudly.

content: 11 As for our own goings now have they surrounded us,— Their eyes they fix､ bending to the earth:
content_old: 11 As for our own goings now have they surrounded us,— Their eyes they fix､ bending to the earth:

content: 12 His likeness is as a lion､ that longeth to rend, And as a young lion､ lurking in secret places.
content_old: 12 His likeness is as a lion､ that longeth to rend, And as a young lion､ lurking in secret places.

content: 13 Rise､ Yahweh! Confront his face､ Bring him down, Deliver my soul from the lawless one who is thy sword:
content_old: 13 Rise､ Yahweh! Confront his face､ Bring him down, Deliver my soul from the lawless one who is thy sword:

content: 14 From men who are thy hand､ O Yahweh､ From the men of this age､ Whose portion is among the living､ And with thy treasure thou fillest their bosom,— They must be satisfied with sons, And must leave their abundance to their children:—
content_old: 14 From men who are thy hand､ O Yahweh､ From the men of this age､ Whose portion is among the living､ And with thy treasure thou fillest their bosom,— They must be satisfied with sons, And must leave their abundance to their children:—

content: To the chief Musician. Of the servant of Yahweh､ of David,—who spake unto Yahweh the words of this song,—in the day when Yahweh had rescued him out of the hand of all his enemies､ and out of the hand of Saul; and he said:—
content_old: To the chief Musician. Of the servant of Yahweh､ of David,—who spake unto Yahweh the words of this song,—in the day when Yahweh had rescued him out of the hand of all his enemies､ and out of the hand of Saul; and he said:—

content: 1 I will love thee､ O Yahweh my strength!
content_old: 1 I will love thee､ O Yahweh my strength!

content: 2 Yahweh was my mountain crag and my stronghold､ and my deliverer: My GOD was my rock, I sought refuge in him, My shield､ and my horn of salvation､ my high tower.
content_old: 2 Yahweh was my mountain crag and my stronghold､ and my deliverer: My GOD was my rock, I sought refuge in him, My shield､ and my horn of salvation､ my high tower.

content: 3 As one worthy to be praised called I on Yahweh,— And from my foes was I saved.
content_old: 3 As one worthy to be praised called I on Yahweh,— And from my foes was I saved.

content: 4 The meshes of death encompassed me, The torrents of perdition made me afraid;
content_old: 4 The meshes of death encompassed me, The torrents of perdition made me afraid;

content: 5 The meshes of hades had surrounded me, The snares of death had confronted me,
content_old: 5 The meshes of hades had surrounded me, The snares of death had confronted me,

content: 6 In my distress called I on Yahweh､ And unto my God made outcry for help, He heard､ out of his temple､ my voice, And my outcry for help came before him—entered into his ears!
content_old: 6 In my distress called I on Yahweh､ And unto my God made outcry for help, He heard､ out of his temple､ my voice, And my outcry for help came before him—entered into his ears!

content: 7 Then did the earth shake and quake, Even the foundations of the mountains were deeply moved, Yea they did shake､ because he was angry.
content_old: 7 Then did the earth shake and quake, Even the foundations of the mountains were deeply moved, Yea they did shake､ because he was angry.

content: 8 There went up a smoke in his nostrils､ And a fire out of his mouth devoured, Live coals were kindled from it:
content_old: 8 There went up a smoke in his nostrils､ And a fire out of his mouth devoured, Live coals were kindled from it:

content: 9 Then he stretched out the heavens, and came down,— And thick gloom was under his feet;
content_old: 9 Then he stretched out the heavens, and came down,— And thick gloom was under his feet;

content: 10 Then he rode on a cherub､ and flew, And darted on the wings of the wind;
content_old: 10 Then he rode on a cherub､ and flew, And darted on the wings of the wind;

content: 11 Made darkness his hiding-place､ Round about him—his pavilion, Darkness of waters､ clouds of vapours.
content_old: 11 Made darkness his hiding-place､ Round about him—his pavilion, Darkness of waters､ clouds of vapours.

content: 12 Out of the brightness before him his clouds rolled along, Hail､ and live coals of fire.
content_old: 12 Out of the brightness before him his clouds rolled along, Hail､ and live coals of fire.

content: 13 Then did Yahweh thunder in the heavens､ And the Highest uttered his voice,— Hail､ and live coals of fire.
content_old: 13 Then did Yahweh thunder in the heavens､ And the Highest uttered his voice,— Hail､ and live coals of fire.

content: 14 And he sent forth his arrows and scattered them, Yea lightnings he shot out, and confused them.
content_old: 14 And he sent forth his arrows and scattered them, Yea lightnings he shot out, and confused them.

content: 15 Then appeared the channels of waters､ Were uncovered the foundations of the world,— At thy rebuke､ O Yahweh, At the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.
content_old: 15 Then appeared the channels of waters､ Were uncovered the foundations of the world,— At thy rebuke､ O Yahweh, At the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.

content: 16 He sent from on high､ he took me,�� He drew me out of many waters.
content_old: 16 He sent from on high､ he took me,�� He drew me out of many waters.

content: 17 He rescued me from my foe､ in his might､ And from them who hated me, because they were too strong for me:
content_old: 17 He rescued me from my foe､ in his might､ And from them who hated me, because they were too strong for me:

content: 18 They confronted me､ in the day of my necessity, Then became Yahweh my stay:
content_old: 18 They confronted me､ in the day of my necessity, Then became Yahweh my stay:

content: 19 And brought me out, into a large place, He delivered me, because he delighted in me.
content_old: 19 And brought me out, into a large place, He delivered me, because he delighted in me.

content: 20 Yahweh rewarded me according to my righteousness, According to the cleanness of my hands he repaid me;
content_old: 20 Yahweh rewarded me according to my righteousness, According to the cleanness of my hands he repaid me;

content: 21 For I had kept the ways of Yahweh, And not broken away from my God;
content_old: 21 For I had kept the ways of Yahweh, And not broken away from my God;

content: 22 For all his regulations were before me, And his statutes did I not put from me:
content_old: 22 For all his regulations were before me, And his statutes did I not put from me:

content: 23 So became I blameless with him, And kept myself from mine iniquity.
content_old: 23 So became I blameless with him, And kept myself from mine iniquity.

content: 24 Yahweh therefore repaid me according to my righteousness, According to the pureness of my hands､ before his eyes.
content_old: 24 Yahweh therefore repaid me according to my righteousness, According to the pureness of my hands､ before his eyes.

content: 25 With the loving thou didst shew thyself loving,— With the blameless man thou didst shew thyself blameless;
content_old: 25 With the loving thou didst shew thyself loving,— With the blameless man thou didst shew thyself blameless;

content: 26 With the pure thou didst shew thyself pure, But with the perverse thou didst shew thyself ready to contend.
content_old: 26 With the pure thou didst shew thyself pure, But with the perverse thou didst shew thyself ready to contend.

content: 27 For as for thee an oppressed people thou didst save, But looks that were lofty layedst thou low;
content_old: 27 For as for thee an oppressed people thou didst save, But looks that were lofty layedst thou low;

content: 28 For thou didst light up my lamp, Yahweh my God enlightened my darkness;
content_old: 28 For thou didst light up my lamp, Yahweh my God enlightened my darkness;

content: 29 For by thee I ran through a troop, And by my God I leapt over a wall.
content_old: 29 For by thee I ran through a troop, And by my God I leapt over a wall.

content: 30 As for GOD blameless is his way, The speech of Yahweh hath been proved, A shield he is to all who seek refuge in him.
content_old: 30 As for GOD blameless is his way, The speech of Yahweh hath been proved, A shield he is to all who seek refuge in him.

content: 31 For who is a God, save Yahweh? And who is a Rock, save our God?
content_old: 31 For who is a God, save Yahweh? And who is a Rock, save our God?

content: 32 The GOD who girded me with strength, And set forth､ as blameless､ my way:
content_old: 32 The GOD who girded me with strength, And set forth､ as blameless､ my way:

content: 33 Planting my feet like hinds’ feet, Yea on my high places he caused me to stand:
content_old: 33 Planting my feet like hinds’ feet, Yea on my high places he caused me to stand:

content: 34 Teaching my hands to war,— So that a bow of bronze was bent by mine arms.
content_old: 34 Teaching my hands to war,— So that a bow of bronze was bent by mine arms.

content: 35 Thus didst thou grant me､ as a shield､ thy salvation,— And thy right hand sustained me, And thy condescension made me great.
content_old: 35 Thus didst thou grant me､ as a shield､ thy salvation,— And thy right hand sustained me, And thy condescension made me great.

content: 36 Thou didst widen my stepping-places under me, So that mine ankles faltered not.
content_old: 36 Thou didst widen my stepping-places under me, So that mine ankles faltered not.

content: 37 I pursued my foes､ and overtook them, And returned not､ till they were consumed:
content_old: 37 I pursued my foes､ and overtook them, And returned not､ till they were consumed:

content: 38 I crushed them, and they were unable to rise, They fell under my feet.
content_old: 38 I crushed them, and they were unable to rise, They fell under my feet.

content: 39 Thus didst thou gird me with strength､ for the battle, Thou subduedst mine assailants under me.
content_old: 39 Thus didst thou gird me with strength､ for the battle, Thou subduedst mine assailants under me.

content: 40 As for my foes thou didst give me their neck, And as for them who hated me I destroyed them.
content_old: 40 As for my foes thou didst give me their neck, And as for them who hated me I destroyed them.

content: 41 They cried out､ But there was none to save, Unto Yahweh､ But he answered them not.
content_old: 41 They cried out､ But there was none to save, Unto Yahweh､ But he answered them not.

content: 42 Then did I beat them in pieces､ like dust on the face of the wind. Like the mire in the lanes did I scatter them.
content_old: 42 Then did I beat them in pieces､ like dust on the face of the wind. Like the mire in the lanes did I scatter them.

content: 43 Thus didst thou rescue me from the contentions of a people,— Didst appoint me to be the head of nations, A people I had not known served me:
content_old: 43 Thus didst thou rescue me from the contentions of a people,— Didst appoint me to be the head of nations, A people I had not known served me:

content: 44 At the hearing of the ear they submitted to me, The sons of the foreigner came cringing unto me:
content_old: 44 At the hearing of the ear they submitted to me, The sons of the foreigner came cringing unto me:

content: 45 The sons of the foreigner lost heart, And came quaking out of their fortresses.
content_old: 45 The sons of the foreigner lost heart, And came quaking out of their fortresses.

content: 46 Yahweh liveth and blessed be my Rock, Yea exalted be the God of my salvation:
content_old: 46 Yahweh liveth and blessed be my Rock, Yea exalted be the God of my salvation:

content: 47 The GOD, who hath avenged me,— And subjugated peoples under me:
content_old: 47 The GOD, who hath avenged me,— And subjugated peoples under me:

content: 48 Who hath delivered me from my foes,— Yea from mine assailants hast thou set me on high, From the man of violence hast thou rescued me.
content_old: 48 Who hath delivered me from my foes,— Yea from mine assailants hast thou set me on high, From the man of violence hast thou rescued me.

content: 49 For this cause will I praise thee among the nations､ O Yahweh, And to thy Name will I sweep the strings:—
content_old: 49 For this cause will I praise thee among the nations､ O Yahweh, And to thy Name will I sweep the strings:—

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.

content: 1 The heavens are telling the glory of GOD, And the work of his hands the expanse is declaring;
content_old: 1 The heavens are telling the glory of GOD, And the work of his hands the expanse is declaring;

content: 2 Day unto day doth pour forth speech, And night unto night doth breathe out knowledge.
content_old: 2 Day unto day doth pour forth speech, And night unto night doth breathe out knowledge.

content: 3 There is no speech, and there are no words,—Unheard is their voice!
content_old: 3 There is no speech, and there are no words,—Unheard is their voice!

content: 4 Yet through all the earth hath gone forth their voice,— And to the end of the world their sayings,— For the sun hath he set up a tent therein;
content_old: 4 Yet through all the earth hath gone forth their voice,— And to the end of the world their sayings,— For the sun hath he set up a tent therein;

content: 5 And he is like a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, He rejoiceth as a hero to run a race:
content_old: 5 And he is like a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, He rejoiceth as a hero to run a race:

content: 6 From one end of the heavens is his going forth, And his circuit to the other end thereof,— And nothing is hid from his glowing heat.
content_old: 6 From one end of the heavens is his going forth, And his circuit to the other end thereof,— And nothing is hid from his glowing heat.

content: 7 The law of Yahweh is complete､ Bringing back the soul, The testimony of Yahweh is confirmed､ Making wise the simple;
content_old: 7 The law of Yahweh is complete､ Bringing back the soul, The testimony of Yahweh is confirmed､ Making wise the simple;

content: 8 The precepts of Yahweh are right, Rejoicing the heart, The commandment of Yahweh is pure､ Enlightening the eyes;
content_old: 8 The precepts of Yahweh are right, Rejoicing the heart, The commandment of Yahweh is pure､ Enlightening the eyes;

content: 9 The reverence of Yahweh is clean, Enduring evermore,— The decisions of Yahweh are faithful, They are righteous altogether:
content_old: 9 The reverence of Yahweh is clean, Enduring evermore,— The decisions of Yahweh are faithful, They are righteous altogether:

content: 10 More desirable than gold､ Yea than much fine gold, Sweeter also than honey､ Or than droppings from the comb.
content_old: 10 More desirable than gold､ Yea than much fine gold, Sweeter also than honey､ Or than droppings from the comb.

content: 11 Even thine own servant taketh warning by them, In the keeping of them great is the reward.
content_old: 11 Even thine own servant taketh warning by them, In the keeping of them great is the reward.

content: 12 Mistakes who perceiveth? From things that are hidden acquit me:
content_old: 12 Mistakes who perceiveth? From things that are hidden acquit me:

content: 13 Even from the presumptuous keep back thy servant､ May they not have dominion over me､ Then shall I be blameless, And shall be acquitted from great transgression:
content_old: 13 Even from the presumptuous keep back thy servant､ May they not have dominion over me､ Then shall I be blameless, And shall be acquitted from great transgression:

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.

content: 1 Yahweh answer thee､ in the day of distress, The Name of the God of Jacob give thee safety;
content_old: 1 Yahweh answer thee､ in the day of distress, The Name of the God of Jacob give thee safety;

content: 2 Send thy help out of the sanctuary, And out of Zion sustain thee;
content_old: 2 Send thy help out of the sanctuary, And out of Zion sustain thee;

content: 3 Remember every present of thine, And thine ascending-sacrifice esteem. Selah.
content_old: 3 Remember every present of thine, And thine ascending-sacrifice esteem. Selah.

content: 4 Give thee according to thy heart, And all thy purposes fulfil.
content_old: 4 Give thee according to thy heart, And all thy purposes fulfil.

content: 5 We will shout aloud in thy salvation､ And in the Name of our God shall we become great, Yahweh fulfil all thy petitions.
content_old: 5 We will shout aloud in thy salvation､ And in the Name of our God shall we become great, Yahweh fulfil all thy petitions.

content: 6 Now do I know that Yahweh hath saved his Anointed One,— He answereth him out of his holy heavens, By the mighty saving deeds of his own right hand.
content_old: 6 Now do I know that Yahweh hath saved his Anointed One,— He answereth him out of his holy heavens, By the mighty saving deeds of his own right hand.

content: 7 These by chariots､ And those by horses, But we by the Name of Yahweh our God Will prevail.
content_old: 7 These by chariots､ And those by horses, But we by the Name of Yahweh our God Will prevail.

content: 8 They have bowed down and fallen, But we have arisen､ and stand upright.
content_old: 8 They have bowed down and fallen, But we have arisen､ and stand upright.

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.

content: 1 O Yahweh､ in thy strength will the king rejoice, And in thy salvation how greatly will he exult!
content_old: 1 O Yahweh､ in thy strength will the king rejoice, And in thy salvation how greatly will he exult!

content: 2 The longing of his heart hast thou given him, And the request of his lips hast thou not withheld. Selah.
content_old: 2 The longing of his heart hast thou given him, And the request of his lips hast thou not withheld. Selah.

content: 3 For thou wilt come to meet him､ with the blessings of goodness, Thou wilt set on his head､ a crown of pure gold.
content_old: 3 For thou wilt come to meet him､ with the blessings of goodness, Thou wilt set on his head､ a crown of pure gold.

content: 4 Life he asked of thee, Thou hast given it him, Length of days､ to times age-abiding and beyond.
content_old: 4 Life he asked of thee, Thou hast given it him, Length of days､ to times age-abiding and beyond.

content: 5 Great is his glory､ in thy salvation, Honour and majesty wilt thou lay upon him;
content_old: 5 Great is his glory､ in thy salvation, Honour and majesty wilt thou lay upon him;

content: 6 For thou wilt appoint him blessings evermore, Wilt cheer him with joy by thy countenance;
content_old: 6 For thou wilt appoint him blessings evermore, Wilt cheer him with joy by thy countenance;

content: 7 For the king is trusting in Yahweh, And in the lovingkindness of the Highest shall he not be shaken.
content_old: 7 For the king is trusting in Yahweh, And in the lovingkindness of the Highest shall he not be shaken.

content: 8 Thy hand will find out all thy foes, Thine own right hand will find out them who hate thee.
content_old: 8 Thy hand will find out all thy foes, Thine own right hand will find out them who hate thee.

content: 9 Thou wilt make them like a furnace of fire､ at the time of thy presence,— Yahweh in his anger will swallow them up, And there shall consume them a fire:
content_old: 9 Thou wilt make them like a furnace of fire､ at the time of thy presence,— Yahweh in his anger will swallow them up, And there shall consume them a fire:

content: 10 Their fruit—out of the earth wilt thou destroy, And their seed､ from among the sons of men;
content_old: 10 Their fruit—out of the earth wilt thou destroy, And their seed､ from among the sons of men;

content: 11 For they have held out､ against thee､ a wicked thing, They have devised a scheme they cannot accomplish.
content_old: 11 For they have held out､ against thee､ a wicked thing, They have devised a scheme they cannot accomplish.

content: 12 For thou wilt cause them to turn their back, Upon thy bow-strings wilt thou make ready against their face.
content_old: 12 For thou wilt cause them to turn their back, Upon thy bow-strings wilt thou make ready against their face.

content: To the Chief Musician. On “the Hind of the Dawn.” A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On “the Hind of the Dawn.” A Melody of David.

content: 1 My GOD､ my GOD, why hast thou forsaken me? Far from saving me､ The words of my loud lamentation?
content_old: 1 My GOD､ my GOD, why hast thou forsaken me? Far from saving me､ The words of my loud lamentation?

content: 2 My God! I keep crying— By day and thou dost not answer, and By night and there is no rest for me.
content_old: 2 My God! I keep crying— By day and thou dost not answer, and By night and there is no rest for me.

content: 3 But thou art holy, Who inhabitest the praises of Israel.
content_old: 3 But thou art holy, Who inhabitest the praises of Israel.

content: 4 In thee trusted our fathers, They trusted, and thou didst deliver them;
content_old: 4 In thee trusted our fathers, They trusted, and thou didst deliver them;

content: 5 Unto thee made they outcry､ and escaped, In thee they trusted､ and had not turned pale.
content_old: 5 Unto thee made they outcry､ and escaped, In thee they trusted､ and had not turned pale.

content: 6 But I am a worm and no one, A reproach of men､ and despised of a people;
content_old: 6 But I am a worm and no one, A reproach of men､ and despised of a people;

content: 7 All that see me laugh at me,— They open wide the mouth, They shake the head:—
content_old: 7 All that see me laugh at me,— They open wide the mouth, They shake the head:—

content: 8 He should trust in Yahweh—let him deliver him,— Let him rescue him､ seeing he delighteth in him.
content_old: 8 He should trust in Yahweh—let him deliver him,— Let him rescue him､ seeing he delighteth in him.

content: 9 For thou art he that severed me from the womb, He that caused me to trust､ upon the breasts of my mother;
content_old: 9 For thou art he that severed me from the womb, He that caused me to trust､ upon the breasts of my mother;

content: 10 Upon thee was I cast from the time I was born, From the womb of my mother my GOD hast thou been.
content_old: 10 Upon thee was I cast from the time I was born, From the womb of my mother my GOD hast thou been.

content: 11 Be not far from me､ for distress is near, For there is none to help.
content_old: 11 Be not far from me､ for distress is near, For there is none to help.

content: 12 Many bulls have surrounded me, Strong oxen of Bashan have enclosed me;
content_old: 12 Many bulls have surrounded me, Strong oxen of Bashan have enclosed me;

content: 13 They have opened wide against me their mouth, A lion rending and roaring.
content_old: 13 They have opened wide against me their mouth, A lion rending and roaring.

content: 14 Like water am I poured out､ And put out of joint are all my bones,— My heart hath become like wax, It is melted in the midst of my body;
content_old: 14 Like water am I poured out､ And put out of joint are all my bones,— My heart hath become like wax, It is melted in the midst of my body;

content: 15 Dried as a potsherd is my strength, And my tongue is made to cleave to my gums, And in the dust of death wilt thou lay me.
content_old: 15 Dried as a potsherd is my strength, And my tongue is made to cleave to my gums, And in the dust of death wilt thou lay me.

content: 16 For dogs have surrounded me,— An assembly of evil doers have encircled me, They have pierced my hands and my feet,
content_old: 16 For dogs have surrounded me,— An assembly of evil doers have encircled me, They have pierced my hands and my feet,

content: 17 I may tell all my bones, They look for—they behold me!
content_old: 17 I may tell all my bones, They look for—they behold me!

content: 18 They part my garments among them, And for my vestment they cast lots.
content_old: 18 They part my garments among them, And for my vestment they cast lots.

content: 19 But thou､ O Yahweh be not far off, O my help! to aid me make haste;
content_old: 19 But thou､ O Yahweh be not far off, O my help! to aid me make haste;

content: 20 Rescue from the sword my life, From the power of the dog my solitary self:
content_old: 20 Rescue from the sword my life, From the power of the dog my solitary self:

content: 21 Save me from the mouth of the lion,— Yea from the horns of wild beasts hast thou delivered me.
content_old: 21 Save me from the mouth of the lion,— Yea from the horns of wild beasts hast thou delivered me.

content: 22 I will declare thy Name unto my brethren,—In the midst of the convocation will I praise thee.
content_old: 22 I will declare thy Name unto my brethren,—In the midst of the convocation will I praise thee.

content: 23 Ye that revere Yahweh praise him､ All ye the seed of Jacob glorify him, And stand in awe of him､ all ye seed of Israel.
content_old: 23 Ye that revere Yahweh praise him､ All ye the seed of Jacob glorify him, And stand in awe of him､ all ye seed of Israel.

content: 24 For he hath not despised nor abhorred the humbling of the patient one､ Neither hath he hid his face from him, But when he cried for help unto him he heard.
content_old: 24 For he hath not despised nor abhorred the humbling of the patient one､ Neither hath he hid his face from him, But when he cried for help unto him he heard.

content: 25 Of thee is my praise in the great convocation, My vows will I pay､ before them who revere him.
content_old: 25 Of thee is my praise in the great convocation, My vows will I pay､ before them who revere him.

content: 26 The patient wronged-ones shall eat and be satisfied､ They shall praise Yahweh who are seekers of him, Let your heart live for aye.
content_old: 26 The patient wronged-ones shall eat and be satisfied､ They shall praise Yahweh who are seekers of him, Let your heart live for aye.

content: 27 All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to Yahweh, Yea all the families of the nations will bow themselves down before thee,
content_old: 27 All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to Yahweh, Yea all the families of the nations will bow themselves down before thee,

content: 28 For to Yahweh belongeth the kingdom, And One to Rule over the nations.
content_old: 28 For to Yahweh belongeth the kingdom, And One to Rule over the nations.

content: 29 All the great ones of the earth shall eat and bow down､ Before him shall kneel all that go down to the dust, Even he who had not kept alive his own soul!
content_old: 29 All the great ones of the earth shall eat and bow down､ Before him shall kneel all that go down to the dust, Even he who had not kept alive his own soul!

content: 30 My seed shall serve him, It shall be recounted､ of the Lord､ to a generation that shall come:
content_old: 30 My seed shall serve him, It shall be recounted､ of the Lord､ to a generation that shall come:

content: A Melody of David.
content_old: A Melody of David.

content: 1 Yahweh is my shepherd—I shall not want:
content_old: 1 Yahweh is my shepherd—I shall not want:

content: 2 In pastures of tender grass he maketh me lie down, Unto restful waters he leadeth me;
content_old: 2 In pastures of tender grass he maketh me lie down, Unto restful waters he leadeth me;

content: 3 My life he restoreth, He guideth me in right paths､ for the sake of his Name.
content_old: 3 My life he restoreth, He guideth me in right paths､ for the sake of his Name.

content: 4 Yea､ though I walk through a valley death-shadowed I will fear no harm､ for thou art with me, Thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.
content_old: 4 Yea､ though I walk through a valley death-shadowed I will fear no harm､ for thou art with me, Thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

content: 5 Thou spreadest before me a table､ in face of mine adversaries, Thou hast anointed､ with oil､ my head, My cup hath run over.
content_old: 5 Thou spreadest before me a table､ in face of mine adversaries, Thou hast anointed､ with oil､ my head, My cup hath run over.

content: David’s. A Melody.
content_old: David’s. A Melody.

content: 1 To Yahweh belongeth The earth and the fulness thereof, The world､ and they who dwell therein;
content_old: 1 To Yahweh belongeth The earth and the fulness thereof, The world､ and they who dwell therein;

content: 2 For he upon the seas hath founded it, And upon the currents doth make it firm.
content_old: 2 For he upon the seas hath founded it, And upon the currents doth make it firm.

content: 3 Who shall ascend the mountain of Yahweh? And who shall stand in his holy place?
content_old: 3 Who shall ascend the mountain of Yahweh? And who shall stand in his holy place?

content: 4 The clean of hands､ And pure of heart,— Who hath not uplifted､ to falsehood､ his soul. Nor sworn deceitfully
content_old: 4 The clean of hands､ And pure of heart,— Who hath not uplifted､ to falsehood､ his soul. Nor sworn deceitfully

content: 5 Shall bear away a blessing from Yahweh, And righteousness､ from his delivering God.
content_old: 5 Shall bear away a blessing from Yahweh, And righteousness､ from his delivering God.

content: 6 This is the generation of them who inquire of him, Who seek thy face､ O God of Jacob. Selah.
content_old: 6 This is the generation of them who inquire of him, Who seek thy face､ O God of Jacob. Selah.

content: 7 Lift up､ O ye gates､ your heads, And lift yourselves up､ ye age-abiding doors, That the king of glory may come in.
content_old: 7 Lift up､ O ye gates､ your heads, And lift yourselves up､ ye age-abiding doors, That the king of glory may come in.

content: 8 Who is the king of glory? Yahweh､ strong and mighty, Yahweh､ mighty in war.
content_old: 8 Who is the king of glory? Yahweh､ strong and mighty, Yahweh､ mighty in war.

content: 9 Lift up､ O ye gates､ your heads､ Yea lift them up､ ye age-abiding doors, That the king of glory may come in.
content_old: 9 Lift up､ O ye gates､ your heads､ Yea lift them up､ ye age-abiding doors, That the king of glory may come in.

content: David’s. An Alphabetical Psalm.
content_old: David’s. An Alphabetical Psalm.

content: 1 Unto thee O Yahweh, my soul would I lift:
content_old: 1 Unto thee O Yahweh, my soul would I lift:

content: 2 O my God､ in thee have I put my trust, Let me not be put to shame, Let not my foe exult over me:
content_old: 2 O my God､ in thee have I put my trust, Let me not be put to shame, Let not my foe exult over me:

content: 3 Yea let none who wait for thee be put to shame, Let them be put to shame who act covertly without cause!
content_old: 3 Yea let none who wait for thee be put to shame, Let them be put to shame who act covertly without cause!

content: 4 Thy ways O Yahweh､ let me know, Thy paths teach thou me:
content_old: 4 Thy ways O Yahweh､ let me know, Thy paths teach thou me:

content: 5 Guide me into thy truth and teach me､ For thou art my delivering God, For thee have I waited all the day:
content_old: 5 Guide me into thy truth and teach me､ For thou art my delivering God, For thee have I waited all the day:

content: 6 Remember thy compassions､ O Yahweh､ and thy lovingkindnesses, For from age-past times have they been.
content_old: 6 Remember thy compassions､ O Yahweh､ and thy lovingkindnesses, For from age-past times have they been.

content: 7 The sins of my youth､ and my transgressions do not thou call to mind,— According to thine own lovingkindness remember thou me, For the sake of thine own goodness､ O Yahweh,
content_old: 7 The sins of my youth､ and my transgressions do not thou call to mind,— According to thine own lovingkindness remember thou me, For the sake of thine own goodness､ O Yahweh,

content: 8 Good and upright is Yahweh, For this cause will he direct sinners into the way.
content_old: 8 Good and upright is Yahweh, For this cause will he direct sinners into the way.

content: 9 May he guide patient wronged-ones to be righted, And teach such oppressed-ones his way.
content_old: 9 May he guide patient wronged-ones to be righted, And teach such oppressed-ones his way.

content: 10 All the paths of Yahweh are lovingkindness and faithfulness, To such as keep his covenant､ and his testimonies.
content_old: 10 All the paths of Yahweh are lovingkindness and faithfulness, To such as keep his covenant､ and his testimonies.

content: 11 For the sake of thy Name O Yahweh, Therefore wilt thou pardon mine iniquity､ For great it is.
content_old: 11 For the sake of thy Name O Yahweh, Therefore wilt thou pardon mine iniquity､ For great it is.

content: 12 Who then is the man that revereth Yahweh? Let him direct him into the way he should choose.
content_old: 12 Who then is the man that revereth Yahweh? Let him direct him into the way he should choose.

content: 13 His soul with prosperity shall tarry, And his seed shall possess the land.
content_old: 13 His soul with prosperity shall tarry, And his seed shall possess the land.

content: 14 Intimacy with Yahweh have they who revere him, His covenant also he letteth them know.
content_old: 14 Intimacy with Yahweh have they who revere him, His covenant also he letteth them know.

content: 15 Mine eyes are continually unto Yahweh,— For he bringeth､ out of the net､ my feet.
content_old: 15 Mine eyes are continually unto Yahweh,— For he bringeth､ out of the net､ my feet.

content: 16 Turn thou unto me, and shew me favour, For alone and oppressed I am.
content_old: 16 Turn thou unto me, and shew me favour, For alone and oppressed I am.

content: 17 The distresses of my heart hath he relieved,— And out of my straits brought me forth.
content_old: 17 The distresses of my heart hath he relieved,— And out of my straits brought me forth.

content: 18 Behold my humiliation and my pain, And take away all my sins.
content_old: 18 Behold my humiliation and my pain, And take away all my sins.

content: 19 Behold my foes､ for they abound,— And with the hatred of violence do they hate me.
content_old: 19 Behold my foes､ for they abound,— And with the hatred of violence do they hate me.

content: 20 Oh keep my soul､ and rescue me, Let me not be put to shame､ for I have sought refuge in thee.
content_old: 20 Oh keep my soul､ and rescue me, Let me not be put to shame､ for I have sought refuge in thee.

content: 21 Let blamelessness and uprightness watch over me, Because I have waited for thee.
content_old: 21 Let blamelessness and uprightness watch over me, Because I have waited for thee.

content: David’s.
content_old: David’s.

content: 1 Do me justice､ O Yahweh､ For I in my blamelessness have walked, And in Yahweh have I trusted､ I will not waver.
content_old: 1 Do me justice､ O Yahweh､ For I in my blamelessness have walked, And in Yahweh have I trusted､ I will not waver.

content: 2 Try me､ O Yahweh､ and prove me, Test my reins and my heart:—
content_old: 2 Try me､ O Yahweh､ and prove me, Test my reins and my heart:—

content: 3 For thy lovingkindness hath been before mine eyes, And I have walked to and fro in thy faithfulness;
content_old: 3 For thy lovingkindness hath been before mine eyes, And I have walked to and fro in thy faithfulness;

content: 4 I have not sat with men of deceit, Nor with dissemblers would I enter;
content_old: 4 I have not sat with men of deceit, Nor with dissemblers would I enter;

content: 5 I have hated the convocation of evil-doers, And with lawless men would I not sit;
content_old: 5 I have hated the convocation of evil-doers, And with lawless men would I not sit;

content: 6 I will bathe､ in pureness､ my hands,— So will I go in procession around thine altar､ O Yahweh;
content_old: 6 I will bathe､ in pureness､ my hands,— So will I go in procession around thine altar､ O Yahweh;

content: 7 To sound aloud a song, And to recount all thy wonderful doings.
content_old: 7 To sound aloud a song, And to recount all thy wonderful doings.

content: 8 O Yahweh､ I have loved the asylum of thy house, Even the place of the habitation of thy glory!
content_old: 8 O Yahweh､ I have loved the asylum of thy house, Even the place of the habitation of thy glory!

content: 9 Do not remove､ with sinners､ my soul, Nor､ with men of bloodshed､ my life;
content_old: 9 Do not remove､ with sinners､ my soul, Nor､ with men of bloodshed､ my life;

content: 10 In whose hands is a plot, And their right hand is filled with a bribe.
content_old: 10 In whose hands is a plot, And their right hand is filled with a bribe.

content: 11 But I in my blamelessness will walk, Redeem me and shew me favour.
content_old: 11 But I in my blamelessness will walk, Redeem me and shew me favour.

content: David’s.
content_old: David’s.

content: 1 Yahweh is my light and my salvation､ Of whom shall I be afraid? Yahweh is the refuge of my life､ Of whom shall I be in dread?
content_old: 1 Yahweh is my light and my salvation､ Of whom shall I be afraid? Yahweh is the refuge of my life､ Of whom shall I be in dread?

content: 2 When there drew near against me evil-doers to devour my flesh Mine adversaries､ and mine enemies—mine!—they stumbled and fell!
content_old: 2 When there drew near against me evil-doers to devour my flesh Mine adversaries､ and mine enemies—mine!—they stumbled and fell!

content: 3 Though there pitch against me—a camp My heart shall not fear,— Though there come up against me—a battle Still am I confident.
content_old: 3 Though there pitch against me—a camp My heart shall not fear,— Though there come up against me—a battle Still am I confident.

content: 4 One thing have I asked of Yahweh､ That will I seek to secure,— That I may dwell in the house of Yahweh､ all the days of my life, To view the delightfulness of Yahweh､ And to contemplate in his temple.
content_old: 4 One thing have I asked of Yahweh､ That will I seek to secure,— That I may dwell in the house of Yahweh､ all the days of my life, To view the delightfulness of Yahweh､ And to contemplate in his temple.

content: 5 For he will hide me in his pavilion､ in the day of calamity,— He will conceal me､ in the secrecy of his tent, Within a rock will he set me on high.
content_old: 5 For he will hide me in his pavilion､ in the day of calamity,— He will conceal me､ in the secrecy of his tent, Within a rock will he set me on high.

content: 6 Now therefore､ shall my head be raised high above my foes round about me､ And I will sacrifice in his tent the sacrifices of triumphant joy, I will sing and touch the strings, to Yahweh.
content_old: 6 Now therefore､ shall my head be raised high above my foes round about me､ And I will sacrifice in his tent the sacrifices of triumphant joy, I will sing and touch the strings, to Yahweh.

content: 7 Hear､ O Yahweh With my voice do I cry, Oh then shew me favour and answer me.
content_old: 7 Hear､ O Yahweh With my voice do I cry, Oh then shew me favour and answer me.

content: 8 To thee said my heart— When thou saidst Seek ye my face— Thy face O Yahweh､ will I seek!
content_old: 8 To thee said my heart— When thou saidst Seek ye my face— Thy face O Yahweh､ will I seek!

content: 9 Do not hide thy face from me､ Do not repulse､ in thine anger､ thine own servant,— My help thou hast been, Do not send me away nor forsake me､ O my saving God!
content_old: 9 Do not hide thy face from me､ Do not repulse､ in thine anger､ thine own servant,— My help thou hast been, Do not send me away nor forsake me､ O my saving God!

content: 10 When my own father and mother had forsaken me Then Yahweh took me up!
content_old: 10 When my own father and mother had forsaken me Then Yahweh took me up!

content: 11 Point out to me､ O Yahweh, thy way,— And guide me in a level path, Because of mine adversaries.
content_old: 11 Point out to me､ O Yahweh, thy way,— And guide me in a level path, Because of mine adversaries.

content: 12 Do not give me up unto the desire of mine adversaries, For there have risen up against me Witnesses that are false､ And he that fanneth up violence.
content_old: 12 Do not give me up unto the desire of mine adversaries, For there have risen up against me Witnesses that are false､ And he that fanneth up violence.

content: 13 I believe that I shall see— The goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living,
content_old: 13 I believe that I shall see— The goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living,

content: David’s.
content_old: David’s.

content: 1 Unto thee､ O Yahweh do I cry､ O my Rock! do not turn in silence from me,—Lest if thou turn from me in silence I be like them who go down into the pit.
content_old: 1 Unto thee､ O Yahweh do I cry､ O my Rock! do not turn in silence from me,—Lest if thou turn from me in silence I be like them who go down into the pit.

content: 2 Hear the voice of my supplication､ When I cry to thee for help, When I lift up my hands toward thy holy shrine.
content_old: 2 Hear the voice of my supplication､ When I cry to thee for help, When I lift up my hands toward thy holy shrine.

content: 3 Do not drag me away— With the lawless､ Or with the workers of iniquity,— Who speak peaceably with their neighbours, But wrong is in their heart.
content_old: 3 Do not drag me away— With the lawless､ Or with the workers of iniquity,— Who speak peaceably with their neighbours, But wrong is in their heart.

content: 4 Give them According to their deed, and According to the wrong of their practices,— According to the work of their own hands give thou unto them, Bring back their own dealing to themselves.
