content_old: 4 Give them According to their deed, and According to the wrong of their practices,— According to the work of their own hands give thou unto them, Bring back their own dealing to themselves.

content: 5 Because they heed not The Deeds of Yahweh, Or the Work of his hands He will pull them down､ and not build them.
content_old: 5 Because they heed not The Deeds of Yahweh, Or the Work of his hands He will pull them down､ and not build them.

content: 6 Blessed be Yahweh, Because he hath heard the voice of my supplication.
content_old: 6 Blessed be Yahweh, Because he hath heard the voice of my supplication.

content: 7 Yahweh is my strength and my shield､ In him hath trusted my heart､ and I have found help,— Therefore hath my heart danced for joy, And with my song do I praise him.
content_old: 7 Yahweh is my strength and my shield､ In him hath trusted my heart､ and I have found help,— Therefore hath my heart danced for joy, And with my song do I praise him.

content: 8 Yahweh is strength to his people,— And the all-saving refuge of his Anointed One is he!
content_old: 8 Yahweh is strength to his people,— And the all-saving refuge of his Anointed One is he!

content: A Melody of David.
content_old: A Melody of David.

content: 1 Give to Yahweh､ ye sons of the mighty,— Give to Yahweh､ both glory and strength:
content_old: 1 Give to Yahweh､ ye sons of the mighty,— Give to Yahweh､ both glory and strength:

content: 2 Give to Yahweh､ the glory of his Name, Bow down to Yahweh､ in the adornment of holiness.
content_old: 2 Give to Yahweh､ the glory of his Name, Bow down to Yahweh､ in the adornment of holiness.

content: 3 The voice of Yahweh is upon the waters,— The GOD of glory hath thundered, Yahweh is upon mighty waters;
content_old: 3 The voice of Yahweh is upon the waters,— The GOD of glory hath thundered, Yahweh is upon mighty waters;

content: 4 The voice of Yahweh is with power, The voice of Yahweh is with majesty;
content_old: 4 The voice of Yahweh is with power, The voice of Yahweh is with majesty;

content: 5 The voice of Yahweh is breaking cedars, Now hath Yahweh broken down the cedars of Lebanon!
content_old: 5 The voice of Yahweh is breaking cedars, Now hath Yahweh broken down the cedars of Lebanon!

content: 6 And hath made them leap like a calf, Lebanon and Sirion､ like the bull-calf of wild-oxen;
content_old: 6 And hath made them leap like a calf, Lebanon and Sirion､ like the bull-calf of wild-oxen;

content: 7 The voice of Yahweh is cleaving out flames of fire;
content_old: 7 The voice of Yahweh is cleaving out flames of fire;

content: 8 The voice of Yahweh bringeth birth pains upon the wilderness; Yahweh bringeth birth-pains upon the wilderness of Kadesh!
content_old: 8 The voice of Yahweh bringeth birth pains upon the wilderness; Yahweh bringeth birth-pains upon the wilderness of Kadesh!

content: 9 The voice of Yahweh causeth the gazelles to bring forth､ And hath stript forests; And in his own temple every one there is saying Glory!
content_old: 9 The voice of Yahweh causeth the gazelles to bring forth､ And hath stript forests; And in his own temple every one there is saying Glory!

content: 10 Yahweh at the Flood was seated, And Yahweh hath taken his seat､ as king､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 10 Yahweh at the Flood was seated, And Yahweh hath taken his seat､ as king､ unto times age-abiding.

content: A Melody. A Song for the Dedication of the House. David’s.
content_old: A Melody. A Song for the Dedication of the House. David’s.

content: 1 I will extol thee､ O Yahweh, For thou hast drawn me up,— And not suffered my foes to rejoice over me.
content_old: 1 I will extol thee､ O Yahweh, For thou hast drawn me up,— And not suffered my foes to rejoice over me.

content: 2 O Yahweh､ my God, I cried for help unto thee, And thou hast healed me.
content_old: 2 O Yahweh､ my God, I cried for help unto thee, And thou hast healed me.

content: 3 O Yahweh! thou hast lifted､ out of hades､ my soul, Thou hast brought me back to life､ from among those who were going down to the pit.
content_old: 3 O Yahweh! thou hast lifted､ out of hades､ my soul, Thou hast brought me back to life､ from among those who were going down to the pit.

content: 4 Sweep the strings to Yahweh､ Ye his men of lovingkindness, And give ye praise at the mention of his holiness.
content_old: 4 Sweep the strings to Yahweh､ Ye his men of lovingkindness, And give ye praise at the mention of his holiness.

content: 5 For there is a Moment in his anger､ a Life-time in his good-pleasure, In the evening cometh Weeping to lodge､ But by the morning ’tis a Shout of Triumph!
content_old: 5 For there is a Moment in his anger､ a Life-time in his good-pleasure, In the evening cometh Weeping to lodge､ But by the morning ’tis a Shout of Triumph!

content: 6 But I said､ in my tranquillity, I shall not be shaken to times age-abiding!
content_old: 6 But I said､ in my tranquillity, I shall not be shaken to times age-abiding!

content: 7 O Yahweh in thy good-pleasure hadst thou caused my mountain to stand strong,— Thou didst hide thy face—I was dismayed!
content_old: 7 O Yahweh in thy good-pleasure hadst thou caused my mountain to stand strong,— Thou didst hide thy face—I was dismayed!

content: 8 Unto thee､ O Yahweh do I cry,— And unto My Lord do I make supplication:
content_old: 8 Unto thee､ O Yahweh do I cry,— And unto My Lord do I make supplication:

content: 9 What profit in my blood? In my going down into the pit? Can dust praise thee? Can it declare thy faithfulness?
content_old: 9 What profit in my blood? In my going down into the pit? Can dust praise thee? Can it declare thy faithfulness?

content: 10 Hear､ O Yahweh､ and shew me favour, O Yahweh! become thou a helper unto me.
content_old: 10 Hear､ O Yahweh､ and shew me favour, O Yahweh! become thou a helper unto me.

content: 11 Thou hast turned my lamentation､ into a dance for me,— Thou hast torn off my sackcloth, And girded me with gladness:
content_old: 11 Thou hast turned my lamentation､ into a dance for me,— Thou hast torn off my sackcloth, And girded me with gladness:

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.

content: 1 In thee O Yahweh､ have I sought refuge, Let me not be ashamed､ to times age-abiding, In thy righteousness deliver me:
content_old: 1 In thee O Yahweh､ have I sought refuge, Let me not be ashamed､ to times age-abiding, In thy righteousness deliver me:

content: 2 Incline unto me､ thine ear, Speedily rescue me,— Become to me a Rock of refuge, a Place of security, For saving me.
content_old: 2 Incline unto me､ thine ear, Speedily rescue me,— Become to me a Rock of refuge, a Place of security, For saving me.

content: 3 Because my mountain crag and my strong-hold thou art Therefore for the sake of thine own Name wilt thou lead me and guide me?
content_old: 3 Because my mountain crag and my strong-hold thou art Therefore for the sake of thine own Name wilt thou lead me and guide me?

content: 4 Wilt thou bring me forth､ out of the net which they have hidden for me? For thou art my refuge.
content_old: 4 Wilt thou bring me forth､ out of the net which they have hidden for me? For thou art my refuge.

content: 5 Into thy hand do I commit my spirit— Thou hast ransomed me､ O Yahweh､ GOD most faithful.
content_old: 5 Into thy hand do I commit my spirit— Thou hast ransomed me､ O Yahweh､ GOD most faithful.

content: 6 I hate such as give heed to false vanities, I then､ in Yahweh have set my hope.
content_old: 6 I hate such as give heed to false vanities, I then､ in Yahweh have set my hope.

content: 7 I will indeed exult and rejoice､ in thy loving-kindness,— In that thou hast looked upon my humiliation, Thou hast taken note that in distresses was my life;
content_old: 7 I will indeed exult and rejoice､ in thy loving-kindness,— In that thou hast looked upon my humiliation, Thou hast taken note that in distresses was my life;

content: 8 And hast not shut me up in the hand of the foe, Thou hast given standing､ in a roomy place､ unto my feet.
content_old: 8 And hast not shut me up in the hand of the foe, Thou hast given standing､ in a roomy place､ unto my feet.

content: 9 Shew me favour､ O Yahweh､ for in distress am I,— Wasted with vexation is mine eye—my soul and my body;
content_old: 9 Shew me favour､ O Yahweh､ for in distress am I,— Wasted with vexation is mine eye—my soul and my body;

content: 10 For consumed with sorrow is my life､ And my years with sighing,— My strength hath staggered with my humiliation, And my bones are without marrow.
content_old: 10 For consumed with sorrow is my life､ And my years with sighing,— My strength hath staggered with my humiliation, And my bones are without marrow.

content: 11 By reason of all mine adversaries have I become a reproach､ Even to my neighbours altogether､ And a dread to mine acquaintances,— They who have seen me abroad have fled from me:
content_old: 11 By reason of all mine adversaries have I become a reproach､ Even to my neighbours altogether､ And a dread to mine acquaintances,— They who have seen me abroad have fled from me:

content: 12 I have been forgotten､ like one dead—out of mind, I have been as a missing vessel.
content_old: 12 I have been forgotten､ like one dead—out of mind, I have been as a missing vessel.

content: 13 For I have heard the whispering of many— A terror round about! When they have sat in conclave together against me To take away my life have they intrigued.
content_old: 13 For I have heard the whispering of many— A terror round about! When they have sat in conclave together against me To take away my life have they intrigued.

content: 14 I therefore in thee have put my trust､ o Yahweh, I have said My God thou art!
content_old: 14 I therefore in thee have put my trust､ o Yahweh, I have said My God thou art!

content: 15 In thy hand are my times, Rescue me from the hand of my foes and from my pursuers!
content_old: 15 In thy hand are my times, Rescue me from the hand of my foes and from my pursuers!

content: 16 Cause thy face to shine upon thy servant, Save me in thy lovingkindness.
content_old: 16 Cause thy face to shine upon thy servant, Save me in thy lovingkindness.

content: 17 O Yahweh! let me not be ashamed､ For I have called upon thee, Let the lawless be ashamed､ Go down in silence to hades!
content_old: 17 O Yahweh! let me not be ashamed､ For I have called upon thee, Let the lawless be ashamed､ Go down in silence to hades!

content: 18 Let false lips be made dumb,— Which are speaking—against a righteous one—arrogantly､ With pride and contempt .
content_old: 18 Let false lips be made dumb,— Which are speaking—against a righteous one—arrogantly､ With pride and contempt .

content: 19 How great is thy goodness､ which thou hast hidden away for them who revere thee,— Thou hast wrought for them who seek refuge in thee, In sight of the sons of men.
content_old: 19 How great is thy goodness､ which thou hast hidden away for them who revere thee,— Thou hast wrought for them who seek refuge in thee, In sight of the sons of men.

content: 20 Thou wilt conceal them､ in the secrecy of thine own presence､ from the conspiracies of men,— Thou wilt hide them in a pavilion､ from the strife of tongues.
content_old: 20 Thou wilt conceal them､ in the secrecy of thine own presence､ from the conspiracies of men,— Thou wilt hide them in a pavilion､ from the strife of tongues.

content: 21 Blessed be Yahweh, For he hath made wonderful his lovingkindness for me, in a fortified city.
content_old: 21 Blessed be Yahweh, For he hath made wonderful his lovingkindness for me, in a fortified city.

content: 22 But I had said in mine alarm､ I am cut off from before thine eyes,— But､ indeed thou didst hear the voice of my supplication, When I cried for help unto thee.
content_old: 22 But I had said in mine alarm､ I am cut off from before thine eyes,— But､ indeed thou didst hear the voice of my supplication, When I cried for help unto thee.

content: 23 Love Yahweh､ all ye his men of lovingkindness,—Faithfulness doth Yahweh observe, But repayeth abundantly him that worketh proudly.
content_old: 23 Love Yahweh､ all ye his men of lovingkindness,—Faithfulness doth Yahweh observe, But repayeth abundantly him that worketh proudly.

content: David’s. An Instructive Psalm.
content_old: David’s. An Instructive Psalm.

content: 1 How happy is he Whose transgression is forgiven! Whose sin is pardoned!
content_old: 1 How happy is he Whose transgression is forgiven! Whose sin is pardoned!

content: 2 How happy the son of earth､ To whom Yahweh will not reckon iniquity! And in whose spirit is no guile!
content_old: 2 How happy the son of earth､ To whom Yahweh will not reckon iniquity! And in whose spirit is no guile!

content: 3 When I kept silence my bones became worn out, Through my groaning all the day;
content_old: 3 When I kept silence my bones became worn out, Through my groaning all the day;

content: 4 For day and night heavy upon me was thy hand,— Changed was my life-sap into the drought of summer. Selah.
content_old: 4 For day and night heavy upon me was thy hand,— Changed was my life-sap into the drought of summer. Selah.

content: 5 My sin would I own unto thee､ And mine iniquity not hide､ I said I will confess my transgressions unto Yahweh, And thou didst forgive the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
content_old: 5 My sin would I own unto thee､ And mine iniquity not hide､ I said I will confess my transgressions unto Yahweh, And thou didst forgive the iniquity of my sin. Selah.

content: 6 For this cause will every man of loving kindness pray unto thee､ in time to obtain,— Surely in the overflow of many waters Unto him shall they not reach.
content_old: 6 For this cause will every man of loving kindness pray unto thee､ in time to obtain,— Surely in the overflow of many waters Unto him shall they not reach.

content: 7 Thou art a hiding-place for me､ From distress wilt thou preserve me,— With shouts of deliverance wilt thou compass me about. Selah.
content_old: 7 Thou art a hiding-place for me､ From distress wilt thou preserve me,— With shouts of deliverance wilt thou compass me about. Selah.

content: 8 I will make thee discreet､ I will point out to thee the way which thou must go, I will fix upon thee mine eye.
content_old: 8 I will make thee discreet､ I will point out to thee the way which thou must go, I will fix upon thee mine eye.

content: 9 Do not ye become like a horse､ like a mule､ without discernment,— With the bit and bridle of his mouth hast thou to restrain him,— He will not come near unto thee.
content_old: 9 Do not ye become like a horse､ like a mule､ without discernment,— With the bit and bridle of his mouth hast thou to restrain him,— He will not come near unto thee.

content: 10 Many pains hath the lawless one,— But he that trusteth in Yahweh Lovingkindness shall compass him about.
content_old: 10 Many pains hath the lawless one,— But he that trusteth in Yahweh Lovingkindness shall compass him about.

content: 1 Shout for joy､ ye righteous､ in Yahweh, To the upright seemly is praise.
content_old: 1 Shout for joy､ ye righteous､ in Yahweh, To the upright seemly is praise.

content: 2 Give ye thanks unto Yahweh with the lyre, With a harp of ten strings make ye music unto him.
content_old: 2 Give ye thanks unto Yahweh with the lyre, With a harp of ten strings make ye music unto him.

content: 3 Sing unto him､ a song that is new, With skill sweep the strings､ with loud noise.
content_old: 3 Sing unto him､ a song that is new, With skill sweep the strings､ with loud noise.

content: 4 For right is the word of Yahweh, And all his work is in faithfulness:
content_old: 4 For right is the word of Yahweh, And all his work is in faithfulness:

content: 5 Who loveth righteousness and justice, With the lovingkindness of Yahweh the earth is full.
content_old: 5 Who loveth righteousness and justice, With the lovingkindness of Yahweh the earth is full.

content: 6 By the word of Yahweh the heavens were made, And by the spirit of his mouth all their host:
content_old: 6 By the word of Yahweh the heavens were made, And by the spirit of his mouth all their host:

content: 7 Who gathered as into a skin-bottle the waters of the sea, Delivering､ into treasuries､ the roaring deeps.
content_old: 7 Who gathered as into a skin-bottle the waters of the sea, Delivering､ into treasuries､ the roaring deeps.

content: 8 Let all the earth stand in awe of Yahweh, Of him be in dread､ all ye inhabitants of the world;
content_old: 8 Let all the earth stand in awe of Yahweh, Of him be in dread､ all ye inhabitants of the world;

content: 9 For he spake､ and it was, He commanded, and it stood forth.
content_old: 9 For he spake､ and it was, He commanded, and it stood forth.

content: 10 Yahweh hath frustrated the counsel of nations, hath brought to nothing the devices of peoples.
content_old: 10 Yahweh hath frustrated the counsel of nations, hath brought to nothing the devices of peoples.

content: 11 The counsel of Yahweh to times age-abiding shall stand, The devices of his heart from generation to generation.
content_old: 11 The counsel of Yahweh to times age-abiding shall stand, The devices of his heart from generation to generation.

content: 12 How happy the nation whose God is Yahweh, The people he hath chosen as his own inheritance!
content_old: 12 How happy the nation whose God is Yahweh, The people he hath chosen as his own inheritance!

content: 13 Out of the heavens hath Yahweh looked, He hath seen all the sons of men:
content_old: 13 Out of the heavens hath Yahweh looked, He hath seen all the sons of men:

content: 14 Out of his settled place of abode hath he fixed his gaze On all the inhabitants of the earth:
content_old: 14 Out of his settled place of abode hath he fixed his gaze On all the inhabitants of the earth:

content: 15 Who fashioneth their heart all together, Who understandeth all their doings.
content_old: 15 Who fashioneth their heart all together, Who understandeth all their doings.

content: 16 Not a king can be saved by greatness of force, Nor hero deliver himself by greatness of strength:
content_old: 16 Not a king can be saved by greatness of force, Nor hero deliver himself by greatness of strength:

content: 17 A deception is the horse､ for victory, And by his great strength shall he not deliver.
content_old: 17 A deception is the horse､ for victory, And by his great strength shall he not deliver.

content: 18 Lo! the eye of Yahweh is toward them who revere him, Unto such as are waiting for his lovingkindness:
content_old: 18 Lo! the eye of Yahweh is toward them who revere him, Unto such as are waiting for his lovingkindness:

content: 19 To rescue､ from death､ their soul, And to keep them alive in famine.
content_old: 19 To rescue､ from death､ their soul, And to keep them alive in famine.

content: 20 Our own soul hath waited for Yahweh, Our help and our shield is he!
content_old: 20 Our own soul hath waited for Yahweh, Our help and our shield is he!

content: 21 For in him shall our heart rejoice, For in his holy Name have we trusted.
content_old: 21 For in him shall our heart rejoice, For in his holy Name have we trusted.

content: David’s. When he disguised his sanity before Abimelech,—who dismissed him､ and he departed. An Alphabetical Psalm.
content_old: David’s. When he disguised his sanity before Abimelech,—who dismissed him､ and he departed. An Alphabetical Psalm.

content: 1 Let me bless Yahweh at all times, Continually be his praise in my mouth.
content_old: 1 Let me bless Yahweh at all times, Continually be his praise in my mouth.

content: 2 In Yahweh boasteth my soul, The patient oppressed-ones shall hear and be glad.
content_old: 2 In Yahweh boasteth my soul, The patient oppressed-ones shall hear and be glad.

content: 3 Ascribe ye greatness unto Yahweh with me, And let us exalt his Name together.
content_old: 3 Ascribe ye greatness unto Yahweh with me, And let us exalt his Name together.

content: 4 I enquired of Yahweh､ and he hath answered me, And out of all my terrors hath he rescued me.
content_old: 4 I enquired of Yahweh､ and he hath answered me, And out of all my terrors hath he rescued me.

content: 5 They looked unto him and were radiant, And as for their faces let them not be abashed.
content_old: 5 They looked unto him and were radiant, And as for their faces let them not be abashed.

content: 6 This oppressed one cried, and Yahweh heard,— And out of all his distresses saved him.
content_old: 6 This oppressed one cried, and Yahweh heard,— And out of all his distresses saved him.

content: 7 The messenger of Yahweh encampeth around them who revere him, Thus hath he delivered them.
content_old: 7 The messenger of Yahweh encampeth around them who revere him, Thus hath he delivered them.

content: 8 Oh taste and see､ that good is Yahweh,— How happy the man who seeketh refuge in him!
content_old: 8 Oh taste and see､ that good is Yahweh,— How happy the man who seeketh refuge in him!

content: 9 Revere Yahweh､ ye his holy ones, For there is no want to them who revere him.
content_old: 9 Revere Yahweh､ ye his holy ones, For there is no want to them who revere him.

content: 10 Young lions have come short､ and suffered hunger, But they who seek Yahweh shall not lack any good thing.
content_old: 10 Young lions have come short､ and suffered hunger, But they who seek Yahweh shall not lack any good thing.

content: 11 Come､ ye children! hearken unto me, The reverence of Yahweh will I teach you.
content_old: 11 Come､ ye children! hearken unto me, The reverence of Yahweh will I teach you.

content: 12 Who is the man that desireth life, Loving days, that he may see good?
content_old: 12 Who is the man that desireth life, Loving days, that he may see good?

content: 13 Keep thy tongue from wickedness, And thy lips from speaking deceit:
content_old: 13 Keep thy tongue from wickedness, And thy lips from speaking deceit:

content: 14 Depart from wickedness and do good, Aim at well-being､ and pursue it.
content_old: 14 Depart from wickedness and do good, Aim at well-being､ and pursue it.

content: 15 The eyes of Yahweh are towards the righteous, And his ears､ towards their cry for help:
content_old: 15 The eyes of Yahweh are towards the righteous, And his ears､ towards their cry for help:

content: 16 The face of Yahweh is against such as do wickedness, To cut off､ from the earth､ their memory.
content_old: 16 The face of Yahweh is against such as do wickedness, To cut off､ from the earth､ their memory.

content: 17 They made outcry, and Yahweh heard, And out of all their straits hath he rescued them.
content_old: 17 They made outcry, and Yahweh heard, And out of all their straits hath he rescued them.

content: 18 Near is Yahweh､ to the broken in heart, And the crushed in spirit will he save.
content_old: 18 Near is Yahweh､ to the broken in heart, And the crushed in spirit will he save.

content: 19 Many are the misfortunes of the righteous, But out of them all doth Yahweh rescue him.
content_old: 19 Many are the misfortunes of the righteous, But out of them all doth Yahweh rescue him.

content: 20 Keeping all his bones, Not one from among them is broken.
content_old: 20 Keeping all his bones, Not one from among them is broken.

content: 21 Misfortune shall be the death of the lawless one, And the haters of the righteous man shall be held guilty.
content_old: 21 Misfortune shall be the death of the lawless one, And the haters of the righteous man shall be held guilty.

content: David’s.
content_old: David’s.

content: 1 Contend､ O Yahweh with them who contend with me, Make war upon them who make war upon me.
content_old: 1 Contend､ O Yahweh with them who contend with me, Make war upon them who make war upon me.

content: 2 Grasp buckler and shield, And arise in my help;
content_old: 2 Grasp buckler and shield, And arise in my help;

content: 3 Then draw the spear､ and close up against my pursuers, Say to my soul Thy salvation I am!
content_old: 3 Then draw the spear､ and close up against my pursuers, Say to my soul Thy salvation I am!

content: 4 Let them be ashamed and confounded､ Who are seeking my life,— Let them turn back and be put to the blush, Who are devising my hurt:
content_old: 4 Let them be ashamed and confounded､ Who are seeking my life,— Let them turn back and be put to the blush, Who are devising my hurt:

content: 5 Let them be as chaff before the wind, With the messenger of Yahweh pressing them on:
content_old: 5 Let them be as chaff before the wind, With the messenger of Yahweh pressing them on:

content: 6 Let their way become dark and slippery, With the messenger of Yahweh pursuing them.
content_old: 6 Let their way become dark and slippery, With the messenger of Yahweh pursuing them.

content: 7 For without cause have they hid for me､ in a ditch､ their net,— Without cause have they digged a pit for my life.
content_old: 7 For without cause have they hid for me､ in a ditch､ their net,— Without cause have they digged a pit for my life.

content: 8 There shall reach him a ruin he could not know,— Yea his own net which he hath hidden shall capture him, Into that ruin shall he fall!
content_old: 8 There shall reach him a ruin he could not know,— Yea his own net which he hath hidden shall capture him, Into that ruin shall he fall!

content: 9 But my soul shall exult in Yahweh,— shall be glad in his salvation:
content_old: 9 But my soul shall exult in Yahweh,— shall be glad in his salvation:

content: 10 All my bones shall say— O Yahweh､ who is like unto thee? Rescuing the oppressed from one stronger than he, Yea the oppressed and the needy, from their spoiler.
content_old: 10 All my bones shall say— O Yahweh､ who is like unto thee? Rescuing the oppressed from one stronger than he, Yea the oppressed and the needy, from their spoiler.

content: 11 There rise up witnesses helping forward violence and wrong, What I know not they demand of me:
content_old: 11 There rise up witnesses helping forward violence and wrong, What I know not they demand of me:

content: 12 They repay me evil for good､ Bereaving my soul.
content_old: 12 They repay me evil for good､ Bereaving my soul.

content: 13 But as for me when they were sick my clothing was sackcloth､ I humbled､ with fasting､ my soul, Though my prayer unto mine own bosom might return:
content_old: 13 But as for me when they were sick my clothing was sackcloth､ I humbled､ with fasting､ my soul, Though my prayer unto mine own bosom might return:

content: 14 Like as for a friend､ like as for a brother of mine own I walked to and fro, As though mourning for a mother I gloomily bowed myself down.
content_old: 14 Like as for a friend､ like as for a brother of mine own I walked to and fro, As though mourning for a mother I gloomily bowed myself down.

content: 15 But in mine overthrow have they rejoiced､ And gathered themselves together,— There gathered themselves together against me foolish men､ And I knew it not, They have torn in pieces, and not been silent;
content_old: 15 But in mine overthrow have they rejoiced､ And gathered themselves together,— There gathered themselves together against me foolish men､ And I knew it not, They have torn in pieces, and not been silent;

content: 16 Amidst profane praters of perversion Have they gnashed upon me with their teeth.
content_old: 16 Amidst profane praters of perversion Have they gnashed upon me with their teeth.

content: 17 My Lord! how long wilt thou look on? Bring back my soul out of their raging, From among lions my solitary self.
content_old: 17 My Lord! how long wilt thou look on? Bring back my soul out of their raging, From among lions my solitary self.

content: 18 I will thank thee､ in the midst of a great convocation,— In the midst of a mighty people will I praise thee.
content_old: 18 I will thank thee､ in the midst of a great convocation,— In the midst of a mighty people will I praise thee.

content: 19 Let not them who are falsely my foes rejoice over me, As for them who hate me without cause let them not wink the eye!
content_old: 19 Let not them who are falsely my foes rejoice over me, As for them who hate me without cause let them not wink the eye!

content: 20 For no salutation will they utter,— But against the quiet of the land deceitful things do they devise;
content_old: 20 For no salutation will they utter,— But against the quiet of the land deceitful things do they devise;

content: 21 Yea they have opened wide against me their mouth, They have said, Aha! Aha! our own eye hath seen!
content_old: 21 Yea they have opened wide against me their mouth, They have said, Aha! Aha! our own eye hath seen!

content: 22 Thou hast seen､ O Yahweh, do not keep silence! O My Lord! be not far from me:
content_old: 22 Thou hast seen､ O Yahweh, do not keep silence! O My Lord! be not far from me:

content: 23 Bestir thyself and wake up､ to my vindication, O my God and My Lord!—to my plea:
content_old: 23 Bestir thyself and wake up､ to my vindication, O my God and My Lord!—to my plea:

content: 24 Vindicate me according to thy righteousness､ O Yahweh､ my God! And let them not rejoice over me:
content_old: 24 Vindicate me according to thy righteousness､ O Yahweh､ my God! And let them not rejoice over me:

content: 25 Let them not say in their heart､ Aha! to our mind! Let them not say､ We have swallowed him up!
content_old: 25 Let them not say in their heart､ Aha! to our mind! Let them not say､ We have swallowed him up!

content: 26 Let them turn pale､ and then at once blush､ Who are rejoicing at my misfortune,— Let them be clothed with shame and confusion, Who are magnifying themselves against me.
content_old: 26 Let them turn pale､ and then at once blush､ Who are rejoicing at my misfortune,— Let them be clothed with shame and confusion, Who are magnifying themselves against me.

content: 27 Let them shout in triumph and rejoice､ Who are desiring my justification; And let them say continually､ Yahweh be magnified, Who hath taken pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
content_old: 27 Let them shout in triumph and rejoice､ Who are desiring my justification; And let them say continually､ Yahweh be magnified, Who hath taken pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

content: To the Chief Musician. Of the Servant of Yahweh—of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. Of the Servant of Yahweh—of David.

content: 1 Declareth the transgression of the lawless one､ within my heart, There is no dread of God before his eyes;
content_old: 1 Declareth the transgression of the lawless one､ within my heart, There is no dread of God before his eyes;

content: 2 For he flattereth himself too much in his own eyes, To find his iniquity—to hate i̱t.
content_old: 2 For he flattereth himself too much in his own eyes, To find his iniquity—to hate i̱t.

content: 3 The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit, He hath left off to shew discretion by doing well:
content_old: 3 The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit, He hath left off to shew discretion by doing well:

content: 4 Iniquity deviseth he upon his bed,— He taketh his stand in a way not good Wrong doth he not abhor!
content_old: 4 Iniquity deviseth he upon his bed,— He taketh his stand in a way not good Wrong doth he not abhor!

content: 5 O Yahweh! in the heavens is thy lovingkindness, Thy faithfulness as far as the fleecy clouds:
content_old: 5 O Yahweh! in the heavens is thy lovingkindness, Thy faithfulness as far as the fleecy clouds:

content: 6 Thy righteousness is like mighty mountains､ And thy just decrees are a great resounding deep,— Man and beast thou savest､ O Yahweh!
content_old: 6 Thy righteousness is like mighty mountains､ And thy just decrees are a great resounding deep,— Man and beast thou savest､ O Yahweh!

content: 7 How precious thy lovingkindness､ O God,— Therefore the sons of men under the shadow of thy wings seek refuge:
content_old: 7 How precious thy lovingkindness､ O God,— Therefore the sons of men under the shadow of thy wings seek refuge:

content: 8 They abundantly relish the fatness of thy house,— And out of the full stream of thine own pleasures thou givest them to drink.
content_old: 8 They abundantly relish the fatness of thy house,— And out of the full stream of thine own pleasures thou givest them to drink.

content: 9 For with thee is the fountain of life, In thy light we see light.
content_old: 9 For with thee is the fountain of life, In thy light we see light.

content: 10 Prolong thy lovingkindness unto them who know thee,— And thy righteousness､ to the upright in heart.
content_old: 10 Prolong thy lovingkindness unto them who know thee,— And thy righteousness､ to the upright in heart.

content: 11 Let not the foot of pride reach me, Nor the hand of the lawless scare me away.
content_old: 11 Let not the foot of pride reach me, Nor the hand of the lawless scare me away.

content: David’s. An Alphabetical Psalm.
content_old: David’s. An Alphabetical Psalm.

content: 1 Burn not with vexation because of evil-doers, Be not envious of the workers of perversity;
content_old: 1 Burn not with vexation because of evil-doers, Be not envious of the workers of perversity;

content: 2 For like grass soon shall they wither, And like green herbage shall they fade.
content_old: 2 For like grass soon shall they wither, And like green herbage shall they fade.

content: 3 Trust in Yahweh､ and do good, Dwell in the land､ and feed on fidelity;
content_old: 3 Trust in Yahweh､ and do good, Dwell in the land､ and feed on fidelity;

content: 4 Yea､ rest thy delight on Yahweh, That he may give thee the requests of thy heart.
content_old: 4 Yea､ rest thy delight on Yahweh, That he may give thee the requests of thy heart.

content: 5 Roll on Yahweh thy way, Trust also in him､ and he will effectually work:
content_old: 5 Roll on Yahweh thy way, Trust also in him､ and he will effectually work:

content: 6 So will he bring forth､ as the light､ thy righteousness, And thy vindication as the noonday.
content_old: 6 So will he bring forth､ as the light､ thy righteousness, And thy vindication as the noonday.

content: 7 Be resigned to Yahweh､ yea wait with longing for him; Burn not with vexation At him who prospereth in his way,— At the man who doeth wickedness.
content_old: 7 Be resigned to Yahweh､ yea wait with longing for him; Burn not with vexation At him who prospereth in his way,— At the man who doeth wickedness.

content: 8 Cease from anger, and forsake wrath, Burn not with vexation—it would be only to do evil;
content_old: 8 Cease from anger, and forsake wrath, Burn not with vexation—it would be only to do evil;

content: 9 For evil doers shall be cut off, But as for them who wait for Yahweh they shall inherit the earth.
content_old: 9 For evil doers shall be cut off, But as for them who wait for Yahweh they shall inherit the earth.

content: 10 Yet a little therefore､ And the lawless one shall not be, Yea thou shalt look about､ over his place— And he shall have vanished!
content_old: 10 Yet a little therefore､ And the lawless one shall not be, Yea thou shalt look about､ over his place— And he shall have vanished!

content: 11 But the patient oppressed-ones shall inherit the earth, And shall delight themselves over the abundance of prosperity.
content_old: 11 But the patient oppressed-ones shall inherit the earth, And shall delight themselves over the abundance of prosperity.

content: 12 Plotting is the lawless one､ against the just, And gnashing upon him with his teeth.
content_old: 12 Plotting is the lawless one､ against the just, And gnashing upon him with his teeth.

content: 13 My Lord shall laugh at him, For he seeth､ that his day will come.
content_old: 13 My Lord shall laugh at him, For he seeth､ that his day will come.

content: 14 A sword have the lawless drawn out And have trodden their bow,— To bring down the oppressed and the needy, To slaughter the upright in life:
content_old: 14 A sword have the lawless drawn out And have trodden their bow,— To bring down the oppressed and the needy, To slaughter the upright in life:

content: 15 Their sword shall enter into their own heart, And their bow shall be broken.
content_old: 15 Their sword shall enter into their own heart, And their bow shall be broken.

content: 16 Better the little of the righteous man Than the abundance of the lawless who are mighty;
content_old: 16 Better the little of the righteous man Than the abundance of the lawless who are mighty;

content: 17 For the arms of the lawless shall be broken, But Yahweh is upholding the righteous.
content_old: 17 For the arms of the lawless shall be broken, But Yahweh is upholding the righteous.

content: 18 Yahweh knoweth the days of the blameless, That their inheritance unto times age-abiding shall continue.
content_old: 18 Yahweh knoweth the days of the blameless, That their inheritance unto times age-abiding shall continue.

content: 19 They shall not be ashamed in the time of calamity, And in the days of famine shall they be filled.
content_old: 19 They shall not be ashamed in the time of calamity, And in the days of famine shall they be filled.

content: 20 For the lawless shall perish､ And the foes of Yahweh be like the glory of the meadows, They have vanished! In smoke have they vanished!
content_old: 20 For the lawless shall perish､ And the foes of Yahweh be like the glory of the meadows, They have vanished! In smoke have they vanished!

content: 21 A lawless man borroweth, and will not repay, But a righteous man sheweth favour and giveth;
content_old: 21 A lawless man borroweth, and will not repay, But a righteous man sheweth favour and giveth;

content: 22 For such as are blessed of him shall inherit the earth, But the accursed of him shall be cut off.
content_old: 22 For such as are blessed of him shall inherit the earth, But the accursed of him shall be cut off.

content: 23 From Yahweh are the steps of a man made firm､ When with his way he is well pleased:
content_old: 23 From Yahweh are the steps of a man made firm､ When with his way he is well pleased:

content: 24 Though he fall he shall not be hurled head-long, For Yahweh is holding his hand.
content_old: 24 Though he fall he shall not be hurled head-long, For Yahweh is holding his hand.

content: 25 Young have I been､ moreover am old,— Yet have I not seen A righteous man forsaken, Nor his seed begging bread:
content_old: 25 Young have I been､ moreover am old,— Yet have I not seen A righteous man forsaken, Nor his seed begging bread:

content: 26 All day long is he shewing favour and lending, His seed therefore､ shall have a blessing.
content_old: 26 All day long is he shewing favour and lending, His seed therefore､ shall have a blessing.

content: 27 Turn from evil､ and do good､ And so settle down､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 27 Turn from evil､ and do good､ And so settle down､ unto times age-abiding.

content: 28 For Yahweh loveth justice､ And will not forsake his men of lovingkindness, Unto times age-abiding have the perverse been destroyed,— And the seed of the lawless been cut off.
content_old: 28 For Yahweh loveth justice､ And will not forsake his men of lovingkindness, Unto times age-abiding have the perverse been destroyed,— And the seed of the lawless been cut off.

content: 29 The righteous shall inherit the earth, That they may settle down､ to futurity､ thereupon.
content_old: 29 The righteous shall inherit the earth, That they may settle down､ to futurity､ thereupon.

content: 30 The mouth of a righteous man softly uttereth wisdom, And his tongue speaketh justice:
content_old: 30 The mouth of a righteous man softly uttereth wisdom, And his tongue speaketh justice:

content: 31 The law of his God is in his heart, His steps shall not swerve.
content_old: 31 The law of his God is in his heart, His steps shall not swerve.

content: 32 The lawless man lieth in wait for the just, And seeketh to put him to death:
content_old: 32 The lawless man lieth in wait for the just, And seeketh to put him to death:

content: 33 Yahweh will not leave him in his hand, Nor condemn him､ when he is judged.
content_old: 33 Yahweh will not leave him in his hand, Nor condemn him､ when he is judged.

content: 34 Wait for Yahweh､ and observe thou his path､ That he may exalt thee､ to inherit the earth, On the､ cutting off of the lawless shalt thou look.
content_old: 34 Wait for Yahweh､ and observe thou his path､ That he may exalt thee､ to inherit the earth, On the､ cutting off of the lawless shalt thou look.

content: 35 I have seen a lawless man､ a tyrant, And spreading himself out､ like a cedar in Lebanon;
content_old: 35 I have seen a lawless man､ a tyrant, And spreading himself out､ like a cedar in Lebanon;

content: 36 Then I passed by, and lo! he had vanished! Yea I sought him､ but he could not be found.
content_old: 36 Then I passed by, and lo! he had vanished! Yea I sought him､ but he could not be found.

content: 37 Mark the blameless man､ And behold the upright, For there is a hereafter for the man of peace;
content_old: 37 Mark the blameless man､ And behold the upright, For there is a hereafter for the man of peace;

content: 38 But transgressors are to be destroyed together, The hereafter of lawless men is to be cut off.
content_old: 38 But transgressors are to be destroyed together, The hereafter of lawless men is to be cut off.

content: 39 But the deliverance of the righteous is from Yahweh, Their refuge in a time of distress.
content_old: 39 But the deliverance of the righteous is from Yahweh, Their refuge in a time of distress.

content: A Melody of David. To bring to Remembrance.
content_old: A Melody of David. To bring to Remembrance.

content: 1 O Yahweh､ do not in thine anger correct me, Nor in thy wrath chastise me;
content_old: 1 O Yahweh､ do not in thine anger correct me, Nor in thy wrath chastise me;

content: 2 For thine arrows have sunk down into me, And thy hand presseth heavily upon me.
content_old: 2 For thine arrows have sunk down into me, And thy hand presseth heavily upon me.

content: 3 There is no soundness in my flesh､ By reason of thine indignation, There is no peace in my bones, By reason of my sin;
content_old: 3 There is no soundness in my flesh､ By reason of thine indignation, There is no peace in my bones, By reason of my sin;

content: 4 For mine iniquities have passed over my head, Like a heavy burden they are too heavy for me:
content_old: 4 For mine iniquities have passed over my head, Like a heavy burden they are too heavy for me:

content: 5 My wounds are of bad odour—they have festered, By reason of my folly:
content_old: 5 My wounds are of bad odour—they have festered, By reason of my folly:

content: 6 I am bent､ I am bowed down very low. All the day have I gloomily walked;
content_old: 6 I am bent､ I am bowed down very low. All the day have I gloomily walked;

content: 7 For my loins are filled with inflammation, And there is no soundness in my flesh:
content_old: 7 For my loins are filled with inflammation, And there is no soundness in my flesh:

content: 8 I am benumbed and crushed exceedingly,— I have cried aloud because of the groaning of my heart.
content_old: 8 I am benumbed and crushed exceedingly,— I have cried aloud because of the groaning of my heart.

content: 9 O My Lord! before thee is all my longing, And my sighing from thee hath not been hid:
content_old: 9 O My Lord! before thee is all my longing, And my sighing from thee hath not been hid:

content: 10 My heart fluttereth, my strength hath forsaken me, And as for the light of mine eyes even they are not with me:
content_old: 10 My heart fluttereth, my strength hath forsaken me, And as for the light of mine eyes even they are not with me:

content: 11 My lovers､ and my friends from before my stroke stand aloof,— And my near ones far away do stand:
content_old: 11 My lovers､ and my friends from before my stroke stand aloof,— And my near ones far away do stand:

content: 12 Yea they who are seeking my life have laid snares､ And they who are asking my harm have threatened engulfing ruin, And deceitful things—all day long do they mutter.
content_old: 12 Yea they who are seeking my life have laid snares､ And they who are asking my harm have threatened engulfing ruin, And deceitful things—all day long do they mutter.

content: 13 But I as one deaf will not hear,— And as one dumb､ who will not open his mouth:
content_old: 13 But I as one deaf will not hear,— And as one dumb､ who will not open his mouth:

content: 14 Thus have I become as a man who cannot hear, In whose mouth are no arguments:
content_old: 14 Thus have I become as a man who cannot hear, In whose mouth are no arguments:

content: 15 Because for thee O Yahweh､ have I waited, Thou wilt answer､ O Adonay､ my God!
content_old: 15 Because for thee O Yahweh､ have I waited, Thou wilt answer､ O Adonay､ my God!

content: 16 For I said Lest they rejoice over me! When my feet were tottering against me have they magnified themselves:
content_old: 16 For I said Lest they rejoice over me! When my feet were tottering against me have they magnified themselves:

content: 17 For I to halt am ready, And my pain is before me continually;
content_old: 17 For I to halt am ready, And my pain is before me continually;

content: 18 For mine iniquity will I declare, I shall be anxious because of my sin;
content_old: 18 For mine iniquity will I declare, I shall be anxious because of my sin;

content: 19 And my foes are alive—have become strong,— And multiplied are they who hate me for false cause:
content_old: 19 And my foes are alive—have become strong,— And multiplied are they who hate me for false cause:

content: 20 Even they who are repaying evil for good accuse me because I pursue the good.
content_old: 20 Even they who are repaying evil for good accuse me because I pursue the good.

content: 21 Do not forsake me､ O Yahweh! My God! be not far from me:
content_old: 21 Do not forsake me､ O Yahweh! My God! be not far from me:

content: To the Chief Musician. For Jeduthun. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. For Jeduthun. A Melody of David.

content: 1 I said､ to myself I will take heed to my ways､ That I sin not with my tongue,— I will put on my mouth a muzzle, So long as the lawless is before me.
content_old: 1 I said､ to myself I will take heed to my ways､ That I sin not with my tongue,— I will put on my mouth a muzzle, So long as the lawless is before me.

content: 2 I was dumb with silence､ I held my peace､ afar from happiness, But my pain had been stirred:
content_old: 2 I was dumb with silence､ I held my peace､ afar from happiness, But my pain had been stirred:

content: 3 Hot was my heart within me､ While I was musing there was kindled a fire, I spake with my tongue!
content_old: 3 Hot was my heart within me､ While I was musing there was kindled a fire, I spake with my tongue!

content: 4 Let me know､ O Yahweh､ mine end､ And the measure of my days—what it is, I would know how short-lived I am.
content_old: 4 Let me know､ O Yahweh､ mine end､ And the measure of my days—what it is, I would know how short-lived I am.

content: 5 Lo! as hand-breadths hast thou granted my days､ And my life-time is as nothing before thee,— Surely a mere breath are all men, even such as stand firm. Selah.
content_old: 5 Lo! as hand-breadths hast thou granted my days､ And my life-time is as nothing before thee,— Surely a mere breath are all men, even such as stand firm. Selah.

content: 6 Surely as a shadow doth every man wander､ Surely in vain do they bustle about, He heapeth things up, and knoweth not who shall gather them in.
content_old: 6 Surely as a shadow doth every man wander､ Surely in vain do they bustle about, He heapeth things up, and knoweth not who shall gather them in.

content: 7 Now therefore､ for what have I waited､ O My Lord? My hope is in thee.
content_old: 7 Now therefore､ for what have I waited､ O My Lord? My hope is in thee.

content: 8 From all my transgressions rescue thou me,— The reproach of the base oh do not make me!
content_old: 8 From all my transgressions rescue thou me,— The reproach of the base oh do not make me!

content: 9 I am dumb､ I cannot open my mouth, For thou hast done it.
content_old: 9 I am dumb､ I cannot open my mouth, For thou hast done it.

content: 10 Remove from off me thy stroke, Because of the hostility of thy hand am I consumed.
content_old: 10 Remove from off me thy stroke, Because of the hostility of thy hand am I consumed.

content: 11 When by rebukes for iniquity thou hast corrected a man Then hast thou consumed､ as a moth､ all that was delightful within him, Surely a breath are all men. Selah.
content_old: 11 When by rebukes for iniquity thou hast corrected a man Then hast thou consumed､ as a moth､ all that was delightful within him, Surely a breath are all men. Selah.

content: 12 Hear my prayer､ O Yahweh､ And unto my cry for help give ear, At my tears do not be silent,— For a sojourner am I with thee, A stranger､ like all my fathers.
content_old: 12 Hear my prayer､ O Yahweh､ And unto my cry for help give ear, At my tears do not be silent,— For a sojourner am I with thee, A stranger､ like all my fathers.

content: To the Chief Musician. David’s. A Melody.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. David’s. A Melody.

content: 1 I waited patiently for Yahweh,— And he inclined unto me, and heard my cry for help;
content_old: 1 I waited patiently for Yahweh,— And he inclined unto me, and heard my cry for help;

content: 2 So he brought me up Out of the destroying pit､ Out of the swampy mire,— And set､ upon a cliff､ my feet, Making firm my steps:
content_old: 2 So he brought me up Out of the destroying pit､ Out of the swampy mire,— And set､ upon a cliff､ my feet, Making firm my steps:

content: 3 Then put he､ into my mouth､ a new song､ Praise to our God,— Many shall see and revere, And shall trust in Yahweh.
content_old: 3 Then put he､ into my mouth､ a new song､ Praise to our God,— Many shall see and revere, And shall trust in Yahweh.

content: 4 How happy the man Who hath made Yahweh his confidence, Who hath not turned unto the haughty､ Nor gone aside unto falsehood.
content_old: 4 How happy the man Who hath made Yahweh his confidence, Who hath not turned unto the haughty､ Nor gone aside unto falsehood.

content: 5 Mighty things hast thou done— Thou､ Yahweh my God､ Thy wonderful doings and thy purposes towards us There is no setting them in order unto thee— I would tell､ and would speak!— They are too great to rehearse.
content_old: 5 Mighty things hast thou done— Thou､ Yahweh my God､ Thy wonderful doings and thy purposes towards us There is no setting them in order unto thee— I would tell､ and would speak!— They are too great to rehearse.

content: 6 Sacrifice and meal-offering thou didst not delight in､ Ears didst thou pierce for me,— Ascending-sacrifice and sin-bearer thou didst not ask:
content_old: 6 Sacrifice and meal-offering thou didst not delight in､ Ears didst thou pierce for me,— Ascending-sacrifice and sin-bearer thou didst not ask:

content: 7 Then said I— Lo! I am come, In the written scroll is it prescribed for me;
content_old: 7 Then said I— Lo! I am come, In the written scroll is it prescribed for me;

content: 8 To do thy good-pleasure､ O my God is my delight, And thy law is in the midst of mine inward parts:
content_old: 8 To do thy good-pleasure､ O my God is my delight, And thy law is in the midst of mine inward parts:

content: 9 I have told the good-tidings of righteousness in a great convocation､ Lo! my lips do I not restrain, O Yahweh､ thou knowest:
content_old: 9 I have told the good-tidings of righteousness in a great convocation､ Lo! my lips do I not restrain, O Yahweh､ thou knowest:

content: 10 Thy righteousness have I not hid in the midst of my heart､ Thy faithfulness and thy salvation have I spoken, I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truthfulness from the great convocation.
content_old: 10 Thy righteousness have I not hid in the midst of my heart､ Thy faithfulness and thy salvation have I spoken, I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truthfulness from the great convocation.

content: 11 Thou､ O Yahweh wilt not restrain thy compassions from me, Thy lovingkindness and thy truthfulness shall continually watch over me.
content_old: 11 Thou､ O Yahweh wilt not restrain thy compassions from me, Thy lovingkindness and thy truthfulness shall continually watch over me.

content: 12 For there have closed in upon me､ misfortunes beyond number､ Mine iniquities have overtaken me, and I cannot see, They have become more than the hairs of my head, And my courage hath forsaken me!
content_old: 12 For there have closed in upon me､ misfortunes beyond number､ Mine iniquities have overtaken me, and I cannot see, They have become more than the hairs of my head, And my courage hath forsaken me!

content: 13 Be pleased､ O Yahweh, to rescue me, O Yahweh! to help me make haste!
content_old: 13 Be pleased､ O Yahweh, to rescue me, O Yahweh! to help me make haste!

content: 14 Let them turn pale and then at once blush､ Who are seeking my life to snatch it away,— Let them draw back､ and be confounded, Who are taking pleasure in my calamity;
content_old: 14 Let them turn pale and then at once blush､ Who are seeking my life to snatch it away,— Let them draw back､ and be confounded, Who are taking pleasure in my calamity;

content: 15 Let them be astonished on account of their own shame, Who are saying of me､ Aha! Aha!
content_old: 15 Let them be astonished on account of their own shame, Who are saying of me､ Aha! Aha!

content: 16 Let all them be glad and rejoice in thee､ Who are seekers of thee. Let them say continually— Yahweh be magnified! Who are lovers of thy salvation.
content_old: 16 Let all them be glad and rejoice in thee､ Who are seekers of thee. Let them say continually— Yahweh be magnified! Who are lovers of thy salvation.

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.

content: 1 How happy is he that is attentive to the poor, In the day of calamity will Yahweh deliver him:
content_old: 1 How happy is he that is attentive to the poor, In the day of calamity will Yahweh deliver him:

content: 2 Yahweh will preserve him and keep him alive､ And he shall be pronounced happy in the land, Do not then give him up at the desire of his enemies!
content_old: 2 Yahweh will preserve him and keep him alive､ And he shall be pronounced happy in the land, Do not then give him up at the desire of his enemies!

content: 3 Yahweh will sustain him upon the bed of sickness, All his couch hast thou transformed in his disease.
content_old: 3 Yahweh will sustain him upon the bed of sickness, All his couch hast thou transformed in his disease.

content: 4 I said— O Yahweh､ shew me favour, Heal thou my soul､ For I have sinned against thee:
content_old: 4 I said— O Yahweh､ shew me favour, Heal thou my soul､ For I have sinned against thee:

content: 5 Mine enemies speak ill of me, When will he die, and his name perish?
content_old: 5 Mine enemies speak ill of me, When will he die, and his name perish?

content: 6 And if he have come to see me Falsehood doth he speak､ His own heart gathereth iniquity to itself, He goeth forth､ abroad he telleth it.
content_old: 6 And if he have come to see me Falsehood doth he speak､ His own heart gathereth iniquity to itself, He goeth forth､ abroad he telleth it.

content: 7 Together—against me do all who hate me whisper among themselves, Against me devise they hurt for me.
content_old: 7 Together—against me do all who hate me whisper among themselves, Against me devise they hurt for me.

content: 8 An infliction of the Abandoned One hath been fixed upon him, And now that he hath lien down he will not again rise.
content_old: 8 An infliction of the Abandoned One hath been fixed upon him, And now that he hath lien down he will not again rise.

content: 9 Even the man whom I used to salute､ In whom I put confidence, Who used to eat my bread,— Hath magnified his heel against me!
content_old: 9 Even the man whom I used to salute､ In whom I put confidence, Who used to eat my bread,— Hath magnified his heel against me!

content: 10 But thou､ O Yahweh shew me favour and raise me up, That I may repay them.
content_old: 10 But thou､ O Yahweh shew me favour and raise me up, That I may repay them.

content: 11 Hereby do I know that thou delightest in me, In that mine enemy shall not raise a shout over me.
content_old: 11 Hereby do I know that thou delightest in me, In that mine enemy shall not raise a shout over me.

content: 12 But as for me In my blamelessness hast thou held me fast, And hast caused me to stand before thee unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 12 But as for me In my blamelessness hast thou held me fast, And hast caused me to stand before thee unto times age-abiding.

content: To the Chief Musician. An Instructive Psalm for the Sons of Korah.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. An Instructive Psalm for the Sons of Korah.

content: 1 As the hart cometh panting up to the channels of water So my soul panteth for thee､ O God.
content_old: 1 As the hart cometh panting up to the channels of water So my soul panteth for thee､ O God.

content: 2 My soul thirsteth for God､ for a GOD who liveth,— When shall I enter in, and see the face of God?
content_old: 2 My soul thirsteth for God､ for a GOD who liveth,— When shall I enter in, and see the face of God?

content: 3 My tears have been my food day and night, While it hath been said unto me all the day､ Where is thy God?
content_old: 3 My tears have been my food day and night, While it hath been said unto me all the day､ Where is thy God?

content: 4 These things I keep calling to mind､ and pouring out､ over me､ my own soul, For I used to cross over with a crowd､ Lead them in procession up to the house of God, With the voice of shouting and praise､—a throng keeping festival.
content_old: 4 These things I keep calling to mind､ and pouring out､ over me､ my own soul, For I used to cross over with a crowd､ Lead them in procession up to the house of God, With the voice of shouting and praise､—a throng keeping festival.

content: 5 Why shouldst thou be cast down､ O my soul? And why shouldst thou moan over me? Wait thou for God, for yet shall I praise him, As the triumph of my presence.
content_old: 5 Why shouldst thou be cast down､ O my soul? And why shouldst thou moan over me? Wait thou for God, for yet shall I praise him, As the triumph of my presence.

content: 6 My God! over myself my soul is east down,— For this cause will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, And the Hermons､ from the hill Mizar.
content_old: 6 My God! over myself my soul is east down,— For this cause will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, And the Hermons､ from the hill Mizar.

content: 7 Roaring deep unto roaring deep is calling, at the voice of thy cataracts, All thy breakers and thy rolling waves over me have passed.
content_old: 7 Roaring deep unto roaring deep is calling, at the voice of thy cataracts, All thy breakers and thy rolling waves over me have passed.

content: 8 By day will Yahweh command his loving-kindness､ And in the night shall His song be with me, My prayer be to the GOD of my life.
content_old: 8 By day will Yahweh command his loving-kindness､ And in the night shall His song be with me, My prayer be to the GOD of my life.

content: 9 I will say unto GOD—my rock､ Wherefore hast thou forgotten me? Wherefore in gloom should I go､ because of oppression by the enemy?
content_old: 9 I will say unto GOD—my rock､ Wherefore hast thou forgotten me? Wherefore in gloom should I go､ because of oppression by the enemy?

content: 10 With a crushing of my bones have my adversaries reproached me,— While they keep saying unto me all the day､ Where is thy God?
content_old: 10 With a crushing of my bones have my adversaries reproached me,— While they keep saying unto me all the day､ Where is thy God?

content: 1 Vindicate me､ O God､ and plead my cause､ Against a nation without lovingkindness, From the man of deceit and perversity wilt thou deliver me?
content_old: 1 Vindicate me､ O God､ and plead my cause､ Against a nation without lovingkindness, From the man of deceit and perversity wilt thou deliver me?

content: 2 For thou art my defending God— Wherefore hast thou rejected me? Wherefore in gloom should I wander､ because of the oppression of an enemy?
content_old: 2 For thou art my defending God— Wherefore hast thou rejected me? Wherefore in gloom should I wander､ because of the oppression of an enemy?

content: 3 Send forth thy light and thy faithfulness, Let them lead me? Let them bring me into thy holy mountain､ and into thy habitations:
content_old: 3 Send forth thy light and thy faithfulness, Let them lead me? Let them bring me into thy holy mountain､ and into thy habitations:

content: 4 That I may go in unto the altar of God､ Unto GOD､ mine exultant joy,— That I may praise thee with the lyre､ O God—mine own God!
content_old: 4 That I may go in unto the altar of God､ Unto GOD､ mine exultant joy,— That I may praise thee with the lyre､ O God—mine own God!

content: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah. An Instructive Psalm.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah. An Instructive Psalm.

content: 1 O God! with our own ears have we heard､ Our fathers have recounted to us,— The work thou didst work In their days､ In the days of aforetime:
content_old: 1 O God! with our own ears have we heard､ Our fathers have recounted to us,— The work thou didst work In their days､ In the days of aforetime:

content: 2 Thou thyself､ with thine own hand— Didst dispossess nations､ And didst plant them, Didst break peoples in pieces, And didst spread them out:
content_old: 2 Thou thyself､ with thine own hand— Didst dispossess nations､ And didst plant them, Didst break peoples in pieces, And didst spread them out:

content: 3 For not by their own sword gat they possession of the land､ Nor did their own arm win victory for them,— But thine own right hand､ and thine own arm､ and the light of thy face､ Because thou hadst accepted them.
content_old: 3 For not by their own sword gat they possession of the land､ Nor did their own arm win victory for them,— But thine own right hand､ and thine own arm､ and the light of thy face､ Because thou hadst accepted them.

content: 4 Thou thyself art my king､ O God, Command thou the victories of Jacob.
content_old: 4 Thou thyself art my king､ O God, Command thou the victories of Jacob.

content: 5 By thee will we thrust at our adversaries, In thy Name will we tread down our assailants;
content_old: 5 By thee will we thrust at our adversaries, In thy Name will we tread down our assailants;

content: 6 For not in my bow will I trust, Nor shall my sword give me victory;
content_old: 6 For not in my bow will I trust, Nor shall my sword give me victory;

content: 7 For thou hast saved us from our adversaries, And them who hated us hast thou put to shame.
content_old: 7 For thou hast saved us from our adversaries, And them who hated us hast thou put to shame.

content: 8 In God have we boasted all the day, And thy Name—unto times age-abiding will we praise. Selah.
content_old: 8 In God have we boasted all the day, And thy Name—unto times age-abiding will we praise. Selah.

content: 9 But nay thou hast rejected､ and confounded us, And wilt not go forth with our hosts;
content_old: 9 But nay thou hast rejected､ and confounded us, And wilt not go forth with our hosts;

content: 10 Thou sufferest us to turn back from the adversary, And they who hate us have plundered at will:
content_old: 10 Thou sufferest us to turn back from the adversary, And they who hate us have plundered at will:

content: 11 Thou dost give us up like sheep to be devoured, And amongst the nations hast thou scattered us.
content_old: 11 Thou dost give us up like sheep to be devoured, And amongst the nations hast thou scattered us.

content: 12 Thou dost sell thy people for no-value, And hast not made increase by their price.
content_old: 12 Thou dost sell thy people for no-value, And hast not made increase by their price.

content: 13 Thou dost make us A reproach to our neighbours, A mockery and a derision to them who are round about us:
content_old: 13 Thou dost make us A reproach to our neighbours, A mockery and a derision to them who are round about us:

content: 14 Thou dost make us A by word among the nations,— A shaking of the head among the peoples.
content_old: 14 Thou dost make us A by word among the nations,— A shaking of the head among the peoples.

content: 15 All the day is my confusion before me, And the shame of my face hath covered me:
content_old: 15 All the day is my confusion before me, And the shame of my face hath covered me:

content: 16 At the voice of him who reproacheth and revileth, At the face of the foe and avenger.
content_old: 16 At the voice of him who reproacheth and revileth, At the face of the foe and avenger.

content: 17 All this hath come upon us､ Yet had we not forgotten thee, Neither had we dealt falsely with thy covenant;
content_old: 17 All this hath come upon us､ Yet had we not forgotten thee, Neither had we dealt falsely with thy covenant;

content: 18 Our heart had not drawn back, Nor had our goings swerved from thy path;
content_old: 18 Our heart had not drawn back, Nor had our goings swerved from thy path;

content: 19 That thou shouldst have crushed us down in the place of wild dogs, And covered us over with a deadly shadow.
content_old: 19 That thou shouldst have crushed us down in the place of wild dogs, And covered us over with a deadly shadow.

content: 20 If we had forgotten the Name of our God, And had spread forth our hands unto the GOD of the foreigner
content_old: 20 If we had forgotten the Name of our God, And had spread forth our hands unto the GOD of the foreigner

content: 21 Would not God have searched into this, Seeing that he knoweth the secrets of the heart?
content_old: 21 Would not God have searched into this, Seeing that he knoweth the secrets of the heart?

content: 22 Surely for thy sake have we been slain all the day, We have been accounted as sheep for slaughter.
content_old: 22 Surely for thy sake have we been slain all the day, We have been accounted as sheep for slaughter.

content: 23 Awake thou! wherefore shouldst thou sleep､ O Lord? Bestir thee! do not reject us altogether!
content_old: 23 Awake thou! wherefore shouldst thou sleep､ O Lord? Bestir thee! do not reject us altogether!

content: 24 Wherefore shouldst thou hide thy face? Shouldst forget our humiliation and our oppression?
content_old: 24 Wherefore shouldst thou hide thy face? Shouldst forget our humiliation and our oppression?

content: 25 For our soul sinketh down to the dust, Our body cleaveth to the earth.
content_old: 25 For our soul sinketh down to the dust, Our body cleaveth to the earth.

content: To the Chief Musician. On Shoshannim. For the Sons of Korah. A Psalm of Instruction. A Song of Love.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On Shoshannim. For the Sons of Korah. A Psalm of Instruction. A Song of Love.

content: 1 Overflowed hath my heart､ with an excellent theme, I will recite my poem concerning the king, Be my tongue like the pen of a scribe who is skilled.
content_old: 1 Overflowed hath my heart､ with an excellent theme, I will recite my poem concerning the king, Be my tongue like the pen of a scribe who is skilled.

content: 2 Most beautiful thou art､ beyond the sons of men､ Graciousness hath been poured forth by thy lips, For this cause hath God blessed thee､ to times age-abiding.
content_old: 2 Most beautiful thou art､ beyond the sons of men､ Graciousness hath been poured forth by thy lips, For this cause hath God blessed thee､ to times age-abiding.

content: 3 Gird thy sword upon thy thigh､ O mighty one, ’Tie thine honour and thy majesty;
content_old: 3 Gird thy sword upon thy thigh､ O mighty one, ’Tie thine honour and thy majesty;

content: 4 And in thy majesty be successful! ride forth! On behalf of faithfulness､ and humility—righteousness, And let thine own right hand shew thee wonderful things.
content_old: 4 And in thy majesty be successful! ride forth! On behalf of faithfulness､ and humility—righteousness, And let thine own right hand shew thee wonderful things.

content: 5 Thine arrows are sharp— Peoples under thee fall! In the heart of the foes of the king.
content_old: 5 Thine arrows are sharp— Peoples under thee fall! In the heart of the foes of the king.

content: 6 Thy throne､ O God is to times age-abiding and beyond, A sceptre of equity is the sceptre of thy kingdom.
content_old: 6 Thy throne､ O God is to times age-abiding and beyond, A sceptre of equity is the sceptre of thy kingdom.

content: 7 Thou hast loved righteousness､ and hated lawlessness,— For this cause hath God､ thine own God､ anointed thee With the oil of gladness､ beyond thy partners.
content_old: 7 Thou hast loved righteousness､ and hated lawlessness,— For this cause hath God､ thine own God､ anointed thee With the oil of gladness､ beyond thy partners.

content: 8 Myrrh and aloes､ cassias､ all thy garments,— Out of the palaces of ivory the tones of strings have rejoiced thee.
content_old: 8 Myrrh and aloes､ cassias､ all thy garments,— Out of the palaces of ivory the tones of strings have rejoiced thee.

content: 9 Daughters of kings are among thine honourable women, Stationed is the bride at thy right hand､ in gold of Ophir.
content_old: 9 Daughters of kings are among thine honourable women, Stationed is the bride at thy right hand､ in gold of Ophir.

content: 10 Hearken､ O daughter､ and observe, Incline also thine ear, Forget､ then､ thine own people､ And the house of thy father;
content_old: 10 Hearken､ O daughter､ and observe, Incline also thine ear, Forget､ then､ thine own people､ And the house of thy father;

content: 11 When the king shall desire thy beauty, Surely he is thy lord, then bow down to him.
content_old: 11 When the king shall desire thy beauty, Surely he is thy lord, then bow down to him.

content: 12 Also the daughter of Tyre cometh in with a present! Thy face shall the rich of the people appease.
content_old: 12 Also the daughter of Tyre cometh in with a present! Thy face shall the rich of the people appease.

content: 13 All glorious—the daughter of a king sitteth within, Brocades､ wrought with gold are her clothing!
content_old: 13 All glorious—the daughter of a king sitteth within, Brocades､ wrought with gold are her clothing!

content: 14 In embroidered raiment shall she be brought unto the king,— The virgins that follow her､ her companions are to be conducted unto thee:
content_old: 14 In embroidered raiment shall she be brought unto the king,— The virgins that follow her､ her companions are to be conducted unto thee:

content: 15 They shall be brought､ with rejoicings and exultation,— They shall enter into the palace of the king!
content_old: 15 They shall be brought､ with rejoicings and exultation,— They shall enter into the palace of the king!

content: 16 Instead of thy fathers be thy sons, Thou shalt make them rulers in all the earth.
content_old: 16 Instead of thy fathers be thy sons, Thou shalt make them rulers in all the earth.

content: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah､ on Alamoth. A Song.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah､ on Alamoth. A Song.

content: 1 God—for us is a refuge and strength, A help in distresses, soon found.
content_old: 1 God—for us is a refuge and strength, A help in distresses, soon found.

content: 2 For this cause will we not fear､ Though the earth sheweth change, Or the mountains slip into the heart of the seas:
content_old: 2 For this cause will we not fear､ Though the earth sheweth change, Or the mountains slip into the heart of the seas:

content: 3 The waters thereof roar and foam, The mountains tremble with the swelling thereof. Selah.
content_old: 3 The waters thereof roar and foam, The mountains tremble with the swelling thereof. Selah.

content: 4 A river! whose channels shall gladden the city of God, The Most High hath hallowed his habitation.
content_old: 4 A river! whose channels shall gladden the city of God, The Most High hath hallowed his habitation.

content: 5 God is in the midst of her､ she shall not be shaken, God will help her､ by the turnings of the morning.
content_old: 5 God is in the midst of her､ she shall not be shaken, God will help her､ by the turnings of the morning.

content: 6 Nations have roared, Kingdoms have tottered, He hath uttered his voice､ Earth melteth.
content_old: 6 Nations have roared, Kingdoms have tottered, He hath uttered his voice､ Earth melteth.

content: 7 Yahweh of hosts is with us, A high tower for us is the God of Jacob. Selah.
content_old: 7 Yahweh of hosts is with us, A high tower for us is the God of Jacob. Selah.

content: 8 Come! view the doings of Yahweh,— Who hath set desolations in the earth;
content_old: 8 Come! view the doings of Yahweh,— Who hath set desolations in the earth;

content: 9 Causing wars to cease unto the end of the earth,— The bow he shivereth, And breaketh in pieces the spear, War-chariots burneth he up with fire.
content_old: 9 Causing wars to cease unto the end of the earth,— The bow he shivereth, And breaketh in pieces the spear, War-chariots burneth he up with fire.

content: 10 Let be! and know that I am God, I will be exalted among the nations､ I will be exalted in the earth.
content_old: 10 Let be! and know that I am God, I will be exalted among the nations､ I will be exalted in the earth.

content: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah. A Melody.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah. A Melody.

content: 1 All ye peoples､ clap your hands, Shout unto God､ with the voice of triumph;
content_old: 1 All ye peoples､ clap your hands, Shout unto God､ with the voice of triumph;

content: 2 For Yahweh—as Most High is to be revered, A great king､ over all the earth,
content_old: 2 For Yahweh—as Most High is to be revered, A great king､ over all the earth,

content: 3 He will subjugate Peoples under us, and Tribes of men beneath our feet.
content_old: 3 He will subjugate Peoples under us, and Tribes of men beneath our feet.

content: 4 He chooseth for us our inheritance, The excellence of Jacob､ which he hath loved. Selah.
content_old: 4 He chooseth for us our inheritance, The excellence of Jacob､ which he hath loved. Selah.

content: 5 God hath ascended with a shout, Yahweh､ with the sound of a horn.
content_old: 5 God hath ascended with a shout, Yahweh､ with the sound of a horn.

content: 6 Sing praises unto God､ sing praises, Sing praises to our King､ sing praises;
content_old: 6 Sing praises unto God､ sing praises, Sing praises to our King､ sing praises;

content: 7 For God is king of all the earth､ Sing praises with understanding.
content_old: 7 For God is king of all the earth､ Sing praises with understanding.

content: 8 God hath become king over the nations, God hath taken his seat upon his holy throne.
content_old: 8 God hath become king over the nations, God hath taken his seat upon his holy throne.

content: A Melodious Song. For the Sons of Korah.
content_old: A Melodious Song. For the Sons of Korah.

content: 1 Great is Yahweh､ and worthy to be mightily praised, In the city of our God､ His holy mountain.
content_old: 1 Great is Yahweh､ and worthy to be mightily praised, In the city of our God､ His holy mountain.

content: 2 Beautiful in elevation､ the joy of all the land Is Mount Zion､ in the recesses of the north,— The city of a great king.
content_old: 2 Beautiful in elevation､ the joy of all the land Is Mount Zion､ in the recesses of the north,— The city of a great king.

content: 3 God in her palaces is to be known as a high tower.
content_old: 3 God in her palaces is to be known as a high tower.

content: 4 For lo! Kings— Met as appointed, Passed by together;
content_old: 4 For lo! Kings— Met as appointed, Passed by together;

content: 5 They themselves saw､ So were they amazed, Dismayed—they hurried away!
content_old: 5 They themselves saw､ So were they amazed, Dismayed—they hurried away!

content: 6 Trembling seized them there, Pangs like hers who is in travail.
content_old: 6 Trembling seized them there, Pangs like hers who is in travail.

content: 7 With an east wind wilt thou shatter the ships of Tarshish.
content_old: 7 With an east wind wilt thou shatter the ships of Tarshish.

content: 8 Just as we had heard So have we seen､ In the city of Yahweh of hosts､ In the city of our God, God himself will establish her､ unto times age-abiding. Selah.
content_old: 8 Just as we had heard So have we seen､ In the city of Yahweh of hosts､ In the city of our God, God himself will establish her､ unto times age-abiding. Selah.

content: 9 We have thought､ O God､ upon thy loving-kindness, In the midst of thy temple:
content_old: 9 We have thought､ O God､ upon thy loving-kindness, In the midst of thy temple:

content: 10 According to thy Name､ O God So be thy praise､ unto the ends of the earth, With righteousness is thy right hand filled.
content_old: 10 According to thy Name､ O God So be thy praise､ unto the ends of the earth, With righteousness is thy right hand filled.

content: 11 Let Mount Zion rejoice､ Let the daughters of Judah exult, Because of thy judgments.
content_old: 11 Let Mount Zion rejoice､ Let the daughters of Judah exult, Because of thy judgments.

content: 12 Go round Zion､ and compass her about, Reckon up her towers;
content_old: 12 Go round Zion､ and compass her about, Reckon up her towers;

content: 13 Apply your mind to her rampart､ Pass between her palaces, That ye may recount them to an after generation;
content_old: 13 Apply your mind to her rampart､ Pass between her palaces, That ye may recount them to an after generation;

content: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah. A Melody.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah. A Melody.

content: 1 Hear ye this､ all ye peoples, Give ear､ all ye inhabitants of this passing world;
content_old: 1 Hear ye this､ all ye peoples, Give ear､ all ye inhabitants of this passing world;

content: 2 Both sons of the low And sons of the high,— Together both rich and needy:—
content_old: 2 Both sons of the low And sons of the high,— Together both rich and needy:—

content: 3 My mouth shall speak forth Wisdom, And the soft utterance of my heart be Understanding:
content_old: 3 My mouth shall speak forth Wisdom, And the soft utterance of my heart be Understanding:

content: 4 I will bend､ to a by-word､ mine ear, I will open､ on the lyre､ mine enigma.
content_old: 4 I will bend､ to a by-word､ mine ear, I will open､ on the lyre､ mine enigma.

content: 5 Wherefore should I fear in the days of calamity, Though the iniquity of them who lie in wait for me should enclose me?
content_old: 5 Wherefore should I fear in the days of calamity, Though the iniquity of them who lie in wait for me should enclose me?

content: 6 As for them who are trusting in their wealth,— And in the abundance of their riches do boast themselves
content_old: 6 As for them who are trusting in their wealth,— And in the abundance of their riches do boast themselves

content: 7 A brother can none of them redeem, He cannot give unto God a ransom for himself:
content_old: 7 A brother can none of them redeem, He cannot give unto God a ransom for himself:

content: 8 So costly is the redemption of their soul, That it faileth unto times age-abiding;
content_old: 8 So costly is the redemption of their soul, That it faileth unto times age-abiding;

content: 9 That he should yet live on continually, Should not see corruption.
content_old: 9 That he should yet live on continually, Should not see corruption.
