content: 10 For it is seen that the wise die､ Together with the dullard and the brutish do they perish, And leave､ to others､ their wealth:
content_old: 10 For it is seen that the wise die､ Together with the dullard and the brutish do they perish, And leave､ to others､ their wealth:

content: 11 Their inward thought is that their houses are for times age-abiding､ Their habitations､ for generation after generation,— They give their own names unto lands!
content_old: 11 Their inward thought is that their houses are for times age-abiding､ Their habitations､ for generation after generation,— They give their own names unto lands!

content: 12 But a son of earth､ though wealthy cannot tarry, He hath made himself a by-word— Beasts they resemble!
content_old: 12 But a son of earth､ though wealthy cannot tarry, He hath made himself a by-word— Beasts they resemble!

content: 13 This､ their way､ is a folly to them, And yet their followers with their mouth approve. Selah.
content_old: 13 This､ their way､ is a folly to them, And yet their followers with their mouth approve. Selah.

content: 14 Like sheep—into hades are they driven､ Death shall shepherd them,— And the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning､ Even their form is to decay､ Hades is all that remaineth of a habitation for him.
content_old: 14 Like sheep—into hades are they driven､ Death shall shepherd them,— And the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning､ Even their form is to decay､ Hades is all that remaineth of a habitation for him.

content: 15 But God will redeem my soul､ out of the hand of hades, For he will take me. Selah.
content_old: 15 But God will redeem my soul､ out of the hand of hades, For he will take me. Selah.

content: 16 Do not fear When a man becometh rich, When the glory of his house increaseth;
content_old: 16 Do not fear When a man becometh rich, When the glory of his house increaseth;

content: 17 For when he dieth he shall take nothing, His glory shall not descend after him;
content_old: 17 For when he dieth he shall take nothing, His glory shall not descend after him;

content: 18 For though his own self—while he lived he used to bless, And they will praise thee､ when thou doest well to thyself
content_old: 18 For though his own self—while he lived he used to bless, And they will praise thee､ when thou doest well to thyself

content: 19 He shall enter as far as the circle of his fathers, Nevermore shall they see the light.
content_old: 19 He shall enter as far as the circle of his fathers, Nevermore shall they see the light.

content: A Melody of Asaph.
content_old: A Melody of Asaph.

content: 1 El､ Elohim､ Yahweh hath spoken､ and called the earth, From the rising of the sun､ unto the going in thereof:
content_old: 1 El､ Elohim､ Yahweh hath spoken､ and called the earth, From the rising of the sun､ unto the going in thereof:

content: 2 Out of Zion the perfection of beauty God hath shone forth.
content_old: 2 Out of Zion the perfection of beauty God hath shone forth.

content: 3 Let our God come､ and let him not keep silence! A fire—before him shall devour, And around him hath it become exceeding tempestuous:
content_old: 3 Let our God come､ and let him not keep silence! A fire—before him shall devour, And around him hath it become exceeding tempestuous:

content: 4 He calleth Unto the heavens above, And unto the earth, That he may judge his people.
content_old: 4 He calleth Unto the heavens above, And unto the earth, That he may judge his people.

content: 5 Gather yourselves unto me—ye my men of lovingkindness, Who have solemnised my covenant over sacrifice.
content_old: 5 Gather yourselves unto me—ye my men of lovingkindness, Who have solemnised my covenant over sacrifice.

content: 6 Now have the heavens declared his righteousness, Because God is about to judge. Selah.
content_old: 6 Now have the heavens declared his righteousness, Because God is about to judge. Selah.

content: 7 Hear､ O my people､ and I will speak､ O Israel､ and I will adjure thee, God､ thine own God I am:—
content_old: 7 Hear､ O my people､ and I will speak､ O Israel､ and I will adjure thee, God､ thine own God I am:—

content: 8 Not for thy sacrifices will I reprove thee, Nor for thine ascending-offerings､ before me continually:
content_old: 8 Not for thy sacrifices will I reprove thee, Nor for thine ascending-offerings､ before me continually:

content: 9 I will not take out of thy house—a bullock, Nor out of thy folds—he-goats;
content_old: 9 I will not take out of thy house—a bullock, Nor out of thy folds—he-goats;

content: 10 For mine is every wild-beast of the forest, The cattle on the mountains､ in their thousands;
content_old: 10 For mine is every wild-beast of the forest, The cattle on the mountains､ in their thousands;

content: 11 I know every bird of the mountains, And the moving things of the plain are with me:
content_old: 11 I know every bird of the mountains, And the moving things of the plain are with me:

content: 12 If I were hungry I would not tell thee, For mine is the world､ and the fulness thereof.
content_old: 12 If I were hungry I would not tell thee, For mine is the world､ and the fulness thereof.

content: 13 Will I eat the flesh of mighty oxen? Or the blood of he-goats will I drink?
content_old: 13 Will I eat the flesh of mighty oxen? Or the blood of he-goats will I drink?

content: 14 Sacrifice to God a thankoffering, And pay to the Most High thy vows;
content_old: 14 Sacrifice to God a thankoffering, And pay to the Most High thy vows;

content: 15 Call upon me､ then､ in the day of distress, I will deliver thee､ that thou mayest glorify me.
content_old: 15 Call upon me､ then､ in the day of distress, I will deliver thee､ that thou mayest glorify me.

content: 16 But to the lawless one God saith､ What hast thou to do､ to recount my statutes? Or that thou hast taken up my covenant upon thy mouth?
content_old: 16 But to the lawless one God saith､ What hast thou to do､ to recount my statutes? Or that thou hast taken up my covenant upon thy mouth?

content: 17 Seeing that thou hast hated correction, And hast cast my words behind thee;
content_old: 17 Seeing that thou hast hated correction, And hast cast my words behind thee;

content: 18 lf thou sawest a thief then didst thou run with him,— And with adulterers hath been thy chosen life;
content_old: 18 lf thou sawest a thief then didst thou run with him,— And with adulterers hath been thy chosen life;

content: 19 Thy mouth hast thou thrust into wickedness, And thy tongue kept weaving deceit;
content_old: 19 Thy mouth hast thou thrust into wickedness, And thy tongue kept weaving deceit;

content: 20 Thou wouldst sit down— Against thine own brother wouldst thou speak, Against thine own mother’s son wouldst thou expose a fault:—
content_old: 20 Thou wouldst sit down— Against thine own brother wouldst thou speak, Against thine own mother’s son wouldst thou expose a fault:—

content: 21 These things hast thou done､ and I have kept silence, Thou thoughtest that I should really be like thyself, I will convict thee､ yea I will set thine offences in order before thine eyes.
content_old: 21 These things hast thou done､ and I have kept silence, Thou thoughtest that I should really be like thyself, I will convict thee､ yea I will set thine offences in order before thine eyes.

content: 22 Understand this､ I pray you､ ye forgetters of God, Lest I tear in pieces, and there be none to deliver:—
content_old: 22 Understand this､ I pray you､ ye forgetters of God, Lest I tear in pieces, and there be none to deliver:—

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David. When Nathan the Prophet had come to him, after he had gone in unto Bath-sheba.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David. When Nathan the Prophet had come to him, after he had gone in unto Bath-sheba.

content: 1 Be favourable unto me O God､ according to thy lovingkindness, And in the multitude of thy compassions blot out my transgressions;
content_old: 1 Be favourable unto me O God､ according to thy lovingkindness, And in the multitude of thy compassions blot out my transgressions;

content: 2 Thoroughly wash me from mine iniquity, And from my sin make me pure;
content_old: 2 Thoroughly wash me from mine iniquity, And from my sin make me pure;

content: 3 For my transgressions do I acknowledge, And my sin is before me continually:
content_old: 3 For my transgressions do I acknowledge, And my sin is before me continually:

content: 4 Against thee—against thee alone have I sinned､ And wickedness—in thine eyes have I done,— That thou mayest Be justified when thou speakest,— Be clear when thou judgest.
content_old: 4 Against thee—against thee alone have I sinned､ And wickedness—in thine eyes have I done,— That thou mayest Be justified when thou speakest,— Be clear when thou judgest.

content: 5 Lo! in iniquity was I brought forth, And in sin did my mother conceive me.
content_old: 5 Lo! in iniquity was I brought forth, And in sin did my mother conceive me.

content: 6 Lo! faithfulness hast thou desired in the inward parts, Yea in the hidden part wilt thou cause me to know wisdom.
content_old: 6 Lo! faithfulness hast thou desired in the inward parts, Yea in the hidden part wilt thou cause me to know wisdom.

content: 7 Wilt thou cleanse me from sin with hyssop､ That I may be pure? Wilt thou wash me, That I may be whiter than snow?
content_old: 7 Wilt thou cleanse me from sin with hyssop､ That I may be pure? Wilt thou wash me, That I may be whiter than snow?

content: 8 Wilt thou cause me to hear joy and gladness? The bones thou hast crushed would exult.
content_old: 8 Wilt thou cause me to hear joy and gladness? The bones thou hast crushed would exult.

content: 9 Hide thy face from my sins,— And all mine iniquities blot out;
content_old: 9 Hide thy face from my sins,— And all mine iniquities blot out;

content: 10 A pure heart create for me､ O God, And a steadfast spirit renew within me.
content_old: 10 A pure heart create for me､ O God, And a steadfast spirit renew within me.

content: 11 Do not cast me away from thy presence, And thy Holy Spirit do not take from me:
content_old: 11 Do not cast me away from thy presence, And thy Holy Spirit do not take from me:

content: 12 Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation, And with a willing spirit wilt thou uphold me:—
content_old: 12 Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation, And with a willing spirit wilt thou uphold me:—

content: 13 I would teach transgressors thy ways, And sinners unto thee should return.
content_old: 13 I would teach transgressors thy ways, And sinners unto thee should return.

content: 14 Rescue me from shed-blood､ O God､ the God of my salvation, My tongue should shout thy righteousness;
content_old: 14 Rescue me from shed-blood､ O God､ the God of my salvation, My tongue should shout thy righteousness;

content: 15 O My Lord! my lips wilt thou open, And my mouth shall declare thy praise.
content_old: 15 O My Lord! my lips wilt thou open, And my mouth shall declare thy praise.

content: 16 For thou wilt not desire sacrifice—that I should give it, Ascending-offering will not please:
content_old: 16 For thou wilt not desire sacrifice—that I should give it, Ascending-offering will not please:

content: 17 The sacrifices of God are a spirit that is broken,— A heart—broken and crushed O God､ thou wilt not despise.
content_old: 17 The sacrifices of God are a spirit that is broken,— A heart—broken and crushed O God､ thou wilt not despise.

content: 18 Do good､ in thy good-pleasure､ unto Zion, Wilt thou build the walls of Jerusalem!
content_old: 18 Do good､ in thy good-pleasure､ unto Zion, Wilt thou build the walls of Jerusalem!

content: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of Instruction, of David. When Doeg the Edomite went､ and told Saul; and said to him,—David hath entered the house of Ahimelech.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of Instruction, of David. When Doeg the Edomite went､ and told Saul; and said to him,—David hath entered the house of Ahimelech.

content: 1 Why dost thou boast thyself of wickedness､ O mighty man? The lovingkindness of GOD lasteth all the day.
content_old: 1 Why dost thou boast thyself of wickedness､ O mighty man? The lovingkindness of GOD lasteth all the day.

content: 2 Engulfing ruin doth thy tongue devise, Like a whetted razor､ working deceit;
content_old: 2 Engulfing ruin doth thy tongue devise, Like a whetted razor､ working deceit;

content: 3 Thou lovest Evil more than good, Falsehood､ more than speaking righteousness. Selah.
content_old: 3 Thou lovest Evil more than good, Falsehood､ more than speaking righteousness. Selah.

content: 4 Thou lovest all devouring words､ O deceitful tongue!
content_old: 4 Thou lovest all devouring words､ O deceitful tongue!

content: 5 GOD also will break thee down utterly,— He will snatch thee up and tear thee away tentless, And uproot thee､ out of the land of the living. Selah.
content_old: 5 GOD also will break thee down utterly,— He will snatch thee up and tear thee away tentless, And uproot thee､ out of the land of the living. Selah.

content: 6 The righteous shall both see and fear､ And over him shall laugh:
content_old: 6 The righteous shall both see and fear､ And over him shall laugh:

content: 7 Lo! the man who made not God his refuge,— But trusted in the abundance of his riches, Emboldened himself in his wealth!
content_old: 7 Lo! the man who made not God his refuge,— But trusted in the abundance of his riches, Emboldened himself in his wealth!

content: 8 But I am like a flourishing olive-tree､ in the house of God, I have put confidence in the lovingkindness of God､ for times age-abiding and beyond.
content_old: 8 But I am like a flourishing olive-tree､ in the house of God, I have put confidence in the lovingkindness of God､ for times age-abiding and beyond.

content: To the Chief Musician. On “Maḥalath.” A Psalm of Instruction, of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On “Maḥalath.” A Psalm of Instruction, of David.

content: 1 The impious hath said in his heart､ There is no God! They have acted corruptly､ They have wrought abominable perversity, There is none that doeth good:—
content_old: 1 The impious hath said in his heart､ There is no God! They have acted corruptly､ They have wrought abominable perversity, There is none that doeth good:—

content: 2 God out of the heavens looked down upon he sons of men,— To see whether there was one that shewed wisdom, Enquiring after God.
content_old: 2 God out of the heavens looked down upon he sons of men,— To see whether there was one that shewed wisdom, Enquiring after God.

content: 3 They all have turned back､ Together have they become tainted,— There is none that doeth good, Not so much as one!
content_old: 3 They all have turned back､ Together have they become tainted,— There is none that doeth good, Not so much as one!

content: 4 Are the workers of iniquity without knowledge? Devouring my people､ as they devour food? Upon God have they not called.
content_old: 4 Are the workers of iniquity without knowledge? Devouring my people､ as they devour food? Upon God have they not called.

content: 5 There have they been in great dread where no dread was, Because God hath scattered the bones of thy besieger,— Thou hast put him to shame､ Because God had rejected them.
content_old: 5 There have they been in great dread where no dread was, Because God hath scattered the bones of thy besieger,— Thou hast put him to shame､ Because God had rejected them.

content: To the Chief Musician: with Stringed Instruments. A Psalm of Instruction, of David. When the Ziphites came and said unto Saul, Is not David hiding himself with us ?
content_old: To the Chief Musician: with Stringed Instruments. A Psalm of Instruction, of David. When the Ziphites came and said unto Saul, Is not David hiding himself with us ?

content: 1 O God! by thine own Name save me, And by thine own strength wilt thou vindicate me?
content_old: 1 O God! by thine own Name save me, And by thine own strength wilt thou vindicate me?

content: 2 O God! Hear my prayer, Give ear to the sayings of my mouth;
content_old: 2 O God! Hear my prayer, Give ear to the sayings of my mouth;

content: 3 For aliens have risen up against me､ And men of violence have sought my life, They have not set God before them. Selah.
content_old: 3 For aliens have risen up against me､ And men of violence have sought my life, They have not set God before them. Selah.

content: 4 Lo! God is bringing me help, My Lord is with the upholders of my life;
content_old: 4 Lo! God is bringing me help, My Lord is with the upholders of my life;

content: 5 Let him turn back the mischief upon mine adversaries, In thy faithfulness destroy them!
content_old: 5 Let him turn back the mischief upon mine adversaries, In thy faithfulness destroy them!

content: 6 With a freewill-offering will I sacrifice unto thee, I will praise thy Name､ O Yahweh､ for it is good;
content_old: 6 With a freewill-offering will I sacrifice unto thee, I will praise thy Name､ O Yahweh､ for it is good;

content: To the Chief Musician: with stringed Instruments. A Psalm of Instruction, of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician: with stringed Instruments. A Psalm of Instruction, of David.

content: 1 Give ear､ O God､ to my prayer, And do not hide thyself from my supplication:
content_old: 1 Give ear､ O God､ to my prayer, And do not hide thyself from my supplication:

content: 2 Attend unto me､ and answer me, I may ramble in my complaining､ And be driven to and fro—
content_old: 2 Attend unto me､ and answer me, I may ramble in my complaining､ And be driven to and fro—

content: 3 Because of the noise of the enemy､ By reason of the oppression of the lawless one, For they would let trouble drop upon me, And in anger would they entrap me.
content_old: 3 Because of the noise of the enemy､ By reason of the oppression of the lawless one, For they would let trouble drop upon me, And in anger would they entrap me.

content: 4 My heart would writhe within me, And the terrors of Death have fallen upon me:
content_old: 4 My heart would writhe within me, And the terrors of Death have fallen upon me:

content: 5 Fear and trembling would enter me, And there would have overwhelmed me—a horror!
content_old: 5 Fear and trembling would enter me, And there would have overwhelmed me—a horror!

content: 6 Then I said— Oh that there were given me a pinion､ like a dove, I would fly away and be at rest;
content_old: 6 Then I said— Oh that there were given me a pinion､ like a dove, I would fly away and be at rest;

content: 7 Lo! I would take a distant flight, I would tarry in the wilderness. Selah.
content_old: 7 Lo! I would take a distant flight, I would tarry in the wilderness. Selah.

content: 8 I would hasten mine escape, From rushing wind､ from storm.
content_old: 8 I would hasten mine escape, From rushing wind､ from storm.

content: 9 Confuse､ O My Lord, divide their speech, For I have seen violence and contention in the city;
content_old: 9 Confuse､ O My Lord, divide their speech, For I have seen violence and contention in the city;

content: 10 Day and night they go round her､ upon her walls, And trouble and misery are in her midst;
content_old: 10 Day and night they go round her､ upon her walls, And trouble and misery are in her midst;

content: 11 Engulfing ruin is in her midst, And there depart not from her broadway､ oppression and deceit.
content_old: 11 Engulfing ruin is in her midst, And there depart not from her broadway､ oppression and deceit.

content: 12 For it is not an enemy that reproacheth me､ Or I could bear it,— Not one that hath hated me､ who against me hath magnified himself, Or I might hide myself from him;
content_old: 12 For it is not an enemy that reproacheth me､ Or I could bear it,— Not one that hath hated me､ who against me hath magnified himself, Or I might hide myself from him;

content: 13 But it is thou､ a man esteemed as mine equal, Mine associate､ and mine acquaintance;
content_old: 13 But it is thou､ a man esteemed as mine equal, Mine associate､ and mine acquaintance;

content: 14 So that together have we been wont to find sweetness in counsel, In the house of God used we to walk in the throng.
content_old: 14 So that together have we been wont to find sweetness in counsel, In the house of God used we to walk in the throng.

content: 15 Desolations on them! Let them go down into hades alive, For wicked doings are at home within them.
content_old: 15 Desolations on them! Let them go down into hades alive, For wicked doings are at home within them.

content: 16 I unto God will cry,— And Yahweh will save me.
content_old: 16 I unto God will cry,— And Yahweh will save me.

content: 17 At evening and morning and high noon have I been wont to lament and complain, And he hath heard my voice!
content_old: 17 At evening and morning and high noon have I been wont to lament and complain, And he hath heard my voice!

content: 18 He hath completely redeemed my soul､ out of the attack upon me, For in multitudes were they in conflict with me.
content_old: 18 He hath completely redeemed my soul､ out of the attack upon me, For in multitudes were they in conflict with me.

content: 19 GOD will hear､ Yea He will humble them who aforetime sat enthroned. Selah. With whom are no changings, Neither have they revered God.
content_old: 19 GOD will hear､ Yea He will humble them who aforetime sat enthroned. Selah. With whom are no changings, Neither have they revered God.

content: 20 He hath thrust forth his hands､ against them he was wont to salute, He hath violated his covenant;
content_old: 20 He hath thrust forth his hands､ against them he was wont to salute, He hath violated his covenant;

content: 21 Smoother than curds were the words of his mouth､ But war was in his heart,— Softer his words than oil､ Yet they were drawn swords!
content_old: 21 Smoother than curds were the words of his mouth､ But war was in his heart,— Softer his words than oil､ Yet they were drawn swords!

content: 22 Cast upon Yahweh thy lot､ and he will sustain thee: He will not suffer､ to times age-abiding､ the righteous one to be shaken.
content_old: 22 Cast upon Yahweh thy lot､ and he will sustain thee: He will not suffer､ to times age-abiding､ the righteous one to be shaken.

content: To the Chief Musician. Upon “The Dove of God from the distant Sea.” David’s. A precious Psalm. When the Philistines seized him in Gath.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. Upon “The Dove of God from the distant Sea.” David’s. A precious Psalm. When the Philistines seized him in Gath.

content: 1 Shew me favour､ O God, For weak man hath panted for me, All the day a fighter oppresseth me:
content_old: 1 Shew me favour､ O God, For weak man hath panted for me, All the day a fighter oppresseth me:

content: 2 Mine adversaries have panted all the day, For many are fighting with me loftily.
content_old: 2 Mine adversaries have panted all the day, For many are fighting with me loftily.

content: 3 What day I am afraid I unto thee will direct my confidence.
content_old: 3 What day I am afraid I unto thee will direct my confidence.

content: 4 In God I will praise his cause,— In God have I trusted､ I will not fear, What can flesh do unto me?
content_old: 4 In God I will praise his cause,— In God have I trusted､ I will not fear, What can flesh do unto me?

content: 5 All the day they wrest my words, Against me all their devices are for mischief;
content_old: 5 All the day they wrest my words, Against me all their devices are for mischief;

content: 6 They stir up strife—they lie hid､ They mark my steps,— Seeing they have waited for my life.
content_old: 6 They stir up strife—they lie hid､ They mark my steps,— Seeing they have waited for my life.

content: 7 Because of iniquity recompense thou them,— In anger bring thou down the peoples, O God.
content_old: 7 Because of iniquity recompense thou them,— In anger bring thou down the peoples, O God.

content: 8 My wandering hast thou recorded,— Put thou my tears in thy bottle, Are they not in thy record?
content_old: 8 My wandering hast thou recorded,— Put thou my tears in thy bottle, Are they not in thy record?

content: 9 Then shall my foes turn back, in the day I cry, This I know, for God is mine!
content_old: 9 Then shall my foes turn back, in the day I cry, This I know, for God is mine!

content: 10 In God will I praise with good cause: In Yahweh will I praise with good cause;
content_old: 10 In God will I praise with good cause: In Yahweh will I praise with good cause;

content: 11 In God have I trusted､ I will not fear, What can a son of earth do unto me?
content_old: 11 In God have I trusted､ I will not fear, What can a son of earth do unto me?

content: 12 Upon me O God､ are thy vows, I will pay back praises unto thee.
content_old: 12 Upon me O God､ are thy vows, I will pay back praises unto thee.

content: To the Chief Musician. “Do not destroy.” A precious Psalm of David. When he fled from the face of Saul into the Cave.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. “Do not destroy.” A precious Psalm of David. When he fled from the face of Saul into the Cave.

content: 1 Shew me favour､ O God､ Shew me favour, For in thee hath my soul sought refuge,— And in the shadow of thy wings will I seek refuge Until the storm of ruin pass by,
content_old: 1 Shew me favour､ O God､ Shew me favour, For in thee hath my soul sought refuge,— And in the shadow of thy wings will I seek refuge Until the storm of ruin pass by,

content: 2 I will cry unto God Most High, Unto GOD, who accomplisheth on my behalf:
content_old: 2 I will cry unto God Most High, Unto GOD, who accomplisheth on my behalf:

content: 3 He will send out of heaven､ that he may save me､ He who is panting for me hath reproached. Selah. God will send out his lovingkindness and his faithfulness.
content_old: 3 He will send out of heaven､ that he may save me､ He who is panting for me hath reproached. Selah. God will send out his lovingkindness and his faithfulness.

content: 4 My soul is in the midst of lions､ I lie down amidst flames,— As for the sons of men Their teeth are spear and arrows, And their tongue is a sharp sword.
content_old: 4 My soul is in the midst of lions､ I lie down amidst flames,— As for the sons of men Their teeth are spear and arrows, And their tongue is a sharp sword.

content: 5 Be exalted Above the Heavens, O God, Above all the earth､ thy glory!
content_old: 5 Be exalted Above the Heavens, O God, Above all the earth､ thy glory!

content: 6 A net did they fix for my steps､ My soul was bowed down,— They digged before me a pit, They fell into the midst thereof! Selah.
content_old: 6 A net did they fix for my steps､ My soul was bowed down,— They digged before me a pit, They fell into the midst thereof! Selah.

content: 7 Fixed is my heart､ O God��� Fixed is my heart, I will sing､ and touch the strings.
content_old: 7 Fixed is my heart､ O God��� Fixed is my heart, I will sing､ and touch the strings.

content: 8 Awake､ mine honour､ Awake､ harp and lyre､ I will awaken the dawn;
content_old: 8 Awake､ mine honour､ Awake､ harp and lyre､ I will awaken the dawn;

content: 9 I will thank thee､ among the peoples､ O My Lord, I will praise thee in song､ among the races of men.
content_old: 9 I will thank thee､ among the peoples､ O My Lord, I will praise thee in song､ among the races of men.

content: 10 For great､ unto the heavens is thy loving-kindness, And unto the skies thy faithfulness.
content_old: 10 For great､ unto the heavens is thy loving-kindness, And unto the skies thy faithfulness.

content: To the Chief Musician. “Do not Destroy.” A precious Psalm of-David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. “Do not Destroy.” A precious Psalm of-David.

content: 1 Are ye indeed silent when righteousness ye should speak? When with equity ye should judge､ O ye sons of men?
content_old: 1 Are ye indeed silent when righteousness ye should speak? When with equity ye should judge､ O ye sons of men?

content: 2 Aye! ye all do work perversity,— Throughout the land your hands weigh out violence.
content_old: 2 Aye! ye all do work perversity,— Throughout the land your hands weigh out violence.

content: 3 Lawless men have been estranged from birth, They have gone astray from their nativity､ speaking falsehood;
content_old: 3 Lawless men have been estranged from birth, They have gone astray from their nativity､ speaking falsehood;

content: 4 Their poison is like unto the poison of a serpent, Like the deaf adder､ that stoppeth his ear;
content_old: 4 Their poison is like unto the poison of a serpent, Like the deaf adder､ that stoppeth his ear;

content: 5 That will not hearken to the voice of whisperers, Though the wise one try to bind him with spells.
content_old: 5 That will not hearken to the voice of whisperers, Though the wise one try to bind him with spells.

content: 6 O God! break away their teeth in their mouth, The biters of the young lions knock thou out､ O Yahweh!
content_old: 6 O God! break away their teeth in their mouth, The biters of the young lions knock thou out､ O Yahweh!

content: 7 Let such men flow away like waters that disperse themselves: He prepareth his arrow､ Like grass let them be cut down:
content_old: 7 Let such men flow away like waters that disperse themselves: He prepareth his arrow､ Like grass let them be cut down:

content: 8 Like a snail､ which melteth away as it goeth, An untimely birth of a woman､ which hath not seen the sun:
content_old: 8 Like a snail､ which melteth away as it goeth, An untimely birth of a woman､ which hath not seen the sun:

content: 9 Before your kettles can perceive the kindled bramble Be he green or be he withered he shall be swept away.
content_old: 9 Before your kettles can perceive the kindled bramble Be he green or be he withered he shall be swept away.

content: 10 The righteous man will rejoice when he hath seen an avenging, His feet will he bathe in the blood of the lawless one:—
content_old: 10 The righteous man will rejoice when he hath seen an avenging, His feet will he bathe in the blood of the lawless one:—

content: To the Chief Musician. “Do not Destroy.” A precious Psalm of David. When Saul sent, and they watched the house, to kill him.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. “Do not Destroy.” A precious Psalm of David. When Saul sent, and they watched the house, to kill him.

content: 1 Rescue me from my foes､ O my God, From them who lift themselves up against me wilt thou set me on high:
content_old: 1 Rescue me from my foes､ O my God, From them who lift themselves up against me wilt thou set me on high:

content: 2 Rescue me､ from the workers of iniquity, And from the men of bloodshed save me.
content_old: 2 Rescue me､ from the workers of iniquity, And from the men of bloodshed save me.

content: 3 For lo! they have lain in wait for my life､ Mighty ones stir up strife against me, Without transgression of mine､ and without sin of mine､ O Yahweh;
content_old: 3 For lo! they have lain in wait for my life､ Mighty ones stir up strife against me, Without transgression of mine､ and without sin of mine､ O Yahweh;

content: 4 For no iniquity do they run that they may take their stand, Rouse thyself to meet me､ and see.
content_old: 4 For no iniquity do they run that they may take their stand, Rouse thyself to meet me､ and see.

content: 5 Thou､ therefore､ O Yahweh､ God of hosts､ God of Israel Awake､ to visit all the nations, Do not shew favour to any iniquitous traitors. Selah.
content_old: 5 Thou､ therefore､ O Yahweh､ God of hosts､ God of Israel Awake､ to visit all the nations, Do not shew favour to any iniquitous traitors. Selah.

content: 6 They return at evening､ They growl like a dog, And go round the city.
content_old: 6 They return at evening､ They growl like a dog, And go round the city.

content: 7 Lo! they belch forth with their mouth､ Swords are in their lips, For say they Who doth hear?
content_old: 7 Lo! they belch forth with their mouth､ Swords are in their lips, For say they Who doth hear?

content: 8 Thou､ therefore��� O Yahweh､ wilt laugh at them, Thou wilt mock at all nations.
content_old: 8 Thou､ therefore��� O Yahweh､ wilt laugh at them, Thou wilt mock at all nations.

content: 9 O my Strength unto thee will I make melody, For God is my high tower.
content_old: 9 O my Strength unto thee will I make melody, For God is my high tower.

content: 10 My God of lovingkindness will come to meet me, God will let me look on mine adversaries.
content_old: 10 My God of lovingkindness will come to meet me, God will let me look on mine adversaries.

content: 11 Do not slay them､ lest my people forget､ Cause them to wander by thy strength､ and prostrate them, Thou our shield, O Lord!
content_old: 11 Do not slay them､ lest my people forget､ Cause them to wander by thy strength､ and prostrate them, Thou our shield, O Lord!

content: 12 The sin of their mouth､ The word of their lips Let them then be captured in their pride, Both for the oath and for the deception they record.
content_old: 12 The sin of their mouth､ The word of their lips Let them then be captured in their pride, Both for the oath and for the deception they record.

content: 13 Bring to a full end in wrath､ Bring to a full end､ that they be no more,— That men may know that God is ruling in Jacob, Unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
content_old: 13 Bring to a full end in wrath､ Bring to a full end､ that they be no more,— That men may know that God is ruling in Jacob, Unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

content: 14 Let them return､ then､ at evening､ Let them growl like a dog, And go round the city.
content_old: 14 Let them return､ then､ at evening､ Let them growl like a dog, And go round the city.

content: 15 They may prowl about for food,— And if they are not satisfied then let them whine!
content_old: 15 They may prowl about for food,— And if they are not satisfied then let them whine!

content: 16 But I will sing thy power､ And will shout aloud､ in the morning､ thy lovingkindness,— For thou hast become a refuge for me, And a place to flee to in the day of my distress.
content_old: 16 But I will sing thy power､ And will shout aloud､ in the morning､ thy lovingkindness,— For thou hast become a refuge for me, And a place to flee to in the day of my distress.

content: To the Chief Musician. Upon “The Lily of Testimony.” A precious Psalm of David, to instruct. When he waged war with Aram-neharaim､ and with Aram-zobah,—and then Joab returned and smote of Edom in the Valley of Salt, twelve thousand.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. Upon “The Lily of Testimony.” A precious Psalm of David, to instruct. When he waged war with Aram-neharaim､ and with Aram-zobah,—and then Joab returned and smote of Edom in the Valley of Salt, twelve thousand.

content: 1 O God､ thou hast rejected us—hast scattered us, Thou hast been angry､ Wilt thou restore us?
content_old: 1 O God､ thou hast rejected us—hast scattered us, Thou hast been angry､ Wilt thou restore us?

content: 2 Thou hast shaken the land—hast rent it, Heal thou the fractures thereof—for it hath tottered:
content_old: 2 Thou hast shaken the land—hast rent it, Heal thou the fractures thereof—for it hath tottered:

content: 3 Thou hast suffered thy people to see hardship, Thou hast let them drink the wine of confusion.
content_old: 3 Thou hast suffered thy people to see hardship, Thou hast let them drink the wine of confusion.

content: 4 Thou hadst given—to them that revere thee—a banner､ to float aloft, Because of thy faithfulness. Selah.
content_old: 4 Thou hadst given—to them that revere thee—a banner､ to float aloft, Because of thy faithfulness. Selah.

content: 5 That thy beloved ones may be delivered Save thou with thine own right hand—and answer us.
content_old: 5 That thy beloved ones may be delivered Save thou with thine own right hand—and answer us.

content: 6 God hath spoken in his holiness— I will exult! I will apportion Shechem, And the vale of Succoth will I measure out;
content_old: 6 God hath spoken in his holiness— I will exult! I will apportion Shechem, And the vale of Succoth will I measure out;

content: 7 Mine is Gilead—and mine Manasseh､ But Ephraim is the defence､ of my head, Judah is my commander’s staff;
content_old: 7 Mine is Gilead—and mine Manasseh､ But Ephraim is the defence､ of my head, Judah is my commander’s staff;

content: 8 Moab is my wash-bowl､ Upon Edom will I throw my shoe, Over Philistia! raise a shout of triumph.
content_old: 8 Moab is my wash-bowl､ Upon Edom will I throw my shoe, Over Philistia! raise a shout of triumph.

content: 9 Who will conduct me to a fortified city? Who will lead me as far as Edom!
content_old: 9 Who will conduct me to a fortified city? Who will lead me as far as Edom!

content: 10 Is it not thou､ O God?—thou hast rejected us! And wilt thou not go forth､ O God､ with our hosts?
content_old: 10 Is it not thou､ O God?—thou hast rejected us! And wilt thou not go forth､ O God､ with our hosts?

content: 11 Grant us help out of distress, For vain is the deliverance of man:
content_old: 11 Grant us help out of distress, For vain is the deliverance of man:

content: To the Chief Musician. Upon a Stringed Instrument. David’s.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. Upon a Stringed Instrument. David’s.

content: 1 Hear､ O God､ my loud cry, Attend unto my prayer:
content_old: 1 Hear､ O God､ my loud cry, Attend unto my prayer:

content: 2 From the end of the earth unto thee do I cry､ When my heart fainteth away, Unto a rock that is higher than I wilt thou lead me.
content_old: 2 From the end of the earth unto thee do I cry､ When my heart fainteth away, Unto a rock that is higher than I wilt thou lead me.

content: 3 For thou hast been A Refuge to me. A Tower of Strength､ from the face of the foe.
content_old: 3 For thou hast been A Refuge to me. A Tower of Strength､ from the face of the foe.

content: 4 I would be a guest in thy tent to the ages, I would seek refuge in the concealment of thy wings. Selah.
content_old: 4 I would be a guest in thy tent to the ages, I would seek refuge in the concealment of thy wings. Selah.

content: 5 For thou､ O God hast hearkened to my vows, Thou hast granted a possession､ unto them who revere thy Name.
content_old: 5 For thou､ O God hast hearkened to my vows, Thou hast granted a possession､ unto them who revere thy Name.

content: 6 Days—unto the days of the king wilt thou add. His years as of generation after generation:
content_old: 6 Days—unto the days of the king wilt thou add. His years as of generation after generation:

content: 7 Let him retain his seat age-abidingly before God, Appoint that ovingkindness and faithfulness may watch over him!
content_old: 7 Let him retain his seat age-abidingly before God, Appoint that ovingkindness and faithfulness may watch over him!

content: To the Chief Musician. On Jeduthun—A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On Jeduthun—A Melody of David.

content: 1 Surely towards God silence becometh my soul, From him is my salvation:
content_old: 1 Surely towards God silence becometh my soul, From him is my salvation:

content: 2 Surely he is my rock and my salvation, My high tower—I shall not be greatly shaken!
content_old: 2 Surely he is my rock and my salvation, My high tower—I shall not be greatly shaken!

content: 3 How long will ye shout at a man? Ye shall be crushed all of you,— Like a wall that bulgeth,—a fence pushed in!
content_old: 3 How long will ye shout at a man? Ye shall be crushed all of you,— Like a wall that bulgeth,—a fence pushed in!

content: 4 Surely from his elevation they have taken counsel to thrust him down､ They accept falsehood,— With his mouth they each of them bless, But inwardly they revile. Selah.
content_old: 4 Surely from his elevation they have taken counsel to thrust him down､ They accept falsehood,— With his mouth they each of them bless, But inwardly they revile. Selah.

content: 5 Surely towards God be thou silent､ my soul, For from him is mine expectation:
content_old: 5 Surely towards God be thou silent､ my soul, For from him is mine expectation:

content: 6 Surely he is my rock､ and my salvation, My high tower—I shall not be shaken!
content_old: 6 Surely he is my rock､ and my salvation, My high tower—I shall not be shaken!

content: 7 Upon God depend my salvation and mine honour, My rock of strength､ my refuge are in God.
content_old: 7 Upon God depend my salvation and mine honour, My rock of strength､ my refuge are in God.

content: 8 Trust ye in him all ye assembly of the people､ Pour out､ before him､ your heart, God is a refuge for us. Selah.
content_old: 8 Trust ye in him all ye assembly of the people､ Pour out､ before him､ your heart, God is a refuge for us. Selah.

content: 9 Surely vanity are men of low degree､ Deception men of high degree,— In the balances they go up, They are made of vanity altogether.
content_old: 9 Surely vanity are men of low degree､ Deception men of high degree,— In the balances they go up, They are made of vanity altogether.

content: 10 Do not trust in extortion､ Nor with robbery become vain,— As for wealth when it beareth fruit Do not set thereon your heart.
content_old: 10 Do not trust in extortion､ Nor with robbery become vain,— As for wealth when it beareth fruit Do not set thereon your heart.

content: 11 One thing hath God spoken､ Two things there are which I have heard, That power belongeth unto God;
content_old: 11 One thing hath God spoken､ Two things there are which I have heard, That power belongeth unto God;

content: A Melody of David. When he was in the Wilderness of Judah.
content_old: A Melody of David. When he was in the Wilderness of Judah.

content: 1 O God､ my GOD thou art､ Earnestly do I desire thee,— My soul thirsteth for thee, My flesh fainteth for thee In a land—dry､ and weary for want for water,—
content_old: 1 O God､ my GOD thou art､ Earnestly do I desire thee,— My soul thirsteth for thee, My flesh fainteth for thee In a land—dry､ and weary for want for water,—

content: 2 In like manner as in the sanctuary I have had vision of thee To behold thy power and thy glory.
content_old: 2 In like manner as in the sanctuary I have had vision of thee To behold thy power and thy glory.

content: 3 Because better is thy lovingkindness than life My lips aloud shall praise thee!
content_old: 3 Because better is thy lovingkindness than life My lips aloud shall praise thee!

content: 4 Thus will I bless thee while I live, In thy Name will I lift up mine outspread hands:
content_old: 4 Thus will I bless thee while I live, In thy Name will I lift up mine outspread hands:

content: 5 As with fatness and richness shall my soul be satisfied, And with joyfully shouting lips shall my mouth utter praise.
content_old: 5 As with fatness and richness shall my soul be satisfied, And with joyfully shouting lips shall my mouth utter praise.

content: 6 Should I call thee to mind upon my couch In the watches of the night would I breathe soft speech of thee.
content_old: 6 Should I call thee to mind upon my couch In the watches of the night would I breathe soft speech of thee.

content: 7 For thou hast become a help unto me,— And in the shadow of thy wings will I shout for joy.
content_old: 7 For thou hast become a help unto me,— And in the shadow of thy wings will I shout for joy.

content: 8 My soul hath run clinging to thee, On me hath thy right hand laid hold.
content_old: 8 My soul hath run clinging to thee, On me hath thy right hand laid hold.

content: 9 When they to crush it would seek my life They shall go into the lower parts of the earth:
content_old: 9 When they to crush it would seek my life They shall go into the lower parts of the earth:

content: 10 Every one shall be given up into the power of the sword, The portion of jackals shall they become.
content_old: 10 Every one shall be given up into the power of the sword, The portion of jackals shall they become.

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.

content: 1 Hear､ O God､ my voice when I complain, From dread peril by the foe wilt thou guard my life.
content_old: 1 Hear､ O God､ my voice when I complain, From dread peril by the foe wilt thou guard my life.

content: 2 Wilt thou hide me From the conclave of evil-doers, From the crowd of workers of iniquity.
content_old: 2 Wilt thou hide me From the conclave of evil-doers, From the crowd of workers of iniquity.

content: 3 Who have sharpened､ like a sword､ their tongue, Have made ready their arrow—a bitter word;
content_old: 3 Who have sharpened､ like a sword､ their tongue, Have made ready their arrow—a bitter word;

content: 4 To shoot､ in secret places､ at the blameless one, Suddenly they shoot at him､ and fear not.
content_old: 4 To shoot､ in secret places､ at the blameless one, Suddenly they shoot at him､ and fear not.

content: 5 They strengthen for them a wicked word､ They talk of hiding snares, They have said､Who can see them?
content_old: 5 They strengthen for them a wicked word､ They talk of hiding snares, They have said､Who can see them?

content: 6 They devise perverse things､ They have completed the device well devised, Both the intent of each one､ and the mind are unsearchable.
content_old: 6 They devise perverse things､ They have completed the device well devised, Both the intent of each one､ and the mind are unsearchable.

content: 7 Once let God have shot at them an arrow Suddenly have appeared their own wounds!
content_old: 7 Once let God have shot at them an arrow Suddenly have appeared their own wounds!

content: 8 When they were to have ruined another their tongue smote themselves, All who observe them take flight.
content_old: 8 When they were to have ruined another their tongue smote themselves, All who observe them take flight.

content: 9 Therefore have all men feared,— And have told the doing of God､ And his work have considered.
content_old: 9 Therefore have all men feared,— And have told the doing of God､ And his work have considered.

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David—a Song.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David—a Song.

content: 1 Thine are silence and praise､ O God､ in Zion,— And to thee shall be paid the vow.
content_old: 1 Thine are silence and praise､ O God､ in Zion,— And to thee shall be paid the vow.

content: 2 Thou hearer of prayer! Unto thee shall all flesh come.
content_old: 2 Thou hearer of prayer! Unto thee shall all flesh come.

content: 3 Iniquitous things have been too strong for me, As for our transgressions wilt thou by propitiation remove them.
content_old: 3 Iniquitous things have been too strong for me, As for our transgressions wilt thou by propitiation remove them.

content: 4 How happy the man thou shalt choose and bring near! He shall abide in thy courts,— We shall be satisfied with The blessing of thy house, The holiness of thy temple.
content_old: 4 How happy the man thou shalt choose and bring near! He shall abide in thy courts,— We shall be satisfied with The blessing of thy house, The holiness of thy temple.

content: 5 By things reverend in righteousness wilt thou answer us､ O God of our salvation, The confidence of all the ends of the earth､ And of the sea far away;
content_old: 5 By things reverend in righteousness wilt thou answer us､ O God of our salvation, The confidence of all the ends of the earth､ And of the sea far away;

content: 6 Who setteth fast the mountains by his strength, Being girded with might;
content_old: 6 Who setteth fast the mountains by his strength, Being girded with might;

content: 7 Who stilleth The noise of the seas､ The noise of their rolling waves, and The tumult of races of men?
content_old: 7 Who stilleth The noise of the seas､ The noise of their rolling waves, and The tumult of races of men?

content: 8 Yea the dwellers in the uttermost parts have feared at thy tokens, The goings forth of morning and evening thou causest to shout for joy.
content_old: 8 Yea the dwellers in the uttermost parts have feared at thy tokens, The goings forth of morning and evening thou causest to shout for joy.

content: 9 Thou hast visited the earth､ and made it abound､ Abundantly dost thou enrich it— The channel of God is full of waters, Thou preparest their corn, Yea thus dost thou prepare it:
content_old: 9 Thou hast visited the earth､ and made it abound､ Abundantly dost thou enrich it— The channel of God is full of waters, Thou preparest their corn, Yea thus dost thou prepare it:

content: 10 The ridges thereof drenching､ Settling the furrows thereof, With myriad drops dost thou soften it, The sprouting thereof dost thou bless.
content_old: 10 The ridges thereof drenching､ Settling the furrows thereof, With myriad drops dost thou soften it, The sprouting thereof dost thou bless.

content: 11 Thou hast set a crown upon thy year of bounty, And thy tracks drop fatness;
content_old: 11 Thou hast set a crown upon thy year of bounty, And thy tracks drop fatness;

content: 12 Fruitful are the pastures of the wilderness, And with exultation the hills do gird themselves.
content_old: 12 Fruitful are the pastures of the wilderness, And with exultation the hills do gird themselves.

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melodious Song.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melodious Song.

content: 1 Make a joyful noise unto God､ all the earth;
content_old: 1 Make a joyful noise unto God､ all the earth;

content: 2 Praise ye in song the glory of his Name, Celebrate the glory of his praise:
content_old: 2 Praise ye in song the glory of his Name, Celebrate the glory of his praise:

content: 3 Say unto God— How fearful in thy doings, Through the abounding of thy power shall thy foes come cringing unto thee;
content_old: 3 Say unto God— How fearful in thy doings, Through the abounding of thy power shall thy foes come cringing unto thee;

content: 4 All the earth shall bow themselves down to thee､ And sing praises unto thee. Shall praise in song thy Name. Selah.
content_old: 4 All the earth shall bow themselves down to thee､ And sing praises unto thee. Shall praise in song thy Name. Selah.

content: 5 Come and see the doings of God,— Fearful in deed toward the sons of men:
content_old: 5 Come and see the doings of God,— Fearful in deed toward the sons of men:

content: 6 He turned the sea into dry land､ Through the stream crossed they over on foot, There did we rejoice in him:
content_old: 6 He turned the sea into dry land､ Through the stream crossed they over on foot, There did we rejoice in him:

content: 7 Who ruleth､ in his might､ unto times age-abiding, His eyes over the nations keep watch, The rebellious let them not exalt themselves. Selah.
content_old: 7 Who ruleth､ in his might､ unto times age-abiding, His eyes over the nations keep watch, The rebellious let them not exalt themselves. Selah.

content: 8 Bless our God､ O ye peoples, And cause to be heard､ the sound of his praise;—
content_old: 8 Bless our God､ O ye peoples, And cause to be heard､ the sound of his praise;—

content: 9 Who hath set our soul among the living, And hath not suffered our foot to slip.
content_old: 9 Who hath set our soul among the living, And hath not suffered our foot to slip.

content: 10 For thou didst prove us､ O God, Thou didst refine us､ according to the refining of silver:
content_old: 10 For thou didst prove us､ O God, Thou didst refine us､ according to the refining of silver:

content: 11 Thou didst bring us into the hunter’s net, Thou didst lay a load upon our loins;
content_old: 11 Thou didst bring us into the hunter’s net, Thou didst lay a load upon our loins;

content: 12 Thou didst let men ride at our head; We went into fire and into water, But thou didst bring us forth into freedom.
content_old: 12 Thou didst let men ride at our head; We went into fire and into water, But thou didst bring us forth into freedom.

content: 13 I will enter thy house with ascending-sacrifices, I will pay unto thee my vows,
content_old: 13 I will enter thy house with ascending-sacrifices, I will pay unto thee my vows,

content: 14 Which my lips uttered, And my mouth spake､ in my distress.
content_old: 14 Which my lips uttered, And my mouth spake､ in my distress.

content: 15 Ascending-sacrifices of fatlings will I cause to ascend unto thee､ With the perfume of rams, I will offer bulls､ with he-goats. Selah.
content_old: 15 Ascending-sacrifices of fatlings will I cause to ascend unto thee､ With the perfume of rams, I will offer bulls､ with he-goats. Selah.

content: 16 Come! hearken—that I may recount, all ye reverers of God, What he hath done for my soul:—
content_old: 16 Come! hearken—that I may recount, all ye reverers of God, What he hath done for my soul:—

content: 17 Unto him—with my mouth did I cry, And high praise was under my tongue.
content_old: 17 Unto him—with my mouth did I cry, And high praise was under my tongue.

content: 18 If iniquity I had cared for in my heart My Lord had not heard me!
content_old: 18 If iniquity I had cared for in my heart My Lord had not heard me!

content: 19 But in truth God hath heard, He hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
content_old: 19 But in truth God hath heard, He hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

content: To the Chief Musician. With stringed Instruments. A Melody, a Song.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. With stringed Instruments. A Melody, a Song.

content: 1 God be favourable to us and bless us, Cause his face to shine upon us. Selah.
content_old: 1 God be favourable to us and bless us, Cause his face to shine upon us. Selah.

content: 2 That thy way may be known throughout the earth, Throughout all nations thy saving help!
content_old: 2 That thy way may be known throughout the earth, Throughout all nations thy saving help!

content: 3 Peoples will praise thee､ O God, Peoples will all of them praise thee
content_old: 3 Peoples will praise thee､ O God, Peoples will all of them praise thee

content: 4 Races of men will be glad and shout for joy,— Because thou wilt judge peoples with equity, And races of men throughout the earth thou wilt lead. Selah.
content_old: 4 Races of men will be glad and shout for joy,— Because thou wilt judge peoples with equity, And races of men throughout the earth thou wilt lead. Selah.

content: 5 Peoples will praise thee､ O God,— Peoples will all of them praise thee.
content_old: 5 Peoples will praise thee､ O God,— Peoples will all of them praise thee.

content: 6 Earth will have given her increase, God､ our own God､ will bless us:
content_old: 6 Earth will have given her increase, God､ our own God､ will bless us:

content: To the Chief Musician. David’s. A Melody, a Song.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. David’s. A Melody, a Song.

content: 1 Let God arise､ let his enemies be scattered, Yea let them that hate him flee before him:
content_old: 1 Let God arise､ let his enemies be scattered, Yea let them that hate him flee before him:

content: 2 As smoke is driven about Let them be driven about,— As wax is melted before a fire Let the lawless perish before God.
content_old: 2 As smoke is driven about Let them be driven about,— As wax is melted before a fire Let the lawless perish before God.

content: 3 But let the righteous be glad､ let them exult before God, Yea let them rejoice with gladness.
content_old: 3 But let the righteous be glad､ let them exult before God, Yea let them rejoice with gladness.

content: 4 Sing ye to God､ Make music of his Name,— Lift up (a song)､ to him that rideth through the waste plains,— Since Yah is his name exult ye before him.
content_old: 4 Sing ye to God､ Make music of his Name,— Lift up (a song)､ to him that rideth through the waste plains,— Since Yah is his name exult ye before him.

content: 5 The father of the fatherless､ And the advocate of widows Is God､ in his holy habitation.
content_old: 5 The father of the fatherless､ And the advocate of widows Is God､ in his holy habitation.

content: 6 God is he that causeth the solitary to dwell in a home､ That bringeth out prisoners into prosperity, But the rebellious have made their habitation in a sunburnt land.
content_old: 6 God is he that causeth the solitary to dwell in a home､ That bringeth out prisoners into prosperity, But the rebellious have made their habitation in a sunburnt land.

content: 7 O God! When thou camest forth before thy people, When thou didst stride through the wilderness Selah.
content_old: 7 O God! When thou camest forth before thy people, When thou didst stride through the wilderness Selah.

content: 8 Earth trembled､ Yea the heavens dripped at the presence of God,— This Sinai—at the presence of God､ the God of Israel.
content_old: 8 Earth trembled､ Yea the heavens dripped at the presence of God,— This Sinai—at the presence of God､ the God of Israel.

content: 9 A bounteous rain dost thou shed abroad､ O God､ upon thine inheritance, When exhausted thou thyself hast supported it:
content_old: 9 A bounteous rain dost thou shed abroad､ O God､ upon thine inheritance, When exhausted thou thyself hast supported it:

content: 10 Thy living host have remained therein, Thou dost provide､ in thy bounty､ for the humbled one—O God!
content_old: 10 Thy living host have remained therein, Thou dost provide､ in thy bounty､ for the humbled one—O God!

content: 11 Let My Lord but give the word The herald bands will be a mighty host:
content_old: 11 Let My Lord but give the word The herald bands will be a mighty host:

content: 12 Kings of armies they flee! they flee! And she that stayeth at home shall share the spoil.
content_old: 12 Kings of armies they flee! they flee! And she that stayeth at home shall share the spoil.

content: 13 Though ye rest between the folds The wings of the dove shall be covered with silver, And her pinions with green-shimmering gold.
content_old: 13 Though ye rest between the folds The wings of the dove shall be covered with silver, And her pinions with green-shimmering gold.

content: 14 When the Almighty scattereth kings therein It will gleam like snow in the gloom.
content_old: 14 When the Almighty scattereth kings therein It will gleam like snow in the gloom.

content: 15 A mighty mountain is the mountain of Bashan, A mountain of peaks is the mountain of Bashan!—
content_old: 15 A mighty mountain is the mountain of Bashan, A mountain of peaks is the mountain of Bashan!—

content: 16 Wherefore start ye up､ ye mountains､ ye peaks? The mountain God hath coveted for his habitation Surely､ Yahweh will inhabit it evermore!
content_old: 16 Wherefore start ye up､ ye mountains､ ye peaks? The mountain God hath coveted for his habitation Surely､ Yahweh will inhabit it evermore!

content: 17 The chariots of God are two myriads—thousands repeated, My Lord is among them､ Sinai is in the sanctuary!
content_old: 17 The chariots of God are two myriads—thousands repeated, My Lord is among them､ Sinai is in the sanctuary!

content: 18 Thou hast ascended on high､ Thou hast led in procession a body of captives､ Thou hast received gifts consisting of men, Yea even the rebellious, That Yah､ Elohim might settle down to rest.
content_old: 18 Thou hast ascended on high､ Thou hast led in procession a body of captives､ Thou hast received gifts consisting of men, Yea even the rebellious, That Yah､ Elohim might settle down to rest.

content: 19 Blessed be My Lord! Day by day he beareth our burden for us, GOD himself is our salvation. Selah.
content_old: 19 Blessed be My Lord! Day by day he beareth our burden for us, GOD himself is our salvation. Selah.

content: 20 The GOD we have is a GOD of saving deeds, And due to Yahweh､ My Lord are escapes from death.
content_old: 20 The GOD we have is a GOD of saving deeds, And due to Yahweh､ My Lord are escapes from death.

content: 21 Yea God himself will smite through the head of his foes,— The hairy crown of him that is marching on in his guilty deeds.
content_old: 21 Yea God himself will smite through the head of his foes,— The hairy crown of him that is marching on in his guilty deeds.

content: 22 Said My Lord､ From Bashan will I bring back,— I will bring back from the depths of the sea:
content_old: 22 Said My Lord､ From Bashan will I bring back,— I will bring back from the depths of the sea:

content: 23 That thou mayest bathe thy foot in blood,— The tongue of thy dogs from the foes hath its portion.
content_old: 23 That thou mayest bathe thy foot in blood,— The tongue of thy dogs from the foes hath its portion.

content: 24 They have seen thy progress O God, The progress of my GOD､ my king into the sanctuary:
content_old: 24 They have seen thy progress O God, The progress of my GOD､ my king into the sanctuary:

content: 25 In front are the singers､ Behind are the harpers, In the midst of damsels playing on timbrels:
content_old: 25 In front are the singers､ Behind are the harpers, In the midst of damsels playing on timbrels:

content: 26 In the congregations bless ye God, My Lord､ from among the called of Israel:
content_old: 26 In the congregations bless ye God, My Lord､ from among the called of Israel:

content: 27 There is Benjamin､ the Diminutive—ruling them､ The princes of Judah—their throng, The princes of Zebulun, The princes of Naphtali.
content_old: 27 There is Benjamin､ the Diminutive—ruling them､ The princes of Judah—their throng, The princes of Zebulun, The princes of Naphtali.

content: 28 Thy God hath commanded thy strength,— The strength O God, which thou hast wrought for us.
content_old: 28 Thy God hath commanded thy strength,— The strength O God, which thou hast wrought for us.

content: 29 Because of thy temple above Jerusalem Unto thee shall kings bear along a gift—
content_old: 29 Because of thy temple above Jerusalem Unto thee shall kings bear along a gift—

content: 30 Rebuke thou The wild beast of the reeds､ The herd of mighty oxen among the calves of the peoples— Each one bowing down with bars of silver,— Scatter thou the peoples, who in wars take delight.
content_old: 30 Rebuke thou The wild beast of the reeds､ The herd of mighty oxen among the calves of the peoples— Each one bowing down with bars of silver,— Scatter thou the peoples, who in wars take delight.

content: 31 Ambassadors come out of Egypt, The Ethiopian eagerly stretcheth out his hands､ unto God.
content_old: 31 Ambassadors come out of Egypt, The Ethiopian eagerly stretcheth out his hands､ unto God.

content: 32 Ye kingdoms of the earth sing unto God, Praise in song Adonây. Selah.
content_old: 32 Ye kingdoms of the earth sing unto God, Praise in song Adonây. Selah.

content: 33 Unto him that rideth upon the most ancient heavens､ Lo! he uttereth his voice､ a voice of strength.
content_old: 33 Unto him that rideth upon the most ancient heavens､ Lo! he uttereth his voice､ a voice of strength.

content: 34 Ascribe ye strength unto God,— Over Israel is his majesty, And his strength､ in the skies. To be revered is God､ for his sanctuary,—
content_old: 34 Ascribe ye strength unto God,— Over Israel is his majesty, And his strength､ in the skies. To be revered is God､ for his sanctuary,—

content: To the Chief Musician. On “The Lilies.” David’s.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On “The Lilies.” David’s.

content: 1 Save me､ O God, For waters have entered as far as the life;
content_old: 1 Save me､ O God, For waters have entered as far as the life;

content: 2 I have sunk in a deep swamp､ Where there is no place to stand, I have come into abysses of waters､ Where a flood hath overflowed me;
content_old: 2 I have sunk in a deep swamp､ Where there is no place to stand, I have come into abysses of waters､ Where a flood hath overflowed me;

content: 3 I am weary with mine outcry､ Parched is my throat,— Mine eyes have become dim, through waiting for my God.
content_old: 3 I am weary with mine outcry､ Parched is my throat,— Mine eyes have become dim, through waiting for my God.

content: 4 More than the hairs of my head Are they who hate me without cause,— Firmer than my bones Are they who are my foes for false cause,— What I had not plundered then had I to restore.
content_old: 4 More than the hairs of my head Are they who hate me without cause,— Firmer than my bones Are they who are my foes for false cause,— What I had not plundered then had I to restore.

content: 5 O God, thou hast known my folly, And my wrong-doings from thee have not been hid.
content_old: 5 O God, thou hast known my folly, And my wrong-doings from thee have not been hid.

content: 6 Let them not be ashamed､ through me､ Who have waited for thee､ O My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts,— Let them not be confounded､ through me､ Who are seeking thee, O God of Israel!
content_old: 6 Let them not be ashamed､ through me､ Who have waited for thee､ O My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts,— Let them not be confounded､ through me､ Who are seeking thee, O God of Israel!

content: 7 Because for thy sake have I borne reproach, Confusion hath covered my face;
content_old: 7 Because for thy sake have I borne reproach, Confusion hath covered my face;

content: 8 One estranged have I become､ to my own brethren, Yea an alien to the sons of mine own mother;
content_old: 8 One estranged have I become､ to my own brethren, Yea an alien to the sons of mine own mother;

content: 9 Because zeal for thy house hath eaten me up, And the reproaches of them who have reproached thee have fallen upon me.
content_old: 9 Because zeal for thy house hath eaten me up, And the reproaches of them who have reproached thee have fallen upon me.

content: 10 When I have humbled my soul with fasting Then hath it turned to my reproach;
content_old: 10 When I have humbled my soul with fasting Then hath it turned to my reproach;

content: 11 When I have made my clothing of sackcloth Then have I served them for a by-word;
content_old: 11 When I have made my clothing of sackcloth Then have I served them for a by-word;

content: 12 They who sit in the gate talk against me,— And against me are the songs of them who imbibe strong drink.
content_old: 12 They who sit in the gate talk against me,— And against me are the songs of them who imbibe strong drink.

content: 13 But as for me my prayer shall be unto thee､ O Yahweh､ in a time of acceptance, O God in the abounding of thy lovingkindness answer me with thy saving faithfulness.
content_old: 13 But as for me my prayer shall be unto thee､ O Yahweh､ in a time of acceptance, O God in the abounding of thy lovingkindness answer me with thy saving faithfulness.

content: 14 Rescue me out of the mire､ lest I sink, Let me be rescued From my haters､ and From abysses of waters:
content_old: 14 Rescue me out of the mire､ lest I sink, Let me be rescued From my haters､ and From abysses of waters:

content: 15 Let not a flood of waters overflow me､ And let not the depth swallow me up, Neither let the well close､ over me､ her mouth.
content_old: 15 Let not a flood of waters overflow me､ And let not the depth swallow me up, Neither let the well close､ over me､ her mouth.

content: 16 Answer me､ O Yahweh､ for good is thy lovingkindness, According to the abounding of thy compassions turn thou towards me:
content_old: 16 Answer me､ O Yahweh､ for good is thy lovingkindness, According to the abounding of thy compassions turn thou towards me:

content: 17 Then do not hide thy face from thy servant, Because I am in distress haste thee—answer me!
content_old: 17 Then do not hide thy face from thy servant, Because I am in distress haste thee—answer me!

content: 18 Oh draw near unto my soul—redeem it, Because of mine enemies ransom me.
content_old: 18 Oh draw near unto my soul—redeem it, Because of mine enemies ransom me.

content: 19 Thou knowest my reproach､ and my shame､ and my confusion, Before thee are all mine adversaries.
content_old: 19 Thou knowest my reproach､ and my shame､ and my confusion, Before thee are all mine adversaries.

content: 20 Reproach hath broken my heart､ and I am weak,— Though I waited for one to pity me yet there was none, And for comforters yet I found not any.
content_old: 20 Reproach hath broken my heart､ and I am weak,— Though I waited for one to pity me yet there was none, And for comforters yet I found not any.

content: 21 But they put in my food—poison! And for my thirst they gave for my drink—vinegar!
content_old: 21 But they put in my food—poison! And for my thirst they gave for my drink—vinegar!

content: 22 Let their table､ before them､ become a snare, And unto their friends､ a lure;
content_old: 22 Let their table､ before them､ become a snare, And unto their friends､ a lure;

content: 23 Let their eyes become too dim to see, And their loins continually cause thou to shake;
content_old: 23 Let their eyes become too dim to see, And their loins continually cause thou to shake;

content: 24 Pour out over them thine indignation, And let the glow of thine anger overtake them:
content_old: 24 Pour out over them thine indignation, And let the glow of thine anger overtake them:

content: 25 Let their encampment become desolate, In their tents be there none to dwell:
content_old: 25 Let their encampment become desolate, In their tents be there none to dwell:

content: 26 For whom thou thyself hadst smitten they pursued, And unto the pain of thy wounded ones they must needs add.
content_old: 26 For whom thou thyself hadst smitten they pursued, And unto the pain of thy wounded ones they must needs add.

content: 27 Lay punishment on their iniquity, And let them not enter into thy righteousness;
content_old: 27 Lay punishment on their iniquity, And let them not enter into thy righteousness;

content: 28 Let them be blotted out of the book of life, And with the righteous let them not be enrolled.
content_old: 28 Let them be blotted out of the book of life, And with the righteous let them not be enrolled.

content: 29 I then､ am humbled and in pain, Thy salvation､ O God may it set me on high.
content_old: 29 I then､ am humbled and in pain, Thy salvation､ O God may it set me on high.

content: 30 I will praise the Name of God with a song, And will magnify him with thanksgiving;
content_old: 30 I will praise the Name of God with a song, And will magnify him with thanksgiving;

content: 31 So shall it be more pleasing to Yahweh than a bullock of the herd､ Showing horn and divided hoof.
content_old: 31 So shall it be more pleasing to Yahweh than a bullock of the herd､ Showing horn and divided hoof.

content: 32 The humbled have seen—they rejoice! Ye seekers of God, let your heart､ then､ revive;
content_old: 32 The humbled have seen—they rejoice! Ye seekers of God, let your heart､ then､ revive;

content: 33 For a Hearkener to the needy is Yahweh, And his prisoners hath he not despised.
content_old: 33 For a Hearkener to the needy is Yahweh, And his prisoners hath he not despised.

content: 34 Let the heavens and the earth praise him, The seas, and everything that creepeth therein.
content_old: 34 Let the heavens and the earth praise him, The seas, and everything that creepeth therein.

content: 35 For God will save Zion､ And build the cities of Judah, So shall men dwell there､ and possess it:
content_old: 35 For God will save Zion､ And build the cities of Judah, So shall men dwell there､ and possess it:

content: To the Chief Musician. David’s. To call to Remembrance.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. David’s. To call to Remembrance.

content: 1 Be pleased O God､ to rescue me, O Yahweh､ to help me—make haste.
content_old: 1 Be pleased O God､ to rescue me, O Yahweh､ to help me—make haste.

content: 2 Let them turn pale and then at once blush､ Who are seeking my life,— Let them draw back､ and be confounded, Who are taking pleasure in my misfortune;
content_old: 2 Let them turn pale and then at once blush､ Who are seeking my life,— Let them draw back､ and be confounded, Who are taking pleasure in my misfortune;

content: 3 Let them turn back､ on account of their own shame, Who are saying Aha! Aha!
content_old: 3 Let them turn back､ on account of their own shame, Who are saying Aha! Aha!

content: 4 Let all them be glad and rejoice in thee, Yea let them who are seekers of thee,—say continually God be magnified! Who are lovers of thy salvation.
content_old: 4 Let all them be glad and rejoice in thee, Yea let them who are seekers of thee,—say continually God be magnified! Who are lovers of thy salvation.

content: 1 In thee､ O Yahweh have I sought refuge, May I not be ashamed unto times age-abiding:
content_old: 1 In thee､ O Yahweh have I sought refuge, May I not be ashamed unto times age-abiding:

content: 2 In thy righteousness wilt thou rescue me and deliver me, Incline unto me thine ear､ and save me:
content_old: 2 In thy righteousness wilt thou rescue me and deliver me, Incline unto me thine ear､ and save me:

content: 3 Be thou unto mea Rock to dwell in､ a Place of Security､ To save me, For my mountain crag and my stronghold thou art.
content_old: 3 Be thou unto mea Rock to dwell in､ a Place of Security､ To save me, For my mountain crag and my stronghold thou art.

content: 4 Oh my God､ deliver me From the hand of the lawless one, From the clutch of the perverse and ruthless one;
content_old: 4 Oh my God､ deliver me From the hand of the lawless one, From the clutch of the perverse and ruthless one;

content: 5 For thou art my hope, My Lord､ Yahweh､ My confidence from my youthful days:
content_old: 5 For thou art my hope, My Lord､ Yahweh､ My confidence from my youthful days:

content: 6 Upon thee have I stayed myself from birth､ Thou art he that severed me from the body of my mother, Of thee shall be my praise—continually.
content_old: 6 Upon thee have I stayed myself from birth､ Thou art he that severed me from the body of my mother, Of thee shall be my praise—continually.

content: 7 A very wonder have I been unto many, Seeing that thou hast been my strong refuge.
content_old: 7 A very wonder have I been unto many, Seeing that thou hast been my strong refuge.

content: 8 My mouth shall be filled with thy praise, All the day with thy splendour.
content_old: 8 My mouth shall be filled with thy praise, All the day with thy splendour.

content: 9 Do not cast me off in the time of old age, When my vigour faileth do not forsake me;
content_old: 9 Do not cast me off in the time of old age, When my vigour faileth do not forsake me;

content: 10 For mine enemies have spoken of me, And they who watch for my life have taken counsel together;
content_old: 10 For mine enemies have spoken of me, And they who watch for my life have taken counsel together;

content: 11 Saying God hath forsaken him, Pursue and take him､ For there is none to rescue.
content_old: 11 Saying God hath forsaken him, Pursue and take him､ For there is none to rescue.

content: 12 O God､ be not far from me, O my God, to help me make haste!
content_old: 12 O God､ be not far from me, O my God, to help me make haste!

content: 13 Let them be ashamed—he consumed Who are assailing my life,— Let them be covered with reproach and confusion Who are seeking my hurt.
content_old: 13 Let them be ashamed—he consumed Who are assailing my life,— Let them be covered with reproach and confusion Who are seeking my hurt.

content: 14 But I continually will hope, And will add to all thy praise;
content_old: 14 But I continually will hope, And will add to all thy praise;

content: 15 My mouth shall relate thy righteousness､ All the day thy deliverance, For I know not the numbers.
content_old: 15 My mouth shall relate thy righteousness､ All the day thy deliverance, For I know not the numbers.

content: 16 I will enter into the mighty doings of My Lord—Yahweh, I will make mention of thy righteousness—thine alone.
content_old: 16 I will enter into the mighty doings of My Lord—Yahweh, I will make mention of thy righteousness—thine alone.

content: 17 O God､ thou hast taught me from my youthful days, And hitherto have I been wont to tell of thy wonders;
content_old: 17 O God､ thou hast taught me from my youthful days, And hitherto have I been wont to tell of thy wonders;

content: 18 Even now､ therefore､ that I am old and grey-headed O God､ do not forsake me,— Until I tell of thine arm unto a new generation, Unto every one that is to come thy might;
content_old: 18 Even now､ therefore､ that I am old and grey-headed O God､ do not forsake me,— Until I tell of thine arm unto a new generation, Unto every one that is to come thy might;

content: 19 And as for thy righteousness､ O God､ up on high, Wherein thou hast wrought great things O God! who is like unto thee?
content_old: 19 And as for thy righteousness､ O God､ up on high, Wherein thou hast wrought great things O God! who is like unto thee?

content: 20 Thou who hast let us see many distresses and misfortunes Wilt again bring us to life, And out of the resounding depths of the earth wilt again raise us up;
content_old: 20 Thou who hast let us see many distresses and misfortunes Wilt again bring us to life, And out of the resounding depths of the earth wilt again raise us up;

content: 21 Thou wilt increase my greatness､ And､ on every side､ wilt comfort me.
content_old: 21 Thou wilt increase my greatness､ And､ on every side､ wilt comfort me.

content: 22 I also will praise thee by the aid of a harp､ Thy faithfulness､ O my God,— I will make music unto thee with a lyre, Thou holy one of Israel;
content_old: 22 I also will praise thee by the aid of a harp､ Thy faithfulness､ O my God,— I will make music unto thee with a lyre, Thou holy one of Israel;

content: 23 My lips shall make a joyful noise､ When I make music unto thee, And my soul̀ which thou hast ransomed;
content_old: 23 My lips shall make a joyful noise､ When I make music unto thee, And my soul̀ which thou hast ransomed;

content: Solomon’s.
content_old: Solomon’s.

content: 1 O God! thy justice give unto the king, And thy righteousness､ unto the son of a king;
content_old: 1 O God! thy justice give unto the king, And thy righteousness､ unto the son of a king;

content: 2 May he judge Thy people with righteousness; And thine oppressed ones with justice;
content_old: 2 May he judge Thy people with righteousness; And thine oppressed ones with justice;

content: 3 May the mountains bring peace to the people, And the hills be laden with righteousness;
content_old: 3 May the mountains bring peace to the people, And the hills be laden with righteousness;

content: 4 May he Vindicate the oppressed of the people､ Bring deliverance to the children of the needy, and Crush the oppressor.
content_old: 4 May he Vindicate the oppressed of the people､ Bring deliverance to the children of the needy, and Crush the oppressor.

content: 5 Let men revere thee With the sun, And in presence of the moon, Unto the remotest generation.
content_old: 5 Let men revere thee With the sun, And in presence of the moon, Unto the remotest generation.

content: 6 Let him come down Like rain on fields to be mown, Like myriad drops on land to be reaped.
content_old: 6 Let him come down Like rain on fields to be mown, Like myriad drops on land to be reaped.

content: 7 May righteousness､ in his days､ blossom forth, And abundance of peace､ till there be no moon.
content_old: 7 May righteousness､ in his days､ blossom forth, And abundance of peace､ till there be no moon.

content: 8 So let him have dominion From sea to sea, And from the River unto the ends of the earth;
content_old: 8 So let him have dominion From sea to sea, And from the River unto the ends of the earth;

content: 9 Before him let the men of the desert kneel, But as for his foes the dust let them lick;
content_old: 9 Before him let the men of the desert kneel, But as for his foes the dust let them lick;

content: 10 The kings of Tarshish and of the Coastlands A gift let them render, The kings of Sheba and Seba A present let them bring;
content_old: 10 The kings of Tarshish and of the Coastlands A gift let them render, The kings of Sheba and Seba A present let them bring;
