content: 11 Yea let all kings bow down unto him, Let all nations serve him;
content_old: 11 Yea let all kings bow down unto him, Let all nations serve him;

content: 12 Because he Rescueth The needy from the rich, The oppressed､ who hath no helper;
content_old: 12 Because he Rescueth The needy from the rich, The oppressed､ who hath no helper;

content: 13 He Pitieth the weak and the needy, And the lives of the needy he Saveth:
content_old: 13 He Pitieth the weak and the needy, And the lives of the needy he Saveth:

content: 14 From extortion and violence he Redeemeth their life, And precious is their blood in his sight.
content_old: 14 From extortion and violence he Redeemeth their life, And precious is their blood in his sight.

content: 15 Let him live､ then! And be there given unto him of the gold of Sheba,— Let prayer also be offered for him continually, All the day let him be blessed.
content_old: 15 Let him live､ then! And be there given unto him of the gold of Sheba,— Let prayer also be offered for him continually, All the day let him be blessed.

content: 16 May there be an abundance of corn in the earth､ in the top of the mountains,— Let the fruit thereof wave like Lebanon, And they of the city bloom like the fresh shoots of the earth.
content_old: 16 May there be an abundance of corn in the earth､ in the top of the mountains,— Let the fruit thereof wave like Lebanon, And they of the city bloom like the fresh shoots of the earth.

content: 17 May his Name be age-abiding､ In the presence of the sun let his Name flourish,— And may all the families of the ground bless themselves in him, All nations pronounce him happy!
content_old: 17 May his Name be age-abiding､ In the presence of the sun let his Name flourish,— And may all the families of the ground bless themselves in him, All nations pronounce him happy!

content: 18 Blessed be Yahweh God､ the God of Israel,— Who doeth wondrous things by himself alone;
content_old: 18 Blessed be Yahweh God､ the God of Israel,— Who doeth wondrous things by himself alone;

content: 19 And blessed be his glorious Name､ unto times age-abiding,— And filled with his glory be all the earth､ Amen and Amen!
content_old: 19 And blessed be his glorious Name､ unto times age-abiding,— And filled with his glory be all the earth､ Amen and Amen!

content: A Melody of Asaph.
content_old: A Melody of Asaph.

content: 1 Nothing but good is God Unto Israel, Unto the pure in heart.
content_old: 1 Nothing but good is God Unto Israel, Unto the pure in heart.

content: 2 But as for me— My feet had almost stumbled, My steps had well-nigh slipped;
content_old: 2 But as for me— My feet had almost stumbled, My steps had well-nigh slipped;

content: 3 For I was envious of the boasters, At the prosperity of the lawless used I to look.
content_old: 3 For I was envious of the boasters, At the prosperity of the lawless used I to look.

content: 4 For they have no pangs in their death, And vigorous is their body;
content_old: 4 For they have no pangs in their death, And vigorous is their body;

content: 5 Of the toil of weak mortals have they none, Nor with the sons of earth are they hard smitten.
content_old: 5 Of the toil of weak mortals have they none, Nor with the sons of earth are they hard smitten.

content: 6 For this cause doth arrogance deck them as a neck-chain, And a garment of wrong is their attire;
content_old: 6 For this cause doth arrogance deck them as a neck-chain, And a garment of wrong is their attire;

content: 7 Their iniquity hath proceeded from fatness They have surpassed the imaginations of the heart;
content_old: 7 Their iniquity hath proceeded from fatness They have surpassed the imaginations of the heart;

content: 8 They mock､ and wickedly command oppression, From on high they command;
content_old: 8 They mock､ and wickedly command oppression, From on high they command;

content: 9 They have set､ in the heavens､ their mouth, And their tongue marcheth through the earth.
content_old: 9 They have set､ in the heavens､ their mouth, And their tongue marcheth through the earth.

content: 10 Therefore must his people return thither, And the waters of abundance are drained by them;
content_old: 10 Therefore must his people return thither, And the waters of abundance are drained by them;

content: 11 And they say— How doth GOD know? And is there knowledge in the Most High?
content_old: 11 And they say— How doth GOD know? And is there knowledge in the Most High?

content: 12 Lo! these are the lawless, Who are secure for an age､ They have attained unto wealth.
content_old: 12 Lo! these are the lawless, Who are secure for an age､ They have attained unto wealth.

content: 13 Altogether in vain Have I cleansed my heart, And bathed in pureness､ my hands;
content_old: 13 Altogether in vain Have I cleansed my heart, And bathed in pureness､ my hands;

content: 14 And yet been smitten all the day, And been rebuked morning by morning!
content_old: 14 And yet been smitten all the day, And been rebuked morning by morning!

content: 15 If I had thought I will relate it thus Lo! the circle of thy sons had I betrayed.
content_old: 15 If I had thought I will relate it thus Lo! the circle of thy sons had I betrayed.

content: 16 When I reasoned､ that I might understand this A vexation it was in mine eyes:
content_old: 16 When I reasoned､ that I might understand this A vexation it was in mine eyes:

content: 17 Until I could enter the holy places of GOD,— Could give heed to their hereafter:—
content_old: 17 Until I could enter the holy places of GOD,— Could give heed to their hereafter:—

content: 18 Surely in slippery places dost thou set them,— Thou hast suffered them to fall into places of danger.
content_old: 18 Surely in slippery places dost thou set them,— Thou hast suffered them to fall into places of danger.

content: 19 How have they become desolate､ as in a moment! They have ceased—come to an end､ by reason of calamities.
content_old: 19 How have they become desolate､ as in a moment! They have ceased—come to an end､ by reason of calamities.

content: 20 As the dream of him that waketh O My Lord! when rousing thyself up their shadowy being wilt thou despise.
content_old: 20 As the dream of him that waketh O My Lord! when rousing thyself up their shadowy being wilt thou despise.

content: 21 But my heart had grown embittered, And in my reins had I received wounds;
content_old: 21 But my heart had grown embittered, And in my reins had I received wounds;

content: 22 But I was brutish､ and could not perceive, Like the beasts had I become before thee.
content_old: 22 But I was brutish､ and could not perceive, Like the beasts had I become before thee.

content: 23 Nevertheless I am continually before thee, Thou hast taken hold of my right hand;
content_old: 23 Nevertheless I am continually before thee, Thou hast taken hold of my right hand;

content: 24 By thy counsel wilt thou guide me, And afterwards unto glory wilt thou take me.
content_old: 24 By thy counsel wilt thou guide me, And afterwards unto glory wilt thou take me.

content: 25 Whom have I in the heavens? And compared with thee there is nothing I desire on earth.
content_old: 25 Whom have I in the heavens? And compared with thee there is nothing I desire on earth.

content: 26 Failed have my flesh and my heart, The rock of my heart—and my portion is God unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 26 Failed have my flesh and my heart, The rock of my heart—and my portion is God unto times age-abiding.

content: 27 For lo! they who are far from thee shall perish, Thou hast put an end to every one who wandered unchastely from thee.
content_old: 27 For lo! they who are far from thee shall perish, Thou hast put an end to every one who wandered unchastely from thee.

content: An Instructive Psalm. Asaph’s.
content_old: An Instructive Psalm. Asaph’s.

content: 1 Wherefore､ O God､ hast thou cast off utterly? Shall thine anger smoke against the flock of thine own pasturing?
content_old: 1 Wherefore､ O God､ hast thou cast off utterly? Shall thine anger smoke against the flock of thine own pasturing?

content: 2 Remember thine own assembly thou didst acquire aforetime､ Thou didst redeem the tribe of thine own inheritance, Mount Zion､ wherein thou didst take up thy habitation.
content_old: 2 Remember thine own assembly thou didst acquire aforetime､ Thou didst redeem the tribe of thine own inheritance, Mount Zion､ wherein thou didst take up thy habitation.

content: 3 Lift up thy steps unto the places utterly unsafe, All the mischief!—the foe in the sanctuary!
content_old: 3 Lift up thy steps unto the places utterly unsafe, All the mischief!—the foe in the sanctuary!

content: 4 Thine adversaries have roared in the midst of thine appointed meeting, They have set their ensigns as tokens!
content_old: 4 Thine adversaries have roared in the midst of thine appointed meeting, They have set their ensigns as tokens!

content: 5 One used to be known according as he carried up high— Into the thicket of trees—the axes;
content_old: 5 One used to be known according as he carried up high— Into the thicket of trees—the axes;

content: 6 But now the doors thereof all together with axes and hammers they batter down.
content_old: 6 But now the doors thereof all together with axes and hammers they batter down.

content: 7 They have cast､ into the fire､ thy sanctuary, To the ground have they profaned the habitation of thy Name.
content_old: 7 They have cast､ into the fire､ thy sanctuary, To the ground have they profaned the habitation of thy Name.

content: 8 They have said in their heart､ Let us suppress them altogether, They have burned up all the meeting-places of GOD in the land.
content_old: 8 They have said in their heart､ Let us suppress them altogether, They have burned up all the meeting-places of GOD in the land.

content: 9 Our own signs have we not seen,— There is no longer a prophet,— Neither is there with us､ one who knoweth— How long!
content_old: 9 Our own signs have we not seen,— There is no longer a prophet,— Neither is there with us､ one who knoweth— How long!

content: 10 How long､ O God､ shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy revile thy Name perpetually?
content_old: 10 How long､ O God､ shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy revile thy Name perpetually?

content: 11 Wherefore shouldst thou withdraw thy hand—thy right hand? Bring it out of the midst of thy bosom! Selah.
content_old: 11 Wherefore shouldst thou withdraw thy hand—thy right hand? Bring it out of the midst of thy bosom! Selah.

content: 12 But God hath been my king from aforetime, Working Deliverances in the midst of the earth.
content_old: 12 But God hath been my king from aforetime, Working Deliverances in the midst of the earth.

content: 13 Thou didst cleave asunder､ in thy might､ the sea, Thou didst break in pieces the heads of the Crocodiles, till they floated on the waters;
content_old: 13 Thou didst cleave asunder､ in thy might､ the sea, Thou didst break in pieces the heads of the Crocodiles, till they floated on the waters;

content: 14 Thou didst crush the heads of the Sea-Monster. Thou didst give him to be food､ for the people of the deserts;
content_old: 14 Thou didst crush the heads of the Sea-Monster. Thou didst give him to be food､ for the people of the deserts;

content: 15 Thou didst cleave open fountain and torrent, Thou didst dry up rivers of steady flow:
content_old: 15 Thou didst cleave open fountain and torrent, Thou didst dry up rivers of steady flow:

content: 16 Thine is the day､ Yea thine the night, Thou didst establish moon and sun;
content_old: 16 Thine is the day､ Yea thine the night, Thou didst establish moon and sun;

content: 17 Thou didst set up all the bounds of the earth, As for summer and winter thou didst form them!
content_old: 17 Thou didst set up all the bounds of the earth, As for summer and winter thou didst form them!

content: 18 Remember this､ An enemy hath reproached Yahweh, Yea an impious people have reviled thy Name.
content_old: 18 Remember this､ An enemy hath reproached Yahweh, Yea an impious people have reviled thy Name.

content: 19 Do not deliver up､ to a wild beast､ the life of thy turtle-dove, The living host of thine oppressed ones do not forget perpetually.
content_old: 19 Do not deliver up､ to a wild beast､ the life of thy turtle-dove, The living host of thine oppressed ones do not forget perpetually.

content: 20 Have respect to thy covenant, For the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of violence.
content_old: 20 Have respect to thy covenant, For the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of violence.

content: 21 May the crushed one not again be confounded, As for the oppressed and the needy let them praise thy Name.
content_old: 21 May the crushed one not again be confounded, As for the oppressed and the needy let them praise thy Name.

content: 22 Arise! O God､ plead thine own cause, Remember the reproach of thee､ from the impious one､ all the day:
content_old: 22 Arise! O God､ plead thine own cause, Remember the reproach of thee､ from the impious one､ all the day:

content: To the Chief Musician. “Do not Destroy.” A Melody of Asaph, a Song.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. “Do not Destroy.” A Melody of Asaph, a Song.

content: 1 We have given thanks unto thee､ O God､ we have given thanks, And in calling upon thy Name men have recounted thy wonders.
content_old: 1 We have given thanks unto thee､ O God､ we have given thanks, And in calling upon thy Name men have recounted thy wonders.

content: 2 Surely I will take a set time,— I with equity will judge:
content_old: 2 Surely I will take a set time,— I with equity will judge:

content: 3 Earth was melting away with all its inhabitants I have fixed the pillars thereof. Selah.
content_old: 3 Earth was melting away with all its inhabitants I have fixed the pillars thereof. Selah.

content: 4 I have said to the boasters､ Do not boast, And to the lawless､ Do not lift up a horn;
content_old: 4 I have said to the boasters､ Do not boast, And to the lawless､ Do not lift up a horn;

content: 5 Do not lift up on high your horn, Nor speak of the Rock､ with arrogance;
content_old: 5 Do not lift up on high your horn, Nor speak of the Rock､ with arrogance;

content: 6 For neither from east nor west, Nor from the wilderness of the mountains cometh exaltation;
content_old: 6 For neither from east nor west, Nor from the wilderness of the mountains cometh exaltation;

content: 7 For God himself is about to judge, One he will cast down､ Another he will lift up;
content_old: 7 For God himself is about to judge, One he will cast down､ Another he will lift up;

content: 8 For a cup is in the hand of Yahweh､ Whose wine is foaming､ It is full of spiced wine､ Which he hath caused to flow from one to another,— Surely the dregs thereof they shall drain out—they shall drink, Even all the lawless ones of the earth.
content_old: 8 For a cup is in the hand of Yahweh､ Whose wine is foaming､ It is full of spiced wine､ Which he hath caused to flow from one to another,— Surely the dregs thereof they shall drain out—they shall drink, Even all the lawless ones of the earth.

content: 9 But I will exult unto times age-abiding, I will sing praises unto the God of Jacob;
content_old: 9 But I will exult unto times age-abiding, I will sing praises unto the God of Jacob;

content: To the Chief Musician. With Stringed Instruments. A Melody of Asaph, a Song.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. With Stringed Instruments. A Melody of Asaph, a Song.

content: 1 God is known in Judah, In Israel great is his Name;
content_old: 1 God is known in Judah, In Israel great is his Name;

content: 2 Now hath come into Salem his pavilion, And his dwelling-place into Zion.
content_old: 2 Now hath come into Salem his pavilion, And his dwelling-place into Zion.

content: 3 There hath he broken in pieces the arrows of the bow, Shield and sword､ and battle. Selah.
content_old: 3 There hath he broken in pieces the arrows of the bow, Shield and sword､ and battle. Selah.

content: 4 Enveloped in light thou art more majestic than the mountains of prey.
content_old: 4 Enveloped in light thou art more majestic than the mountains of prey.

content: 5 The valiant of heart have become a spoil､ They have slumbered their sleep, And none of the men of might have found their hands.
content_old: 5 The valiant of heart have become a spoil､ They have slumbered their sleep, And none of the men of might have found their hands.

content: 6 At thy rebuke O God of Jacob, Stunned are the horsemen.
content_old: 6 At thy rebuke O God of Jacob, Stunned are the horsemen.

content: 7 As for thee to be feared thou art! Who then shall stand before thee､ because of the power of thine anger?
content_old: 7 As for thee to be feared thou art! Who then shall stand before thee､ because of the power of thine anger?

content: 8 Out of the heavens didst thou cause judgment to be heard, Earth feared and was still:
content_old: 8 Out of the heavens didst thou cause judgment to be heard, Earth feared and was still:

content: 9 When God rose up to judgment､ To save all the oppressed of the earth. Selah.
content_old: 9 When God rose up to judgment､ To save all the oppressed of the earth. Selah.

content: 10 For the multitude of mankind shall give thanks unto thee, The remainder of the multitude shall keep holy festival unto thee.
content_old: 10 For the multitude of mankind shall give thanks unto thee, The remainder of the multitude shall keep holy festival unto thee.

content: 11 Vow and pay､ unto Yahweh your God,— Let all who are round about him Bear along a gift unto him who is to be revered.
content_old: 11 Vow and pay､ unto Yahweh your God,— Let all who are round about him Bear along a gift unto him who is to be revered.

content: To the Chief Musician. On “Jeduthun.” Asaph’s, a Melody.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On “Jeduthun.” Asaph’s, a Melody.

content: 1 With my voice—unto God will I make outcry, With my voice unto God､ and he will give ear unto me;
content_old: 1 With my voice—unto God will I make outcry, With my voice unto God､ and he will give ear unto me;

content: 2 In the day of my distress—unto My Lord will I seek, My hand by night hath been outstretched､ and never once became slack, My soul hath refused to be consoled;
content_old: 2 In the day of my distress—unto My Lord will I seek, My hand by night hath been outstretched､ and never once became slack, My soul hath refused to be consoled;

content: 3 I remember God and I murmur, I muse､ and my spirit swooneth. Selah.
content_old: 3 I remember God and I murmur, I muse､ and my spirit swooneth. Selah.

content: 4 Thou hast held､ watching､ mine eyes, I was driven to and fro､ and could not speak;
content_old: 4 Thou hast held､ watching､ mine eyes, I was driven to and fro､ and could not speak;

content: 5 I reasoned Of the days of aforetime, Of the years of by-gone ages;
content_old: 5 I reasoned Of the days of aforetime, Of the years of by-gone ages;

content: 6 I remember my song in the night,— With my own heart I commune, And my spirit maketh search:—
content_old: 6 I remember my song in the night,— With my own heart I commune, And my spirit maketh search:—

content: 7 For ages will My Lord reject? And not again grant acceptance any more?
content_old: 7 For ages will My Lord reject? And not again grant acceptance any more?

content: 8 Hath his lovingkindness come to a perpetual end? Hath his word failed to generation after generation?
content_old: 8 Hath his lovingkindness come to a perpetual end? Hath his word failed to generation after generation?

content: 9 Hath GOD forgotten to shew favour? Or hath he shut up､ in anger､ his compassions? Selah.
content_old: 9 Hath GOD forgotten to shew favour? Or hath he shut up､ in anger､ his compassions? Selah.

content: 10 Then said I— An affliction to me it is, The changing of the right hand of the Most High.
content_old: 10 Then said I— An affliction to me it is, The changing of the right hand of the Most High.

content: 11 I will remember the doings of Yah, Surely I will remember､ out of aforetime､ thy wonderful way;
content_old: 11 I will remember the doings of Yah, Surely I will remember､ out of aforetime､ thy wonderful way;

content: 12 And will talk to myself of all thy work, And of thy doings will I muse:—
content_old: 12 And will talk to myself of all thy work, And of thy doings will I muse:—

content: 13 O God､ in the sanctuary is thy way,— Who is a great GOD like Elohim?
content_old: 13 O God､ in the sanctuary is thy way,— Who is a great GOD like Elohim?

content: 14 Thou art GOD､ doing wonderfully,— Thou hast made known､ among the peoples､ thy might;
content_old: 14 Thou art GOD､ doing wonderfully,— Thou hast made known､ among the peoples､ thy might;

content: 15 Thou didst redeem､ with thine arm— Thy people, Thy sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
content_old: 15 Thou didst redeem､ with thine arm— Thy people, Thy sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

content: 16 The waters saw thee､ O God､ The waters saw thee､ They were in birth-throes, Yea the resounding deeps were stirred;
content_old: 16 The waters saw thee､ O God､ The waters saw thee､ They were in birth-throes, Yea the resounding deeps were stirred;

content: 17 The clouds poured down waters､ The skies uttered a voice, Yea thine arrows flew hither and thither;
content_old: 17 The clouds poured down waters､ The skies uttered a voice, Yea thine arrows flew hither and thither;

content: 18 The voice of thy thunder was in the whirlwind､ Thy lightnings illumined the world, The earth trembled and quaked;
content_old: 18 The voice of thy thunder was in the whirlwind､ Thy lightnings illumined the world, The earth trembled and quaked;

content: 19 In the sea was thy way､ And thy path in the mighty waters, And thy footprints could not be known:
content_old: 19 In the sea was thy way､ And thy path in the mighty waters, And thy footprints could not be known:

content: An Instructive Psalm. Asaph’s.
content_old: An Instructive Psalm. Asaph’s.

content: 1 Give ear､ O my people､ to mine instruction, Bend your ear to the sayings of my mouth;
content_old: 1 Give ear､ O my people､ to mine instruction, Bend your ear to the sayings of my mouth;

content: 2 I will open､ in a parable､ my mouth, I will pour forth enigmas out of antiquity;—
content_old: 2 I will open､ in a parable､ my mouth, I will pour forth enigmas out of antiquity;—

content: 3 Which we have heard､ and come to know, And our fathers have recounted to us;
content_old: 3 Which we have heard､ and come to know, And our fathers have recounted to us;

content: 4 We will not withhold them from their children､ To a later generation recounting the praises of Yahweh, Even his might and his wonders which he wrought;
content_old: 4 We will not withhold them from their children､ To a later generation recounting the praises of Yahweh, Even his might and his wonders which he wrought;

content: 5 When he set up a testimony in Jacob､ And a law appointed in Israel,— Which he commanded our fathers, That they might make them known to their children;
content_old: 5 When he set up a testimony in Jacob､ And a law appointed in Israel,— Which he commanded our fathers, That they might make them known to their children;

content: 6 To the end A later generation might come to know､ Children who should be born, Who should arise､ and recount them to their children;
content_old: 6 To the end A later generation might come to know､ Children who should be born, Who should arise､ and recount them to their children;

content: 7 That they might set､ in Elohim､ their confidence,— And not forget the doings of El, But his commandments might observe;
content_old: 7 That they might set､ in Elohim､ their confidence,— And not forget the doings of El, But his commandments might observe;

content: 8 And not become､ like their fathers､ a generation stubborn and rebellious,— A generation that fixed not their heart, Neither was their spirit faithful with GOD.
content_old: 8 And not become､ like their fathers､ a generation stubborn and rebellious,— A generation that fixed not their heart, Neither was their spirit faithful with GOD.

content: 9 The sons of Ephraim—armed bowmen Turned in the day of battle;
content_old: 9 The sons of Ephraim—armed bowmen Turned in the day of battle;

content: 10 They kept not the covenant of God, And in his law refused to walk;
content_old: 10 They kept not the covenant of God, And in his law refused to walk;

content: 11 And forgat His doings, And his wonders which he had shewed them:
content_old: 11 And forgat His doings, And his wonders which he had shewed them:

content: 12 In presence of their fathers wrought he wondrously,— In the land of Egypt—the field of Zoan:
content_old: 12 In presence of their fathers wrought he wondrously,— In the land of Egypt—the field of Zoan:

content: 13 He clave the sea､ and caused them to pass through, And reared up the waters like a mound;
content_old: 13 He clave the sea､ and caused them to pass through, And reared up the waters like a mound;

content: 14 And led them､ by a cloud､ in the daytime, And all the night､ by a light of fire;
content_old: 14 And led them､ by a cloud､ in the daytime, And all the night､ by a light of fire;

content: 15 He used to cleave rocks in the desert, And let them drink as out of mighty deeps;
content_old: 15 He used to cleave rocks in the desert, And let them drink as out of mighty deeps;

content: 16 And he brought forth streams out of the cliff, And caused waters to flow down､ like rivers.
content_old: 16 And he brought forth streams out of the cliff, And caused waters to flow down､ like rivers.

content: 17 But again､ once more sinned they against him, Resisting the Most High in a land of drought:
content_old: 17 But again､ once more sinned they against him, Resisting the Most High in a land of drought:

content: 18 They put GOD to the proof in their heart, By asking food to their mind:
content_old: 18 They put GOD to the proof in their heart, By asking food to their mind:

content: 19 Yea they spake against Elohim,— They said､ Can GOD prepare a table in the desert?
content_old: 19 Yea they spake against Elohim,— They said､ Can GOD prepare a table in the desert?

content: 20 Lo! he hath smitten a rock､ And waters have gushed out､ Yea torrents have rushed along,— Food also can he give? Or provide flesh for his people?
content_old: 20 Lo! he hath smitten a rock､ And waters have gushed out､ Yea torrents have rushed along,— Food also can he give? Or provide flesh for his people?

content: 21 Therefore Yahweh hearkened､ and became wroth,— And a fire was kindled against Jacob, Moreover also anger mounted against Israel;
content_old: 21 Therefore Yahweh hearkened､ and became wroth,— And a fire was kindled against Jacob, Moreover also anger mounted against Israel;

content: 22 Because They believed not in God, Nor trusted in his salvation;
content_old: 22 Because They believed not in God, Nor trusted in his salvation;

content: 23 Though he had commanded the skies above, And the doors of the heavens had opened;
content_old: 23 Though he had commanded the skies above, And the doors of the heavens had opened;

content: 24 And had rained on them manna to eat, And the corn of the heavens had given to them:
content_old: 24 And had rained on them manna to eat, And the corn of the heavens had given to them:

content: 25 The food of the mighty each one did eat, Nourishment sent he them to the full;
content_old: 25 The food of the mighty each one did eat, Nourishment sent he them to the full;

content: 26 He let loose an east wind in the heavens, Then guided he､ in his might､ a south wind;
content_old: 26 He let loose an east wind in the heavens, Then guided he､ in his might､ a south wind;

content: 27 And rained upon them flesh as the dust, And like the sand of the seas birds of wing;
content_old: 27 And rained upon them flesh as the dust, And like the sand of the seas birds of wing;

content: 28 And let them fall in the midst of their camp,— Round about their habitations.
content_old: 28 And let them fall in the midst of their camp,— Round about their habitations.

content: 29 So they did eat and were abundantly filled, When what they longed for he had brought them:—
content_old: 29 So they did eat and were abundantly filled, When what they longed for he had brought them:—

content: 30 They had not turned away from what they had longed for, Yet was their food in their mouth
content_old: 30 They had not turned away from what they had longed for, Yet was their food in their mouth

content: 31 When the anger of God mounted against them､ And he slew of their vigorous youths, And the choice young men of Israel caused he to bow down in death.
content_old: 31 When the anger of God mounted against them､ And he slew of their vigorous youths, And the choice young men of Israel caused he to bow down in death.

content: 32 For all this sinned they still, And believed not in his wonders;
content_old: 32 For all this sinned they still, And believed not in his wonders;

content: 33 So he ended､ in a breath､ their days, And their years, in a sudden terror!
content_old: 33 So he ended､ in a breath､ their days, And their years, in a sudden terror!

content: 34 If he slew of them then they sought him, Yea they turned, and did earnestly seek GOD;
content_old: 34 If he slew of them then they sought him, Yea they turned, and did earnestly seek GOD;

content: 35 And remembered that Elohim was their rock, Yea EL Most High their Redeemer:
content_old: 35 And remembered that Elohim was their rock, Yea EL Most High their Redeemer:

content: 36 So they spake him fair with their mouth, And with their tongue did promise him falsely;
content_old: 36 So they spake him fair with their mouth, And with their tongue did promise him falsely;

content: 37 But their heart was not fixed with him, Nor were they trusty in his covenant:
content_old: 37 But their heart was not fixed with him, Nor were they trusty in his covenant:

content: 38 Yet he full of compassion would put a propitiatory-covering over iniquity､ and not destroy,— Yea many a time turned he back his anger, And would not stir up all his wrath.
content_old: 38 Yet he full of compassion would put a propitiatory-covering over iniquity､ and not destroy,— Yea many a time turned he back his anger, And would not stir up all his wrath.

content: 39 So then he remembered That Flesh they were, A Wind departing､ that returneth not.
content_old: 39 So then he remembered That Flesh they were, A Wind departing､ that returneth not.

content: 40 How often they Resisted him in the desert, Vexed him､ in the waste:
content_old: 40 How often they Resisted him in the desert, Vexed him､ in the waste:

content: 41 Yea they again put GOD to the test, And to the Holy One of Israel caused they sorrow:
content_old: 41 Yea they again put GOD to the test, And to the Holy One of Israel caused they sorrow:

content: 42 They remembered not his hand—The day When he ransomed them from the adversary;
content_old: 42 They remembered not his hand—The day When he ransomed them from the adversary;

content: 43 When he set､ in Egypt､ his signs, And his wonders､ in the plain of Zoan;
content_old: 43 When he set､ in Egypt､ his signs, And his wonders､ in the plain of Zoan;

content: 44 When he turned, into blood､ their Nile-streams, And their own rivers could they not drink;
content_old: 44 When he turned, into blood､ their Nile-streams, And their own rivers could they not drink;

content: 45 He sent among them The gad-fly､ and it devoured them, And the frog､ and it despoiled them;
content_old: 45 He sent among them The gad-fly､ and it devoured them, And the frog､ and it despoiled them;

content: 46 When he gave to the corn-locust their produce, And their toil､ to the swarming locust;
content_old: 46 When he gave to the corn-locust their produce, And their toil､ to the swarming locust;

content: 47 He killed､ with hail､ their vine, And their sycomores, with frost:
content_old: 47 He killed､ with hail､ their vine, And their sycomores, with frost:

content: 48 When he gave up､ to hail-storms､ their beasts, And their cattle, to pestilent fevers;
content_old: 48 When he gave up､ to hail-storms､ their beasts, And their cattle, to pestilent fevers;

content: 49 He sent among them the heat of his anger､ Wrath and indignation and distress,— A mission of messengers of misfortune:
content_old: 49 He sent among them the heat of his anger､ Wrath and indignation and distress,— A mission of messengers of misfortune:

content: 50 He levelled a path for his anger,— Withheld not､ from death､ their soul, But their life—to the pestilence he delivered:
content_old: 50 He levelled a path for his anger,— Withheld not､ from death､ their soul, But their life—to the pestilence he delivered:

content: 51 So he smote Every first-born in Egypt, The beginning of their strength, in the tents of Ham;
content_old: 51 So he smote Every first-born in Egypt, The beginning of their strength, in the tents of Ham;

content: 52 And he set forth, like sheep, his people, And guided them､ like a flock in the desert;
content_old: 52 And he set forth, like sheep, his people, And guided them､ like a flock in the desert;

content: 53 Yea he led them securely､ and they dreaded not, And their enemies the sea did cover.
content_old: 53 Yea he led them securely､ and they dreaded not, And their enemies the sea did cover.

content: 54 Then brought he them within his own holy bounds, The mountain-range､ which his right hand made his own:
content_old: 54 Then brought he them within his own holy bounds, The mountain-range､ which his right hand made his own:

content: 55 So he drave out､ before them､ whole nations, And allotted them､ by line, an inheritance, And caused to dwell､ in their own homes､ the tribes of Israel.
content_old: 55 So he drave out､ before them､ whole nations, And allotted them､ by line, an inheritance, And caused to dwell､ in their own homes､ the tribes of Israel.

content: 56 But they tested and resisted God Most High, And his testimonies did not observe;
content_old: 56 But they tested and resisted God Most High, And his testimonies did not observe;

content: 57 But drew back and dealt treacherously､ like their fathers, They turned aside､ like deceitful bowmen;
content_old: 57 But drew back and dealt treacherously､ like their fathers, They turned aside､ like deceitful bowmen;

content: 58 And provoked him to anger with their high places, And with their images used to move him to jealousy.
content_old: 58 And provoked him to anger with their high places, And with their images used to move him to jealousy.

content: 59 God heard and was wroth, And greatly abhorred Israel;
content_old: 59 God heard and was wroth, And greatly abhorred Israel;

content: 60 So he gave up the habitation of Shiloh, The tent he had set up among Men;
content_old: 60 So he gave up the habitation of Shiloh, The tent he had set up among Men;

content: 61 Yea he gave up､ into captivity､ his strength, And his beauty into the hand of an adversary;
content_old: 61 Yea he gave up､ into captivity､ his strength, And his beauty into the hand of an adversary;

content: 62 And delivered up､ to the sword､ his people, And with his own inheritance was he wroth;
content_old: 62 And delivered up､ to the sword､ his people, And with his own inheritance was he wroth;

content: 63 His young men were devoured by fire, And his virgins were not praised in song;
content_old: 63 His young men were devoured by fire, And his virgins were not praised in song;

content: 64 His priests by the sword did fall, And his widows were not able to bewail.
content_old: 64 His priests by the sword did fall, And his widows were not able to bewail.

content: 65 Then awoke､ as one that had slept､ Adonây, As a warrior exulting with wine!
content_old: 65 Then awoke､ as one that had slept､ Adonây, As a warrior exulting with wine!

content: 66 So he smote his adversaries in the rear, Reproach age-abiding laid he upon them.
content_old: 66 So he smote his adversaries in the rear, Reproach age-abiding laid he upon them.

content: 67 Howbeit he rejected the tent of Joseph, And the tribe of Ephraim did not choose:
content_old: 67 Howbeit he rejected the tent of Joseph, And the tribe of Ephraim did not choose:

content: 68 But made choice of the tribe of Judah, The mountain of Zion､ which he loved;
content_old: 68 But made choice of the tribe of Judah, The mountain of Zion､ which he loved;

content: 69 And built､ like the heights､ his sanctuary, Like the earth he founded it to times age-abiding.
content_old: 69 And built､ like the heights､ his sanctuary, Like the earth he founded it to times age-abiding.

content: 70 And made choice of David his servant, And took him from among the folds of the sheep:
content_old: 70 And made choice of David his servant, And took him from among the folds of the sheep:

content: 71 From after the suckling ewes he brought him in,— To be shepherd to Jacob his people, And to Israel, his inheritance.
content_old: 71 From after the suckling ewes he brought him in,— To be shepherd to Jacob his people, And to Israel, his inheritance.

content: A Melody of Asaph.
content_old: A Melody of Asaph.

content: 1 O God､ nations Have entered thine inheritance､ Have profaned thy holy temple,— Have laid Jerusalem in heaps:
content_old: 1 O God､ nations Have entered thine inheritance､ Have profaned thy holy temple,— Have laid Jerusalem in heaps:

content: 2 They have given The dead bodies of thy servants､ As food for the birds of the heavens, The flesh of thy men of lovingkindness, Unto the wild beast of the earth:
content_old: 2 They have given The dead bodies of thy servants､ As food for the birds of the heavens, The flesh of thy men of lovingkindness, Unto the wild beast of the earth:

content: 3 They have poured out their blood like water Round about Jerusalem, With none to bury.
content_old: 3 They have poured out their blood like water Round about Jerusalem, With none to bury.

content: 4 We have become A reproach to our neighbours,— A mockery and a derision, to them who are round about us.
content_old: 4 We have become A reproach to our neighbours,— A mockery and a derision, to them who are round about us.

content: 5 How long､ O Yahweh､ wilt thou be angry utterly? Shall thy jealousy burn like fire?
content_old: 5 How long､ O Yahweh､ wilt thou be angry utterly? Shall thy jealousy burn like fire?

content: 6 Pour out thy wrath Upon the nations that have not known thee,—and Upon the kingdoms that on thy Name have not called.
content_old: 6 Pour out thy wrath Upon the nations that have not known thee,—and Upon the kingdoms that on thy Name have not called.

content: 7 For he hath devoured Jacob,— And his dwelling-place have they laid waste.
content_old: 7 For he hath devoured Jacob,— And his dwelling-place have they laid waste.

content: 8 Do not remember against us former iniquities,— Haste thee､ let thy compassions come to meet us, For we have been brought very low!
content_old: 8 Do not remember against us former iniquities,— Haste thee､ let thy compassions come to meet us, For we have been brought very low!

content: 9 Help us､ O God of our salvation､ On account of the glory of thy Name,— Rescue us then､ and put a propitiatory-covering over our sins, For the sake of thy Name.
content_old: 9 Help us､ O God of our salvation､ On account of the glory of thy Name,— Rescue us then､ and put a propitiatory-covering over our sins, For the sake of thy Name.

content: 10 Wherefore should the nations say— Where is their God? Let him be known among the nations before our eyes! Yea! by the avenging of the blood of thy servants which hath been shed!
content_old: 10 Wherefore should the nations say— Where is their God? Let him be known among the nations before our eyes! Yea! by the avenging of the blood of thy servants which hath been shed!

content: 11 Let the groaning of the prisoner come in before thee,— According to the greatness of thine arm Set free them who are appointed to death.
content_old: 11 Let the groaning of the prisoner come in before thee,— According to the greatness of thine arm Set free them who are appointed to death.

content: 12 Return､ therefore､ unto our neighbours— Sevenfold､ into their own bosom､ The reproach wherewith they have reproached thee､ O Adonây!
content_old: 12 Return､ therefore､ unto our neighbours— Sevenfold､ into their own bosom､ The reproach wherewith they have reproached thee､ O Adonây!

content: To the Chief Musician. For “the Lilies of Testimony.” Asaph’s. A Melody.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. For “the Lilies of Testimony.” Asaph’s. A Melody.

content: 1 O Shepherd of Israel､ give ear､ Thou who leddest forth Joseph like a flock, Thou who art throned on the cherubim､ appear!
content_old: 1 O Shepherd of Israel､ give ear､ Thou who leddest forth Joseph like a flock, Thou who art throned on the cherubim､ appear!

content: 2 Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, And come! to our salvation.
content_old: 2 Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, And come! to our salvation.

content: 3 O God､ bring us back, And light up thy face､ That we may be saved.
content_old: 3 O God､ bring us back, And light up thy face､ That we may be saved.

content: 4 O Yahweh､ God of hosts! How long hast thou been wroth with the prayer of thy people?
content_old: 4 O Yahweh､ God of hosts! How long hast thou been wroth with the prayer of thy people?

content: 5 Thou hast fed them with the food of tears, And hast caused them to drink the water of weeping in threefold abundance.
content_old: 5 Thou hast fed them with the food of tears, And hast caused them to drink the water of weeping in threefold abundance.

content: 6 Thou dost make us an object of contention to our neighbours, And our foes find mockery for themselves.
content_old: 6 Thou dost make us an object of contention to our neighbours, And our foes find mockery for themselves.

content: 7 O God of hosts､ bring us back, And light up thy face, That we may be saved.
content_old: 7 O God of hosts､ bring us back, And light up thy face, That we may be saved.

content: 8 A vine out of Egypt thou didst remove, Thou didst cast out nations, and plant it;
content_old: 8 A vine out of Egypt thou didst remove, Thou didst cast out nations, and plant it;

content: 9 Thou didst make a clear space before it, So it rooted well its roots､ and filled up the land;
content_old: 9 Thou didst make a clear space before it, So it rooted well its roots､ and filled up the land;

content: 10 Covered were the mountains with its shade, And with its boughs the mighty cedars.
content_old: 10 Covered were the mountains with its shade, And with its boughs the mighty cedars.

content: 11 It thrust forth its branches as far as the sea,— And unto the River its shoots.
content_old: 11 It thrust forth its branches as far as the sea,— And unto the River its shoots.

content: 12 Wherefore hast thou broken down its fences, So that all who pass along the way pluck its fruit?
content_old: 12 Wherefore hast thou broken down its fences, So that all who pass along the way pluck its fruit?

content: 13 The boar out of the forest browseth upon it, And the wild beast of the field pastureth thereon.
content_old: 13 The boar out of the forest browseth upon it, And the wild beast of the field pastureth thereon.

content: 14 O God of hosts､ return, we pray thee,— Look down out of the heavens､ and see, And inspect this vine:
content_old: 14 O God of hosts､ return, we pray thee,— Look down out of the heavens､ and see, And inspect this vine:

content: 15 Yea the stock which thy right hand planted, Even upon the son thou didst secure for thyself.
content_old: 15 Yea the stock which thy right hand planted, Even upon the son thou didst secure for thyself.

content: 16 To be burned with fire it is cut down,— At the rebuke of thy countenance they will perish.
content_old: 16 To be burned with fire it is cut down,— At the rebuke of thy countenance they will perish.

content: 17 Let thy hand be Upon the Man of thy right hand, Upon the Son of Man thou didst secure for thyself;
content_old: 17 Let thy hand be Upon the Man of thy right hand, Upon the Son of Man thou didst secure for thyself;

content: 18 So will we not draw back from thee, Thou wilt bring us to life､ And on thy Name will we call.
content_old: 18 So will we not draw back from thee, Thou wilt bring us to life､ And on thy Name will we call.

content: To the Chief Musician. On “the Gittith.” Asaph’s.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On “the Gittith.” Asaph’s.

content: 1 Shout ye for joy､ unto God our strength, Sound the note of triumph､ to the God of Jacob;
content_old: 1 Shout ye for joy､ unto God our strength, Sound the note of triumph､ to the God of Jacob;

content: 2 Raise a melody､ and strike the timbrel, The lyre so sweet､ with the harp:
content_old: 2 Raise a melody､ and strike the timbrel, The lyre so sweet､ with the harp:

content: 3 Blow､ at the new moon､ the horn, At the full moon､ for the day of our sacred festival:
content_old: 3 Blow､ at the new moon､ the horn, At the full moon､ for the day of our sacred festival:

content: 4 For a statute to Israel it is, A regulation, by the God of Jacob;
content_old: 4 For a statute to Israel it is, A regulation, by the God of Jacob;

content: 5 A testimony in Joseph he appointed it､ When he went forth over the land of Egypt: A language I liked not used I to hear;
content_old: 5 A testimony in Joseph he appointed it､ When he went forth over the land of Egypt: A language I liked not used I to hear;

content: 6 I took away､ from the burden､ his shoulder, His hands from the clay were set free.
content_old: 6 I took away､ from the burden､ his shoulder, His hands from the clay were set free.

content: 7 In distress thou didst cry､ and I delivered thee,— I answered thee､ within a hiding-place of thunder, I proved thee by the waters of Meribah. Selah.
content_old: 7 In distress thou didst cry､ and I delivered thee,— I answered thee､ within a hiding-place of thunder, I proved thee by the waters of Meribah. Selah.

content: 8 Hear､ O my people､ and I will adjure thee, O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me!
content_old: 8 Hear､ O my people､ and I will adjure thee, O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me!

content: 9 There shall not be within thee a foreign GOD,— Neither shalt thou bow down to a strange GOD:
content_old: 9 There shall not be within thee a foreign GOD,— Neither shalt thou bow down to a strange GOD:

content: 10 I､ Yahweh am thy God､ Who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt,— Open wide thy mouth, that I may fill it.
content_old: 10 I､ Yahweh am thy God､ Who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt,— Open wide thy mouth, that I may fill it.

content: 11 But my people hearkened not unto my voice, Even Israel inclined not unto me.
content_old: 11 But my people hearkened not unto my voice, Even Israel inclined not unto me.

content: 12 So then I let them go on in the stubbornness of their own heart, They might walk in their own counsels!
content_old: 12 So then I let them go on in the stubbornness of their own heart, They might walk in their own counsels!

content: 13 If my people were hearkening unto me, If Israel in my ways would walk
content_old: 13 If my people were hearkening unto me, If Israel in my ways would walk

content: 14 Right soon their foes would I subdue, And against their adversaries would I turn my hand:
content_old: 14 Right soon their foes would I subdue, And against their adversaries would I turn my hand:

content: 15 The haters of Yahweh should come cringing unto him, Then let their own good time be age-abiding!
content_old: 15 The haters of Yahweh should come cringing unto him, Then let their own good time be age-abiding!

content: A Melody of Asaph.
content_old: A Melody of Asaph.

content: 1 God hath taken his place in the august assembly, In the midst of the gods will he judge.
content_old: 1 God hath taken his place in the august assembly, In the midst of the gods will he judge.

content: 2 How long will ye judge perversely And the countenances of the lawless uplift? Selah.
content_old: 2 How long will ye judge perversely And the countenances of the lawless uplift? Selah.

content: 3 Vindicate the weak and the fatherless, The oppressed and the poor see righted;
content_old: 3 Vindicate the weak and the fatherless, The oppressed and the poor see righted;

content: 4 Deliver the weak and the needy, Out of the hand of the lawless make rescue.
content_old: 4 Deliver the weak and the needy, Out of the hand of the lawless make rescue.

content: 5 They know not､ neither can they perceive､ In darkness they wander, All the foundations of the earth do shake
content_old: 5 They know not､ neither can they perceive､ In darkness they wander, All the foundations of the earth do shake

content: 6 I said､ Gods ye are, Yea sons of the Highest are ye all;
content_old: 6 I said､ Gods ye are, Yea sons of the Highest are ye all;

content: 7 But indeed､ like the earth-born shall ye die! And like one of the princes shall ye fall!
content_old: 7 But indeed､ like the earth-born shall ye die! And like one of the princes shall ye fall!

content: A Song, a Melody of Asaph.
content_old: A Song, a Melody of Asaph.

content: 1 O God､ Do not keep quiet, Do not hold thy peace､ Neither be thou still､ O GOD!
content_old: 1 O God､ Do not keep quiet, Do not hold thy peace､ Neither be thou still､ O GOD!

content: 2 For lo! thine enemies are tumultuous, And they who hate thee have lifted up the head;
content_old: 2 For lo! thine enemies are tumultuous, And they who hate thee have lifted up the head;

content: 3 Against thy people they craftily devise a secret plot, And conspire against thy treasured ones.
content_old: 3 Against thy people they craftily devise a secret plot, And conspire against thy treasured ones.

content: 4 They have said— Come､ and let us wipe them out from being a nation, That the name of Israel may be remembered no more.
content_old: 4 They have said— Come､ and let us wipe them out from being a nation, That the name of Israel may be remembered no more.

content: 5 For they have taken counsel with one heart, Against thee—a covenant would they solemnise—
content_old: 5 For they have taken counsel with one heart, Against thee—a covenant would they solemnise—

content: 6 The tents of Edom､ and the Ishmaelites､ Of Moab and the Hagarenes;
content_old: 6 The tents of Edom､ and the Ishmaelites､ Of Moab and the Hagarenes;

content: 7 Gebal and Ammon､ and Amalek, The Philistines､ with the dwellers in Tyre;
content_old: 7 Gebal and Ammon､ and Amalek, The Philistines､ with the dwellers in Tyre;

content: 8 Even Assyria hath joined herself with them, They have become an arm to the sons of Lot. Selah.
content_old: 8 Even Assyria hath joined herself with them, They have become an arm to the sons of Lot. Selah.

content: 9 Make them like Midian, Like Sisera､ like Jabin､ by the torrent of Kishon;
content_old: 9 Make them like Midian, Like Sisera､ like Jabin､ by the torrent of Kishon;

content: 10 They perished at En-dor, They became manure for the soil!
content_old: 10 They perished at En-dor, They became manure for the soil!

content: 11 Make them—their nobles—like Oreb and like Zeeb, And like Zebah and like Zalmunna all their princes:
content_old: 11 Make them—their nobles—like Oreb and like Zeeb, And like Zebah and like Zalmunna all their princes:

content: 12 Who said— Let us take a possession for ourselves The pastures of God!
content_old: 12 Who said— Let us take a possession for ourselves The pastures of God!

content: 13 O my God､ make them As whirling dust, As chaff before a wind;
content_old: 13 O my God､ make them As whirling dust, As chaff before a wind;

content: 14 As a fire burneth a forest,— And as a flame setteth mountains ablaze
content_old: 14 As a fire burneth a forest,— And as a flame setteth mountains ablaze

content: 15 So wilt thou pursue them with thy tempest,— And with thy storm-wind wilt terrify them:
content_old: 15 So wilt thou pursue them with thy tempest,— And with thy storm-wind wilt terrify them:

content: 16 Fill thou their faces with dishonour, That men may seek thy Name､ O Yahweh;
content_old: 16 Fill thou their faces with dishonour, That men may seek thy Name､ O Yahweh;

content: 17 Let them turn pale､ and be terrified to futurity, Yea let them blush､ and perish:
content_old: 17 Let them turn pale､ and be terrified to futurity, Yea let them blush､ and perish:

content: To the Chief Musician. On “the Gittith.” For the Sons of Korah. A Melody.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. On “the Gittith.” For the Sons of Korah. A Melody.

content: 1 How lovely are thy habitations､ O Yahweh of hosts!
content_old: 1 How lovely are thy habitations､ O Yahweh of hosts!

content: 2 My soul longeth—yea even languisheth—for the courts of Yahweh,— My heart and my flesh shout aloud for a Living GOD.
content_old: 2 My soul longeth—yea even languisheth—for the courts of Yahweh,— My heart and my flesh shout aloud for a Living GOD.

content: 3 Even the sparrow hath found a home. And the swallow a nest for herself where she hath laid her young, Thine altars､ O Yahweh of hosts, My king and my God!
content_old: 3 Even the sparrow hath found a home. And the swallow a nest for herself where she hath laid her young, Thine altars､ O Yahweh of hosts, My king and my God!

content: 4 How happy are they who abide in thy house,— Still are they praising thee. Selah.
content_old: 4 How happy are they who abide in thy house,— Still are they praising thee. Selah.

content: 5 How happy the men whose strength is in thee, Festive processions are in their heart.
content_old: 5 How happy the men whose strength is in thee, Festive processions are in their heart.

content: 6 Passing through the balsam-vale A place of fountains they make it, Yea with blessings is it covered by the early rain.
content_old: 6 Passing through the balsam-vale A place of fountains they make it, Yea with blessings is it covered by the early rain.

content: 7 They go from strength to strength, Each one appeareth before God in Zion.
content_old: 7 They go from strength to strength, Each one appeareth before God in Zion.

content: 8 O Yahweh､ God of hosts､ hear thou my prayer,— Give hear､ thou God of Jacob. Selah.
content_old: 8 O Yahweh､ God of hosts､ hear thou my prayer,— Give hear､ thou God of Jacob. Selah.

content: 9 Our Shield behold thou､ O God, And look upon the face of thine Anointed One.
content_old: 9 Our Shield behold thou､ O God, And look upon the face of thine Anointed One.

content: 10 For better is a day in thy courts､ than a thousand, I choose rather to stand at the threshold in the house of my God, Than to dwell in the tents of lawlessness.
content_old: 10 For better is a day in thy courts､ than a thousand, I choose rather to stand at the threshold in the house of my God, Than to dwell in the tents of lawlessness.

content: 11 For a sun and shield is Yahweh God,— Grace and glory will Yahweh give, He will not withhold what is good､ from them who walk without blame.
content_old: 11 For a sun and shield is Yahweh God,— Grace and glory will Yahweh give, He will not withhold what is good､ from them who walk without blame.

content: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah. A Melody.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. For the Sons of Korah. A Melody.

content: 1 Thou hast accepted､ O Yahweh､ thy land, Thou hast brought back the captives of Jacob;
content_old: 1 Thou hast accepted､ O Yahweh､ thy land, Thou hast brought back the captives of Jacob;

content: 2 Thou hast taken away､ the iniquity of thy people, Thou hast covered､ all their sin. Selah.
content_old: 2 Thou hast taken away､ the iniquity of thy people, Thou hast covered､ all their sin. Selah.

content: 3 Thou hast withdrawn all thine indignation, Thou hast ceased from the glow of thine anger.
content_old: 3 Thou hast withdrawn all thine indignation, Thou hast ceased from the glow of thine anger.

content: 4 Restore us､ O God of our salvation, And take away thy vexation towards us.
content_old: 4 Restore us､ O God of our salvation, And take away thy vexation towards us.

content: 5 To times age-abiding wilt thou be angry with us? Wilt thou prolong thine anger､ from generation to generation?
content_old: 5 To times age-abiding wilt thou be angry with us? Wilt thou prolong thine anger､ from generation to generation?

content: 6 Wilt not thou thyself again give us life, That thy people may rejoice in thee.
content_old: 6 Wilt not thou thyself again give us life, That thy people may rejoice in thee.

content: 7 Shew us､ O Yahweh､ thy lovingkindness, And thy salvation wilt thou grant us.
content_old: 7 Shew us､ O Yahweh､ thy lovingkindness, And thy salvation wilt thou grant us.

content: 8 I will hear､ what GOD—Yahweh—will speak,— For he will bespeak prosperity to his people､ And to his men of lovingkindness, And to them who return with their heart unto him.
content_old: 8 I will hear､ what GOD—Yahweh—will speak,— For he will bespeak prosperity to his people､ And to his men of lovingkindness, And to them who return with their heart unto him.

content: 9 Surely near unto them who revere him is his salvation, That the Glory may settle down in our land.
content_old: 9 Surely near unto them who revere him is his salvation, That the Glory may settle down in our land.

content: 10 Lovingkindness and faithfulness have met together, Righteousness and prosperity have kissed each other;
content_old: 10 Lovingkindness and faithfulness have met together, Righteousness and prosperity have kissed each other;

content: 11 Faithfulness out of the earth doth spring forth, And righteousness out of the heavens hath looked down.
content_old: 11 Faithfulness out of the earth doth spring forth, And righteousness out of the heavens hath looked down.

content: 12 Yahweh himself too will give us the blessing, And our land shall yield her increase.
content_old: 12 Yahweh himself too will give us the blessing, And our land shall yield her increase.

content: A Prayer. David’s.
content_old: A Prayer. David’s.

content: 1 Bow down､ O Yahweh､ thine ear—answer me, For oppressed and needy am I;
content_old: 1 Bow down､ O Yahweh､ thine ear—answer me, For oppressed and needy am I;

content: 2 O guard my life､ For a man of lovingkindness am I,— Save thy servant､ O thou my God, Thy servant who trusteth in thee;
content_old: 2 O guard my life､ For a man of lovingkindness am I,— Save thy servant､ O thou my God, Thy servant who trusteth in thee;

content: 3 Shew me favour､ O My Lord, For unto thee do I cry､ all the day;
content_old: 3 Shew me favour､ O My Lord, For unto thee do I cry､ all the day;

content: 4 Rejoice the soul of thy servant, For unto thee O My Lord my soul do I lift.
content_old: 4 Rejoice the soul of thy servant, For unto thee O My Lord my soul do I lift.

content: 5 For thou､ O My Lord art good and forgiving､ And abundant in lovingkindness､ to all who call upon thee.
content_old: 5 For thou､ O My Lord art good and forgiving､ And abundant in lovingkindness､ to all who call upon thee.

content: 6 Give ear､ O Yahweh､ unto my prayer, And attend unto the voice of my supplications.
content_old: 6 Give ear､ O Yahweh､ unto my prayer, And attend unto the voice of my supplications.

content: 7 ln the day of my distress will I call upon thee, For thou wilt answer me.
content_old: 7 ln the day of my distress will I call upon thee, For thou wilt answer me.

content: 8 There is none like unto thee､ among the gods､ O My Lord, And nothing like thy works.
content_old: 8 There is none like unto thee､ among the gods､ O My Lord, And nothing like thy works.

content: 9 All nations whom thou hast made Shall come in and bow down before thee､ O My Lord, That they may glorify thy Name.
content_old: 9 All nations whom thou hast made Shall come in and bow down before thee､ O My Lord, That they may glorify thy Name.

content: 10 For great thou art､ and doest wondrous things, Thou､ O God､ of thyself alone.
content_old: 10 For great thou art､ and doest wondrous things, Thou､ O God､ of thyself alone.

content: 11 Point out to me､ O Yahweh､ thy way､ I will walk steadfastly in thy truth, My heart will rejoice to revere thy Name.
content_old: 11 Point out to me､ O Yahweh､ thy way､ I will walk steadfastly in thy truth, My heart will rejoice to revere thy Name.

content: 12 I will give thee thanks､ Adonây､ my God､ with all my heart, And will glorify thy Name unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 12 I will give thee thanks､ Adonây､ my God､ with all my heart, And will glorify thy Name unto times age-abiding.

content: 13 For thy lovingkindness is great towards me, And thou hast rescued my soul from Hades beneath.
content_old: 13 For thy lovingkindness is great towards me, And thou hast rescued my soul from Hades beneath.

content: 14 O God､ the insolent have arisen against me､ And the assembly of tyrants have sought my life, And have not set thee before them.
content_old: 14 O God､ the insolent have arisen against me､ And the assembly of tyrants have sought my life, And have not set thee before them.

content: 15 But thou､ O My Lord art A God of compassion and favour, Slow to anger, and abundant in lovingkindness and faithfulness?
content_old: 15 But thou､ O My Lord art A God of compassion and favour, Slow to anger, and abundant in lovingkindness and faithfulness?

content: 16 Turn thou unto me､ and shew me favour,— Give thy strength to thy servant, And save the son of thy handmaid.
content_old: 16 Turn thou unto me､ and shew me favour,— Give thy strength to thy servant, And save the son of thy handmaid.

content: For the Sons of Korah. A Melody, a Song.
content_old: For the Sons of Korah. A Melody, a Song.

content: 1 His foundation is in the holy mountains:
content_old: 1 His foundation is in the holy mountains:

content: 2 Yahweh loveth the gates of Zion, More than all the dwellings of Jacob.
content_old: 2 Yahweh loveth the gates of Zion, More than all the dwellings of Jacob.

content: 3 Glorious things are to be spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.
content_old: 3 Glorious things are to be spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.

content: 4 I will mention Rahab and Babylon､ to them who know me,— Lo! Philistia and Tyre with Ethiopia, This one was born there.
content_old: 4 I will mention Rahab and Babylon､ to them who know me,— Lo! Philistia and Tyre with Ethiopia, This one was born there.

content: 5 But of Zion it shall be said— This man and that were born in her, And the Highest himself shall establish her.
content_old: 5 But of Zion it shall be said— This man and that were born in her, And the Highest himself shall establish her.

content: 6 Yahweh will record､ when he enrolleth the peoples, This one was born there. Selah.
content_old: 6 Yahweh will record､ when he enrolleth the peoples, This one was born there. Selah.

content: A Song, a Melody. For the Sons of Korah. To the Chief Musician. On “Maḥalath.” For alternate Song. An Instructive Psalm. By Heman the Ezrahite.
content_old: A Song, a Melody. For the Sons of Korah. To the Chief Musician. On “Maḥalath.” For alternate Song. An Instructive Psalm. By Heman the Ezrahite.

content: 1 O Yahweh､ God of my salvation, By day have I made outcry､ In the night also before thee.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh､ God of my salvation, By day have I made outcry､ In the night also before thee.

content: 2 Let my prayer come into thy presence, Bow down thine ear to my loud cry.
content_old: 2 Let my prayer come into thy presence, Bow down thine ear to my loud cry.

content: 3 For my soul is sated with misfortunes. And my life—unto Hades hath drawn near;
content_old: 3 For my soul is sated with misfortunes. And my life—unto Hades hath drawn near;

content: 4 I am counted with them who descend into the pit, I have become as a man that is without help;
content_old: 4 I am counted with them who descend into the pit, I have become as a man that is without help;

content: 5 Among the dead is my couch,— Like the slain that lie in the grave､ Where thou rememberest them no more, Yea they from thy hand are cut off;
content_old: 5 Among the dead is my couch,— Like the slain that lie in the grave､ Where thou rememberest them no more, Yea they from thy hand are cut off;

content: 6 Thou hast laid me In the lowest pit, In dark places, In the deeps:
content_old: 6 Thou hast laid me In the lowest pit, In dark places, In the deeps:

content: 7 Upon me hath rested thine indignation, And with all thy breakers hast thou caused affliction. Selah.
content_old: 7 Upon me hath rested thine indignation, And with all thy breakers hast thou caused affliction. Selah.

content: 8 Thou hast far removed mine acquaintances from me,— Thou hast made me an abomination unto them, Shut up and I cannot go forth!
content_old: 8 Thou hast far removed mine acquaintances from me,— Thou hast made me an abomination unto them, Shut up and I cannot go forth!

content: 9 Mine eye hath dimmed through affliction; I have called upon thee､ O Yahweh､ all day long, I have spread out､ unto thee､ my hands.
content_old: 9 Mine eye hath dimmed through affliction; I have called upon thee､ O Yahweh､ all day long, I have spread out､ unto thee､ my hands.

content: 10 For the dead wilt thou perform a wonder? Or shall the shades arising､ give thee thanks? Selah.
content_old: 10 For the dead wilt thou perform a wonder? Or shall the shades arising､ give thee thanks? Selah.

content: 11 Shall Thy lovingkindness be recounted in the grave? Thy faithfulness, in destruction?
content_old: 11 Shall Thy lovingkindness be recounted in the grave? Thy faithfulness, in destruction?

content: 12 Shall any wonder of thine be known in the dark? Or thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
content_old: 12 Shall any wonder of thine be known in the dark? Or thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

content: 13 But I unto thee､ O Yahweh have cried for help, And in the morning my prayer will confront thee!
content_old: 13 But I unto thee､ O Yahweh have cried for help, And in the morning my prayer will confront thee!

content: 14 Wherefore､ O Yahweh､ shouldst thou reject my soul? shouldst thou hide thy face from me?
content_old: 14 Wherefore､ O Yahweh､ shouldst thou reject my soul? shouldst thou hide thy face from me?

content: 15 Afflicted have I been､ and dying､ from youth, I have borne the terror of thee—I shall be distracted!
content_old: 15 Afflicted have I been､ and dying､ from youth, I have borne the terror of thee—I shall be distracted!

content: 16 Over me have passed thy bursts of burning anger, The alarms of thee have put an end to me;
content_old: 16 Over me have passed thy bursts of burning anger, The alarms of thee have put an end to me;

content: 17 They have surrounded me like waters､ all the day, They have come circling against me together:
content_old: 17 They have surrounded me like waters､ all the day, They have come circling against me together:

content: An Instructive Psalm, by Ethan the Ezrahite.
content_old: An Instructive Psalm, by Ethan the Ezrahite.

content: 1 The lovingkindnesses of Yahweh age-abidingly will I sing, To generation after generation will I make known thy faithfulness with my mouth.
content_old: 1 The lovingkindnesses of Yahweh age-abidingly will I sing, To generation after generation will I make known thy faithfulness with my mouth.

content: 2 For I said､ To times age-abiding shall lovingkindness be built up, As for the heavens thou wilt establish thy faithfulness therein.
content_old: 2 For I said､ To times age-abiding shall lovingkindness be built up, As for the heavens thou wilt establish thy faithfulness therein.

content: 3 I have solemnised a covenant､ for my chosen one, I have sworn unto David my servant:
content_old: 3 I have solemnised a covenant､ for my chosen one, I have sworn unto David my servant:

content: 4 Unto times age-abiding will I establish thy seed, And will build up､ unto generation after generation､ thy throne. Selah.
content_old: 4 Unto times age-abiding will I establish thy seed, And will build up､ unto generation after generation､ thy throne. Selah.

content: 5 So shall the heavens praise thy wondrousness､ O Yahweh,— Yea thy faithfulness in the convocation of holy ones.
content_old: 5 So shall the heavens praise thy wondrousness､ O Yahweh,— Yea thy faithfulness in the convocation of holy ones.

content: 6 For whom､ in the skies､ can one compare unto Yahweh? Or can one liken unto Yahweh, among the sons of the mighty?
content_old: 6 For whom､ in the skies､ can one compare unto Yahweh? Or can one liken unto Yahweh, among the sons of the mighty?

content: 7 A GOD inspiring awe in the circle of the holy ones､ exceedingly, And to be reverenced above all who are round about him.
content_old: 7 A GOD inspiring awe in the circle of the holy ones､ exceedingly, And to be reverenced above all who are round about him.

content: 8 O Yahweh､ God of hosts! Who､ like thee､ is mighty､ O Yah! With thy faithfulness round about thee:
content_old: 8 O Yahweh､ God of hosts! Who､ like thee､ is mighty､ O Yah! With thy faithfulness round about thee:

content: 9 Thou rulest over the swelling of the sea, When the rolling waves thereof lift themselves Thou dost bid them be still:
content_old: 9 Thou rulest over the swelling of the sea, When the rolling waves thereof lift themselves Thou dost bid them be still:

content: 10 Thou hast crushed—as one slain—Rahab, With thy strong arm hast thou scattered thy foes.
content_old: 10 Thou hast crushed—as one slain—Rahab, With thy strong arm hast thou scattered thy foes.

content: 11 Thine are the heavens Yea thine the earth, The world and the fulness thereof Thou didst found them;
content_old: 11 Thine are the heavens Yea thine the earth, The world and the fulness thereof Thou didst found them;

content: 12 The north and the south Thou didst create them,— Tabor and Hermon with thy Name shall shout for joy:
content_old: 12 The north and the south Thou didst create them,— Tabor and Hermon with thy Name shall shout for joy:

content: 13 Thine is an arm with might, Strong is thy hand, High is thy right hand;
content_old: 13 Thine is an arm with might, Strong is thy hand, High is thy right hand;

content: 14 Righteousness and justice are the establishing of thy throne, Lovingkindness and faithfulness go before thy face.
content_old: 14 Righteousness and justice are the establishing of thy throne, Lovingkindness and faithfulness go before thy face.

content: 15 How happy are the people who know the joyful sound! O Yahweh! in the light of thy countenance shall they firmly march along;
content_old: 15 How happy are the people who know the joyful sound! O Yahweh! in the light of thy countenance shall they firmly march along;

content: 16 In thy Name shall they exult all the day, And in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
content_old: 16 In thy Name shall they exult all the day, And in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.

content: 17 For the beauty of their strength thou art, And in thine acceptance shall our horns be exalted.
content_old: 17 For the beauty of their strength thou art, And in thine acceptance shall our horns be exalted.

content: 18 For to Yahweh belongeth our Shield, And to the Holy One of Israel belongeth our King.
content_old: 18 For to Yahweh belongeth our Shield, And to the Holy One of Israel belongeth our King.

content: 19 Then spakest thou in vision of thy men of lovingkindness､ And saidst— I have laid help upon a mighty one, I have exalted one chosen from among the people;
content_old: 19 Then spakest thou in vision of thy men of lovingkindness､ And saidst— I have laid help upon a mighty one, I have exalted one chosen from among the people;

content: 20 I have found David my servant, With mine own holy oil have I anointed him;
content_old: 20 I have found David my servant, With mine own holy oil have I anointed him;

content: 21 With whom my hand shall be firm, Yea mine arm shall strengthen him;
content_old: 21 With whom my hand shall be firm, Yea mine arm shall strengthen him;

content: 22 No foe shall make exactions on him, Nor shall a son of perversity humiliate him;
content_old: 22 No foe shall make exactions on him, Nor shall a son of perversity humiliate him;

content: 23 And I will shatter､ from before him､ his adversaries, And them who hate him will I smite;
content_old: 23 And I will shatter､ from before him､ his adversaries, And them who hate him will I smite;

content: 24 And my faithfulness and my lovingkindness shall be with him, And in my Name exalted shall be his horn;
content_old: 24 And my faithfulness and my lovingkindness shall be with him, And in my Name exalted shall be his horn;

content: 25 And I will set､ in the sea､ his hand, And､ in the rivers､ his right hand;
content_old: 25 And I will set､ in the sea､ his hand, And､ in the rivers､ his right hand;

content: 26 He shall cry out unto me､ My Father thou art, My GOD, and my Rock of Salvation!
content_old: 26 He shall cry out unto me､ My Father thou art, My GOD, and my Rock of Salvation!

content: 27 Yea I will appoint him firstborn, Most High to the kings of the earth!
content_old: 27 Yea I will appoint him firstborn, Most High to the kings of the earth!

content: 28 Age-abidingly will I keep for him my lovingkindness, And my covenant hath been made steadfast for him;
content_old: 28 Age-abidingly will I keep for him my lovingkindness, And my covenant hath been made steadfast for him;

content: 29 Therefore will I appoint､ to futurity､ his seed, And his throne as the days of the heavens.
content_old: 29 Therefore will I appoint､ to futurity､ his seed, And his throne as the days of the heavens.

content: 30 If his sons forsake my law, And in my regulations do not walk;
content_old: 30 If his sons forsake my law, And in my regulations do not walk;

content: 31 If my statutes they profane, And my commandments do not keep
content_old: 31 If my statutes they profane, And my commandments do not keep

content: 32 Then will I punish with a rod their transgression; And with stripes their iniquity:
content_old: 32 Then will I punish with a rod their transgression; And with stripes their iniquity:

content: 33 But my lovingkindness will I not frustrate from them, Neither will I falsify my faithfulness;
content_old: 33 But my lovingkindness will I not frustrate from them, Neither will I falsify my faithfulness;

content: 34 I will not violate my covenant, And that which hath proceeded out of my lips will I not alter:
content_old: 34 I will not violate my covenant, And that which hath proceeded out of my lips will I not alter:

content: 35 One thing have I sworn by my holiness, Verily to David will I not lie;
content_old: 35 One thing have I sworn by my holiness, Verily to David will I not lie;

content: 36 His seed age-abidingly shall remain, And his throne be like the sun before me;
content_old: 36 His seed age-abidingly shall remain, And his throne be like the sun before me;

content: 37 Like the moon shall it be established unto times age-abiding, And a witness in the skies hath been made sure. Selah.
content_old: 37 Like the moon shall it be established unto times age-abiding, And a witness in the skies hath been made sure. Selah.

content: 38 Yet thou thyself hast cast off､ and rejected, Thou hast been wroth with thine Anointed One!
content_old: 38 Yet thou thyself hast cast off､ and rejected, Thou hast been wroth with thine Anointed One!

content: 39 Thou hast cast down the covenant of thy Servant, Thou hast profaned､ to the earth､ his crown;
content_old: 39 Thou hast cast down the covenant of thy Servant, Thou hast profaned､ to the earth､ his crown;

content: 40 Thou hast broken down all his defences, Thou hast laid his fortresses in ruins;
content_old: 40 Thou hast broken down all his defences, Thou hast laid his fortresses in ruins;

content: 41 All the passers by the way have plundered him, He hath become a reproach to his neighbours;
content_old: 41 All the passers by the way have plundered him, He hath become a reproach to his neighbours;

content: 42 Thou hast raised the right hand of his adversaries, Thou hast gladdened all his enemies;
content_old: 42 Thou hast raised the right hand of his adversaries, Thou hast gladdened all his enemies;

content: 43 Yea thou hast turned the edge of his sword, Neither hast thou caused him to stand in the battle;
content_old: 43 Yea thou hast turned the edge of his sword, Neither hast thou caused him to stand in the battle;

content: 44 Thou hast brought to an end his splendour, And his throne—to the ground hast thou hurled;
content_old: 44 Thou hast brought to an end his splendour, And his throne—to the ground hast thou hurled;

content: 45 Thou hast shortened the days of his youths,— Thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.
content_old: 45 Thou hast shortened the days of his youths,— Thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

content: 46 How long､ O Yahweh､ Wilt thou hide thyself utterly? Shall thine indignation burn like fire?
content_old: 46 How long､ O Yahweh､ Wilt thou hide thyself utterly? Shall thine indignation burn like fire?

content: 47 Remember how short-lived I am, Wherefore in vain hast thou created all the sons of Adam?
content_old: 47 Remember how short-lived I am, Wherefore in vain hast thou created all the sons of Adam?

content: 48 Who is the man that shall live､ and not see death? That can deliver his soul from the hand of hades. Selah.
content_old: 48 Who is the man that shall live､ and not see death? That can deliver his soul from the hand of hades. Selah.

content: 49 Where are thy former lovingkindnesses, O My Lord? Thou didst swear unto David, in thy faithfulness!
content_old: 49 Where are thy former lovingkindnesses, O My Lord? Thou didst swear unto David, in thy faithfulness!

content: 50 Remember､ O My Lord､ the reproach of thy servants, I have carried in my bosom the insult of the peoples:
content_old: 50 Remember､ O My Lord､ the reproach of thy servants, I have carried in my bosom the insult of the peoples:

content: 51 In that thy foes have reproached､ O Yahweh, In that they have reproached the footsteps of thine Anointed One!
content_old: 51 In that thy foes have reproached､ O Yahweh, In that they have reproached the footsteps of thine Anointed One!

content: A Prayer by Moses､ the Man of God.
content_old: A Prayer by Moses､ the Man of God.

content: 1 Lord! a dwelling-place hast thou become to us､ From generation to generation:
content_old: 1 Lord! a dwelling-place hast thou become to us､ From generation to generation:

content: 2 Before the mountains were born､ Or thou hadst brought forth the earth and the world Even from age unto age thou wast GOD.
content_old: 2 Before the mountains were born､ Or thou hadst brought forth the earth and the world Even from age unto age thou wast GOD.

content: 3 Thou causest man to return unto dust, And hast said— Return､ ye sons of Adam!
content_old: 3 Thou causest man to return unto dust, And hast said— Return､ ye sons of Adam!

content: 4 For a thousand years､ in thine eyes are As yesterday､ in that it passed away, Or as a watch in the night.
content_old: 4 For a thousand years､ in thine eyes are As yesterday､ in that it passed away, Or as a watch in the night.

content: 5 Thou hast snatched them away､ A sleep do they become, In the morning they are like grass that shooteth up,
content_old: 5 Thou hast snatched them away､ A sleep do they become, In the morning they are like grass that shooteth up,

content: 6 In the morning it sprouteth and shooteth up, By the evening it is cut down and withered.
content_old: 6 In the morning it sprouteth and shooteth up, By the evening it is cut down and withered.
