content: 7 For we are consumed in thine anger, And in thy wrath are we dismayed;
content_old: 7 For we are consumed in thine anger, And in thy wrath are we dismayed;

content: 8 Thou hast set Our iniquities before thee, Our secret near the luminary of thy face.
content_old: 8 Thou hast set Our iniquities before thee, Our secret near the luminary of thy face.

content: 9 For all our days decline in thy wrath,— We end our years like a sigh.
content_old: 9 For all our days decline in thy wrath,— We end our years like a sigh.

content: 10 The days of our years have､ in them､ three score years and ten, And if by reason of strength they have fourscore years Yet their boast is labour and sorrow, For it hath passed quickly､ and we have flown away.
content_old: 10 The days of our years have､ in them､ three score years and ten, And if by reason of strength they have fourscore years Yet their boast is labour and sorrow, For it hath passed quickly､ and we have flown away.

content: 11 Who knoweth the strength of thine anger? Even according to the fear of thee is thy wrath!
content_old: 11 Who knoweth the strength of thine anger? Even according to the fear of thee is thy wrath!

content: 12 How to number our days so grant us to know, That we may win us a heart that hath wisdom.
content_old: 12 How to number our days so grant us to know, That we may win us a heart that hath wisdom.

content: 13 Return､ Yahweh､ oh how long? And have compassion upon thy servants;
content_old: 13 Return､ Yahweh､ oh how long? And have compassion upon thy servants;

content: 14 Satisfy us､ in the morning､ with thy loving-kindness, That we may shout aloud and be glad､ Throughout all our days.
content_old: 14 Satisfy us､ in the morning､ with thy loving-kindness, That we may shout aloud and be glad､ Throughout all our days.

content: 15 Make us glad､ according to The days thou hast humbled us, The years we have seen misfortune:
content_old: 15 Make us glad､ according to The days thou hast humbled us, The years we have seen misfortune:

content: 16 Let thy work appear unto thy servants, And thy majesty upon their children;
content_old: 16 Let thy work appear unto thy servants, And thy majesty upon their children;

content: 1 He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High Under the shadow of the Almighty will tarry,
content_old: 1 He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High Under the shadow of the Almighty will tarry,

content: 2 Saying of Yahweh— My refuge and my fortress, My God､ in whom I will trust.
content_old: 2 Saying of Yahweh— My refuge and my fortress, My God､ in whom I will trust.

content: 3 For he will rescue thee From the snare of the fowler, From the destructive pestilence.
content_old: 3 For he will rescue thee From the snare of the fowler, From the destructive pestilence.

content: 4 With his pinion will he cover thee､ And under his wings shalt thou seek refuge, A shield and buckler is his faithfulness.
content_old: 4 With his pinion will he cover thee､ And under his wings shalt thou seek refuge, A shield and buckler is his faithfulness.

content: 5 Thou shalt not be afraid Of the dread of the night, Of the arrow that flieth by day;
content_old: 5 Thou shalt not be afraid Of the dread of the night, Of the arrow that flieth by day;

content: 6 Of the pestilence that､ in darkness､ doth walk, Of the plague that layeth waste at noonday.
content_old: 6 Of the pestilence that､ in darkness､ doth walk, Of the plague that layeth waste at noonday.

content: 7 There shall fall､ at thy side､ a thousand, Yea myriads at thy right hand, Unto thee shall it not come nigh;
content_old: 7 There shall fall､ at thy side､ a thousand, Yea myriads at thy right hand, Unto thee shall it not come nigh;

content: 8 Save only with thine own eyes shalt thou discern､ And the recompense of the lawless shalt thou see.
content_old: 8 Save only with thine own eyes shalt thou discern､ And the recompense of the lawless shalt thou see.

content: 9 Because thou hast made Yahweh､ my refuge,— The Most High thou hast made thy dwelling-place
content_old: 9 Because thou hast made Yahweh､ my refuge,— The Most High thou hast made thy dwelling-place

content: 10 There shall not be sent unto thee misfortune, Nor shall plague come near into thy tent;
content_old: 10 There shall not be sent unto thee misfortune, Nor shall plague come near into thy tent;

content: 11 For his messengers will he charge concerning thee, To keep thee､ in all thy ways;
content_old: 11 For his messengers will he charge concerning thee, To keep thee､ in all thy ways;

content: 12 On hands will they bear thee up, Lest thou strike､ against a stone､ thy foot;
content_old: 12 On hands will they bear thee up, Lest thou strike､ against a stone､ thy foot;

content: 13 On the lion and adder shalt thou tread, Shalt trample on young lion and crocodile.
content_old: 13 On the lion and adder shalt thou tread, Shalt trample on young lion and crocodile.

content: 14 Because on me he hath set firm his love Therefore will I deliver him, I will set him on high､ Because he hath known my Name;
content_old: 14 Because on me he hath set firm his love Therefore will I deliver him, I will set him on high､ Because he hath known my Name;

content: 15 He shall call me､ and I will answer him､ With him will I be､ in distress, I will rescue him､ and will honour him;
content_old: 15 He shall call me､ and I will answer him､ With him will I be､ in distress, I will rescue him､ and will honour him;

content: A Melody, a Song､ For the Sabbath-day.
content_old: A Melody, a Song､ For the Sabbath-day.

content: 1 It is good to give thanks to Yahweh, And to sing praises unto thy Name､ O Most High;
content_old: 1 It is good to give thanks to Yahweh, And to sing praises unto thy Name､ O Most High;

content: 2 To declare､ in the morning､ thy lovingkindness, And thy faithfulness at night;
content_old: 2 To declare､ in the morning､ thy lovingkindness, And thy faithfulness at night;

content: 3 Upon an instrument of ten strings､ and upon a harp, With resounding music on the lyre.
content_old: 3 Upon an instrument of ten strings､ and upon a harp, With resounding music on the lyre.

content: 4 For thou hast made me glad､ O Yahweh､ in thy doing, In the works of thy hands will I shout for joy.
content_old: 4 For thou hast made me glad､ O Yahweh､ in thy doing, In the works of thy hands will I shout for joy.

content: 5 How great have grown thy works､ Yahweh, How very deep are laid thy plans!
content_old: 5 How great have grown thy works､ Yahweh, How very deep are laid thy plans!

content: 6 A man that is brutish cannot know, And a dullard cannot discern this:—
content_old: 6 A man that is brutish cannot know, And a dullard cannot discern this:—

content: 7 When the lawless do thrive like grass､ And all the workers of iniquity have blossomed It is that they may be destroyed for ever.
content_old: 7 When the lawless do thrive like grass､ And all the workers of iniquity have blossomed It is that they may be destroyed for ever.

content: 8 But thou shalt be on high age-abidingly､ O Yahweh.
content_old: 8 But thou shalt be on high age-abidingly､ O Yahweh.

content: 9 For lo! thine enemies､ Yahweh､ For lo! thine enemies shall perish, They shall be scattered—all the workers of iniquity;
content_old: 9 For lo! thine enemies､ Yahweh､ For lo! thine enemies shall perish, They shall be scattered—all the workers of iniquity;

content: 10 But thou wilt exalt､ as those of the buffalo, my horn, I have been anointed, with fresh oil.
content_old: 10 But thou wilt exalt､ as those of the buffalo, my horn, I have been anointed, with fresh oil.

content: 11 So hath mine eye descried them who were lying in wait for me,— Of my wicked assailants mine ears shall hear.
content_old: 11 So hath mine eye descried them who were lying in wait for me,— Of my wicked assailants mine ears shall hear.

content: 12 The righteous like the palm-tree shall thrive, Like the cedar in Lebanon shall he grow;
content_old: 12 The righteous like the palm-tree shall thrive, Like the cedar in Lebanon shall he grow;

content: 13 They who are planted in the house of Yahweh ln the courts of our God shall flourish;
content_old: 13 They who are planted in the house of Yahweh ln the courts of our God shall flourish;

content: 14 Still shall they bear fruit in old age, Vigorous and fresh shall they be:
content_old: 14 Still shall they bear fruit in old age, Vigorous and fresh shall they be:

content: 1 Yahweh hath become king､ With majesty is he clothed,— Clothed is Yahweh､ With strength hath he girded himself, Surely he hath fixed the world, It shall not be shaken.
content_old: 1 Yahweh hath become king､ With majesty is he clothed,— Clothed is Yahweh､ With strength hath he girded himself, Surely he hath fixed the world, It shall not be shaken.

content: 2 Established hath been thy throne from of old, From age-past times thou art.
content_old: 2 Established hath been thy throne from of old, From age-past times thou art.

content: 3 The floods have lifted up､ O Yahweh､ The floods have lifted up—their voice, The floods have lifted up—their dashing waves.
content_old: 3 The floods have lifted up､ O Yahweh､ The floods have lifted up—their voice, The floods have lifted up—their dashing waves.

content: 4 With the sounds of many waters Majestic are the breakers of the sea, Majestic on high is Yahweh.
content_old: 4 With the sounds of many waters Majestic are the breakers of the sea, Majestic on high is Yahweh.

content: 1 O GOD of avenging—Yahweh､ GOD of avenging､ shine forth:
content_old: 1 O GOD of avenging—Yahweh､ GOD of avenging､ shine forth:

content: 2 Lift up thyself､ O judge of the earth, Render a recompense unto the proud.
content_old: 2 Lift up thyself､ O judge of the earth, Render a recompense unto the proud.

content: 3 How long shall the lawless､ O Yahweh, How long shall the lawless exult?
content_old: 3 How long shall the lawless､ O Yahweh, How long shall the lawless exult?

content: 4 They pour forth words､ they speak arrogantly, All the workers of iniquity do boast:
content_old: 4 They pour forth words､ they speak arrogantly, All the workers of iniquity do boast:

content: 5 Thy people O Yahweh､ they will crush, And thine inheritance tread down;
content_old: 5 Thy people O Yahweh､ they will crush, And thine inheritance tread down;

content: 6 The widow and sojourner they will slay, And the fatherless murder.
content_old: 6 The widow and sojourner they will slay, And the fatherless murder.

content: 7 Yet have they said— Yah doth not see, The God of Jacob doth not understand.
content_old: 7 Yet have they said— Yah doth not see, The God of Jacob doth not understand.

content: 8 Understand､ ye brutish among the people, And ye dullards when will ye show discretion?
content_old: 8 Understand､ ye brutish among the people, And ye dullards when will ye show discretion?

content: 9 He that planteth the ear shall he not hear? Or that fashioneth the eye shall he not have power to see?
content_old: 9 He that planteth the ear shall he not hear? Or that fashioneth the eye shall he not have power to see?

content: 10 He that correcteth nations shall he not reprove? He that teacheth man knowledge!
content_old: 10 He that correcteth nations shall he not reprove? He that teacheth man knowledge!

content: 11 Yahweh knoweth the plans of men, That they are a breath!
content_old: 11 Yahweh knoweth the plans of men, That they are a breath!

content: 12 How happy the man whom thou correctest､ O Yah! And whom out of thy law thou instructest!
content_old: 12 How happy the man whom thou correctest､ O Yah! And whom out of thy law thou instructest!

content: 13 That thou mayest give him rest from the days of misfortune, Until there be digged—for the lawless one—a pit.
content_old: 13 That thou mayest give him rest from the days of misfortune, Until there be digged—for the lawless one—a pit.

content: 14 For Yahweh will not abandon his people, And his inheritance will he not forsake;
content_old: 14 For Yahweh will not abandon his people, And his inheritance will he not forsake;

content: 15 For unto righteousness shall the judicial sentence return, Then shall follow it—all the upright in heart.
content_old: 15 For unto righteousness shall the judicial sentence return, Then shall follow it—all the upright in heart.

content: 16 Who will rise up for me､ against the evildoers? Who will make a stand for me､ against the workers of iniquity?
content_old: 16 Who will rise up for me､ against the evildoers? Who will make a stand for me､ against the workers of iniquity?

content: 17 If Yahweh had not been a help to me Soon had sunk into silence—my soul!
content_old: 17 If Yahweh had not been a help to me Soon had sunk into silence—my soul!

content: 18 If I say My foot hath slipped Thy lovingkindness O Yahweh､ supporteth me.
content_old: 18 If I say My foot hath slipped Thy lovingkindness O Yahweh､ supporteth me.

content: 19 In the multitude of my cares within me Thy consolations delight my soul.
content_old: 19 In the multitude of my cares within me Thy consolations delight my soul.

content: 20 Shall the throne that inflicteth ruin have fellowship with thee, That frameth oppression by statute?
content_old: 20 Shall the throne that inflicteth ruin have fellowship with thee, That frameth oppression by statute?

content: 21 They make an attack on the life of the righteous one,— And innocent blood they condemn.
content_old: 21 They make an attack on the life of the righteous one,— And innocent blood they condemn.

content: 22 But Yahweh hath become for me a high tower, And my God､ my rock of refuge.
content_old: 22 But Yahweh hath become for me a high tower, And my God､ my rock of refuge.

content: 1 Come､ let us make a joyful noise to Yahweh, Let us shout in triumph､ to the rock of our salvation!
content_old: 1 Come､ let us make a joyful noise to Yahweh, Let us shout in triumph､ to the rock of our salvation!

content: 2 O let us come before his face with thanksgiving, With the sounds of strings let us shout aloud to him.
content_old: 2 O let us come before his face with thanksgiving, With the sounds of strings let us shout aloud to him.

content: 3 For a great GOD is Yahweh, And a great king､ above all gods.
content_old: 3 For a great GOD is Yahweh, And a great king､ above all gods.

content: 4 In whose hand are the hidden recesses of the earth, And the peaks of the mountains are his;
content_old: 4 In whose hand are the hidden recesses of the earth, And the peaks of the mountains are his;

content: 5 Whose is the sea､ for he made it, And the dry land his hands did form.
content_old: 5 Whose is the sea､ for he made it, And the dry land his hands did form.

content: 6 Enter! let us bow down､ and bend low, Let us kneel､ before Yahweh our maker;
content_old: 6 Enter! let us bow down､ and bend low, Let us kneel､ before Yahweh our maker;

content: 7 For he is our God､ And we are the people of his pasture､ and the flock of his hand. To-day if to his voice ye will hearken
content_old: 7 For he is our God､ And we are the people of his pasture､ and the flock of his hand. To-day if to his voice ye will hearken

content: 8 Do not harden your heart as at Meribah, As on the day of Massah, in the desert;
content_old: 8 Do not harden your heart as at Meribah, As on the day of Massah, in the desert;

content: 9 When your fathers tested me, They proved me､ yea they also saw what I could do.
content_old: 9 When your fathers tested me, They proved me､ yea they also saw what I could do.

content: 10 Forty years loathed I that generation､ So I said— A people going astray in heart they are, Even they have not known my ways!
content_old: 10 Forty years loathed I that generation､ So I said— A people going astray in heart they are, Even they have not known my ways!

content: 1 Sing to Yahweh､ a song that is new, Sing to Yahweh､ all the earth;
content_old: 1 Sing to Yahweh､ a song that is new, Sing to Yahweh､ all the earth;

content: 2 Sing to Yahweh､ bless ye his Name,— Tell the tidings､ from day to day､ of his salvation:
content_old: 2 Sing to Yahweh､ bless ye his Name,— Tell the tidings､ from day to day､ of his salvation:

content: 3 Recount Among the nations､ his glory, Among all the peoples､ his wonders.
content_old: 3 Recount Among the nations､ his glory, Among all the peoples､ his wonders.

content: 4 For great is Yahweh､ and worthy to be mightily praised, To be revered is he above all gods;
content_old: 4 For great is Yahweh､ and worthy to be mightily praised, To be revered is he above all gods;

content: 5 For all the gods of the peoples are things of nought,— But Yahweh made the heavens.
content_old: 5 For all the gods of the peoples are things of nought,— But Yahweh made the heavens.

content: 6 Praise and majesty are before him, Strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
content_old: 6 Praise and majesty are before him, Strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

content: 7 Give to Yahweh､ ye families of the peoples, Give to Yahweh, glory and strength;
content_old: 7 Give to Yahweh､ ye families of the peoples, Give to Yahweh, glory and strength;

content: 8 Give to Yahweh､ the glory of his Name, Bring a present､ and enter his courts;
content_old: 8 Give to Yahweh､ the glory of his Name, Bring a present､ and enter his courts;

content: 9 Bow down to Yahweh､ in the adornment of holiness, Be in anguish at his presence､ all the earth!
content_old: 9 Bow down to Yahweh､ in the adornment of holiness, Be in anguish at his presence､ all the earth!

content: 10 Say among the nations､ Yahweh hath become King､ Surely he hath fixed the world､ It shall not be shaken, He will judge the peoples with equity.
content_old: 10 Say among the nations､ Yahweh hath become King､ Surely he hath fixed the world､ It shall not be shaken, He will judge the peoples with equity.

content: 11 Let the heavens rejoice､ and the earth exult, Let the sea roar､ and the fulness thereof;
content_old: 11 Let the heavens rejoice､ and the earth exult, Let the sea roar､ and the fulness thereof;

content: 12 Let the field leap for joy､ and all that is therein, Then shall all the trees of the forest shout in triumph
content_old: 12 Let the field leap for joy､ and all that is therein, Then shall all the trees of the forest shout in triumph

content: 1 Yahweh hath become king､ Let the earth exult, Let the multitude of coastlands rejoice.
content_old: 1 Yahweh hath become king､ Let the earth exult, Let the multitude of coastlands rejoice.

content: 2 Clouds and thick darkness are round about him, Righteousness and justice are the establishing of his throne.
content_old: 2 Clouds and thick darkness are round about him, Righteousness and justice are the establishing of his throne.

content: 3 Fire before him proceedeth, That it may consume､ round about､ his adversaries.
content_old: 3 Fire before him proceedeth, That it may consume､ round about､ his adversaries.

content: 4 His lightnings have illumined the world, The earth hath seen､ and hath trembled;
content_old: 4 His lightnings have illumined the world, The earth hath seen､ and hath trembled;

content: 5 The mountains like wax have melted､ At the presence of Yahweh, At the presence､ of the Lord of all the earth.
content_old: 5 The mountains like wax have melted､ At the presence of Yahweh, At the presence､ of the Lord of all the earth.

content: 6 The heavens have declared his righteousness,— And all the peoples have seen his glory.
content_old: 6 The heavens have declared his righteousness,— And all the peoples have seen his glory.

content: 7 Let all who serve an image be ashamed､ They who boast themselves in things of nought, Bow down unto him, all ye gods.
content_old: 7 Let all who serve an image be ashamed､ They who boast themselves in things of nought, Bow down unto him, all ye gods.

content: 8 Zion hath heard and rejoiced､ And the daughters of Judah have exulted, Because of thy righteous decisions､ O Yahweh:
content_old: 8 Zion hath heard and rejoiced､ And the daughters of Judah have exulted, Because of thy righteous decisions､ O Yahweh:

content: 9 For thou､ Yahweh art Most High over all the earth, Greatly hast thou exalted thyself above all gods.
content_old: 9 For thou､ Yahweh art Most High over all the earth, Greatly hast thou exalted thyself above all gods.

content: 10 Ye lovers of Yahweh! be haters of wrong,— He preserveth the lives of his men of lovingkindness, From the hand of the lawless will he rescue them.
content_old: 10 Ye lovers of Yahweh! be haters of wrong,— He preserveth the lives of his men of lovingkindness, From the hand of the lawless will he rescue them.

content: 11 Light is sown for the righteous one, And for the upright in heart rejoicing:
content_old: 11 Light is sown for the righteous one, And for the upright in heart rejoicing:

content: A Melody.
content_old: A Melody.

content: 1 Sing to Yahweh､ a song that is new､ For wonderful things hath he done, His own right hand and his holy arm have brought him salvation.
content_old: 1 Sing to Yahweh､ a song that is new､ For wonderful things hath he done, His own right hand and his holy arm have brought him salvation.

content: 2 Yahweh hath made known his salvation, Before the eyes of the nations hath he revealed his righteousness:
content_old: 2 Yahweh hath made known his salvation, Before the eyes of the nations hath he revealed his righteousness:

content: 3 He hath remembered his lovingkindness and his faithfulness towards the house of Israel,— All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
content_old: 3 He hath remembered his lovingkindness and his faithfulness towards the house of Israel,— All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

content: 4 Shout aloud to Yahweh､ all the earth, Break forth and make a joyful noise and sweep the strings;
content_old: 4 Shout aloud to Yahweh､ all the earth, Break forth and make a joyful noise and sweep the strings;

content: 5 Sweep the strings to Yahweh With the lyre, With the lyre､ and the voice of melody;
content_old: 5 Sweep the strings to Yahweh With the lyre, With the lyre､ and the voice of melody;

content: 6 With trumpets and the sound of a horn Shout aloud､ before the king—Yahweh.
content_old: 6 With trumpets and the sound of a horn Shout aloud､ before the king—Yahweh.

content: 7 Let the sea roar､ and the fulness thereof, The world､ and they who dwell therein;
content_old: 7 Let the sea roar､ and the fulness thereof, The world､ and they who dwell therein;

content: 8 Let the floods clap their hands, Together let the mountains make a joyful noise
content_old: 8 Let the floods clap their hands, Together let the mountains make a joyful noise

content: 1 Yahweh hath become king､ Let the peoples tremble, He is enthroned on the cherubim､ Let the earth shake､
content_old: 1 Yahweh hath become king､ Let the peoples tremble, He is enthroned on the cherubim､ Let the earth shake､

content: 2 Yahweh in Zion is great, And high is he over all the peoples.
content_old: 2 Yahweh in Zion is great, And high is he over all the peoples.

content: 3 Let them thank his Name—great and reverend, Holy is he!
content_old: 3 Let them thank his Name—great and reverend, Holy is he!

content: 4 Yea with the strength of a king—justice he loveth,— Thou hast established equity, Justice and righteousness in Jacob thou hast wrought.
content_old: 4 Yea with the strength of a king—justice he loveth,— Thou hast established equity, Justice and righteousness in Jacob thou hast wrought.

content: 5 Exalt Yahweh our God､ And bow down at his footstool, Holy is he!
content_old: 5 Exalt Yahweh our God､ And bow down at his footstool, Holy is he!

content: 6 Moses and Aaron were among his priests､ And Samuel was among them who were calling upon his Name, Who were calling upon Yahweh, and he used to answer them:
content_old: 6 Moses and Aaron were among his priests､ And Samuel was among them who were calling upon his Name, Who were calling upon Yahweh, and he used to answer them:

content: 7 In the pillar of cloud used he to speak unto them, They kept his testimonies､ and the statute he gave them.
content_old: 7 In the pillar of cloud used he to speak unto them, They kept his testimonies､ and the statute he gave them.

content: 8 O Yahweh our God! thou answeredst them,— A pardoning GOD thou becamest to them, Yet one bringing vengeance on their deeds.
content_old: 8 O Yahweh our God! thou answeredst them,— A pardoning GOD thou becamest to them, Yet one bringing vengeance on their deeds.

content: A Melody for Thanksgiving.
content_old: A Melody for Thanksgiving.

content: 1 Make a joyful noise to Yahweh, all the earth:
content_old: 1 Make a joyful noise to Yahweh, all the earth:

content: 2 Serve Yahweh with rejoicing, Enter before him, with shouts of triumph.
content_old: 2 Serve Yahweh with rejoicing, Enter before him, with shouts of triumph.

content: 3 Know that Yahweh he is God,— He made us､ and not we ourselves, His people､ and the flock of his pasture.
content_old: 3 Know that Yahweh he is God,— He made us､ and not we ourselves, His people､ and the flock of his pasture.

content: 4 Enter ye his gates､ with thanksgiving､ his courts､ with praise, Give ye thanks to him､ bless ye his Name;
content_old: 4 Enter ye his gates､ with thanksgiving､ his courts､ with praise, Give ye thanks to him､ bless ye his Name;

content: David’s. A Melody.
content_old: David’s. A Melody.

content: 1 Of lovingkindness and of justice will I sing! Unto thee､ O Yahweh will I touch the strings!
content_old: 1 Of lovingkindness and of justice will I sing! Unto thee､ O Yahweh will I touch the strings!

content: 2 I will behave myself wisely in a blameless way､ When wilt thou come in unto me? I will walk to and fro in the blamelessness of my heart,—in the midst of my house:
content_old: 2 I will behave myself wisely in a blameless way､ When wilt thou come in unto me? I will walk to and fro in the blamelessness of my heart,—in the midst of my house:

content: 3 I will not set before mine eyes､ a vile thing,— The doing of them who fall away I hate, It shall not cleave unto me;
content_old: 3 I will not set before mine eyes､ a vile thing,— The doing of them who fall away I hate, It shall not cleave unto me;

content: 4 A perverse heart shall depart from me, A maker of mischief will I not acknowledge;
content_old: 4 A perverse heart shall depart from me, A maker of mischief will I not acknowledge;

content: 5 He that uttereth slander in secret against his friend Him will I root out; One of lofty eyes､ and of an ambitious heart Him shall I not be able to endure.
content_old: 5 He that uttereth slander in secret against his friend Him will I root out; One of lofty eyes､ and of an ambitious heart Him shall I not be able to endure.

content: 6 Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land､ That they may dwell with me,— He that walketh in a blameless way He shall attend me.
content_old: 6 Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land､ That they may dwell with me,— He that walketh in a blameless way He shall attend me.

content: 7 There shall not dwell in the midst of my house､ One who worketh deceit,— He that speaketh falsehoods shall not be established before mine eyes;
content_old: 7 There shall not dwell in the midst of my house､ One who worketh deceit,— He that speaketh falsehoods shall not be established before mine eyes;

content: A Prayer for the Humbled One when he is about to faint, and before Yahweh poureth out his grief.
content_old: A Prayer for the Humbled One when he is about to faint, and before Yahweh poureth out his grief.

content: 1 O Yahweh, hear thou my prayer, And let my cry for help unto thee enter in.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh, hear thou my prayer, And let my cry for help unto thee enter in.

content: 2 Do not hide thy face from me､ In the day when I am in distress,— Bend down unto me thine ear, In the day when I call speedily answer me.
content_old: 2 Do not hide thy face from me､ In the day when I am in distress,— Bend down unto me thine ear, In the day when I call speedily answer me.

content: 3 For consumed in smoke are my days, And my bones like a burning mass are scorched through;
content_old: 3 For consumed in smoke are my days, And my bones like a burning mass are scorched through;

content: 4 Smitten like herbage so is my heart dried up, For I have forgotten to eat my food.
content_old: 4 Smitten like herbage so is my heart dried up, For I have forgotten to eat my food.

content: 5 At the noise of my groaning my bone hath cleaved to my flesh:
content_old: 5 At the noise of my groaning my bone hath cleaved to my flesh:

content: 6 I am like the pelican of the desert, I have become as an owl among ruins.
content_old: 6 I am like the pelican of the desert, I have become as an owl among ruins.

content: 7 I have watched and am become Like a bird sitting alone upon a housetop.
content_old: 7 I have watched and am become Like a bird sitting alone upon a housetop.

content: 8 All the day have mine enemies reproached me, And they who are mad against me by me have sworn.
content_old: 8 All the day have mine enemies reproached me, And they who are mad against me by me have sworn.

content: 9 For ashes—like bread have I eaten, And my drink—with my tears have I mingled;
content_old: 9 For ashes—like bread have I eaten, And my drink—with my tears have I mingled;

content: 10 Because of thine indignation and thy wrath, For thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.
content_old: 10 Because of thine indignation and thy wrath, For thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.

content: 11 My days are like a shadow extended, And I as green herbage do wither.
content_old: 11 My days are like a shadow extended, And I as green herbage do wither.

content: 12 But thou､ O Yahweh age-abidingly wilt remain, And the memorial of thee､ to generation after generation.
content_old: 12 But thou､ O Yahweh age-abidingly wilt remain, And the memorial of thee､ to generation after generation.

content: 13 Thou wilt arise､ wilt have compassion upon Zion, Surely it is time to favour her, Surely the time appointed hath come;
content_old: 13 Thou wilt arise､ wilt have compassion upon Zion, Surely it is time to favour her, Surely the time appointed hath come;

content: 14 Seeing that thy servants take pleasure in her stones, And her dust they favour:
content_old: 14 Seeing that thy servants take pleasure in her stones, And her dust they favour:

content: 15 That the nations may revere thy Name､ O Yahweh. And all the kings of the earth､ thy glory.
content_old: 15 That the nations may revere thy Name､ O Yahweh. And all the kings of the earth､ thy glory.

content: 16 When Yahweh hath built up Zion, Hath appeared in his glory;
content_old: 16 When Yahweh hath built up Zion, Hath appeared in his glory;

content: 17 Hath turned towards the prayer of the destitute, And not despised their prayer
content_old: 17 Hath turned towards the prayer of the destitute, And not despised their prayer

content: 18 This shall be written for a later generation, And a people to be created will give praise unto Yah:—
content_old: 18 This shall be written for a later generation, And a people to be created will give praise unto Yah:—

content: 19 That he looked down､ out of his holy height, Yahweh from the heavens unto the earth directed his gaze;—
content_old: 19 That he looked down､ out of his holy height, Yahweh from the heavens unto the earth directed his gaze;—

content: 20 To hear the groaning of the prisoner, To set free､ them who were appointed to death.
content_old: 20 To hear the groaning of the prisoner, To set free､ them who were appointed to death.

content: 21 To the end the Name of Yahweh might be celebrated in Zion And his praise in Jerusalem:
content_old: 21 To the end the Name of Yahweh might be celebrated in Zion And his praise in Jerusalem:

content: 22 When the peoples gather themselves together, And the kingdoms､ to serve Yahweh.
content_old: 22 When the peoples gather themselves together, And the kingdoms､ to serve Yahweh.

content: 23 He hath prostrated､ in the way､ my strength,— He hath shortened my days.
content_old: 23 He hath prostrated､ in the way､ my strength,— He hath shortened my days.

content: 24 I said､ O my GOD､ do not remove me in the midst of my days, Throughout the generation of generations are thy years;
content_old: 24 I said､ O my GOD､ do not remove me in the midst of my days, Throughout the generation of generations are thy years;

content: 25 Of old—the earth thou didst found, And the work of thy hands are the heavens;
content_old: 25 Of old—the earth thou didst found, And the work of thy hands are the heavens;

content: 26 They shall perish､ But thou wilt abide; And they all like a garment shall fall in pieces, As a vesture wilt thou change them and they shall vanish;
content_old: 26 They shall perish､ But thou wilt abide; And they all like a garment shall fall in pieces, As a vesture wilt thou change them and they shall vanish;

content: 27 But thou art the same,— And thy years shall have no end:
content_old: 27 But thou art the same,— And thy years shall have no end:

content: 1 Bless､ O my soul､ Yahweh,— And all that is within me､ his holy Name;
content_old: 1 Bless､ O my soul､ Yahweh,— And all that is within me､ his holy Name;

content: 2 Bless､ O my soul､ Yahweh, And forget not all his dealings:—
content_old: 2 Bless､ O my soul､ Yahweh, And forget not all his dealings:—

content: 3 Who forgiveth all thine iniquity, Who healeth all thy diseases;
content_old: 3 Who forgiveth all thine iniquity, Who healeth all thy diseases;

content: 4 Who redeemeth､ from destruction､ thy life, Who crowneth thee､ with lovingkindness and compassion:
content_old: 4 Who redeemeth､ from destruction､ thy life, Who crowneth thee､ with lovingkindness and compassion:

content: 5 Who satisfieth､ with good､ thine age, Thy youth reneweth itself like an eagle.
content_old: 5 Who satisfieth､ with good､ thine age, Thy youth reneweth itself like an eagle.

content: 6 Yahweh is one who executeth righteousness, Yea vindication for all the oppressed.
content_old: 6 Yahweh is one who executeth righteousness, Yea vindication for all the oppressed.

content: 7 Who made known his ways unto Moses, Unto the sons of Israel his doings.
content_old: 7 Who made known his ways unto Moses, Unto the sons of Israel his doings.

content: 8 Compassionate and gracious is Yahweh,—Slow to anger and abundant in lovingkindness.
content_old: 8 Compassionate and gracious is Yahweh,—Slow to anger and abundant in lovingkindness.

content: 9 Not perpetually will he contend, Nor age-abidingly retain anger;
content_old: 9 Not perpetually will he contend, Nor age-abidingly retain anger;

content: 10 Not according to our sins hath he dealt with us, Nor according to our iniquities hath he treated us.
content_old: 10 Not according to our sins hath he dealt with us, Nor according to our iniquities hath he treated us.

content: 11 For as the heavens are exalted over the earth His lovingkindness hath prevailed over them who revere him;
content_old: 11 For as the heavens are exalted over the earth His lovingkindness hath prevailed over them who revere him;

content: 12 As far as East from West Hath he put far from us､ our transgressions;
content_old: 12 As far as East from West Hath he put far from us､ our transgressions;

content: 13 Like the compassion of a father for his children Is the compassion of Yahweh for them who revere him;
content_old: 13 Like the compassion of a father for his children Is the compassion of Yahweh for them who revere him;

content: 14 For he knoweth how we are formed, He is mindful that dust we are.
content_old: 14 For he knoweth how we are formed, He is mindful that dust we are.

content: 15 As for man like grass are his days, Like the blossom of the field so doth he blossom;
content_old: 15 As for man like grass are his days, Like the blossom of the field so doth he blossom;

content: 16 For a wind hath passed over it､ and it is gone, And its own place is acquainted with it no more.
content_old: 16 For a wind hath passed over it､ and it is gone, And its own place is acquainted with it no more.

content: 17 But the lovingkindness of Yahweh is from one age even to another Upon them who revere him, And his righteousness､ to children’s children:—
content_old: 17 But the lovingkindness of Yahweh is from one age even to another Upon them who revere him, And his righteousness､ to children’s children:—

content: 18 To such as keep his covenant, And remember his precepts､ to do them.
content_old: 18 To such as keep his covenant, And remember his precepts､ to do them.

content: 19 Yahweh in the heavens hath established his throne, And his kingdom over all hath dominion.
content_old: 19 Yahweh in the heavens hath established his throne, And his kingdom over all hath dominion.

content: 20 Bless Yahweh､ ye messengers of his,— Heroes of vigour､ doing his word, To hearken again to the voice of his word;
content_old: 20 Bless Yahweh､ ye messengers of his,— Heroes of vigour､ doing his word, To hearken again to the voice of his word;

content: 21 Bless Yahweh､ all ye his hosts, Attendants of his､ doing his pleasure;
content_old: 21 Bless Yahweh､ all ye his hosts, Attendants of his､ doing his pleasure;

content: 1 Bless､ O my soul､ Yahweh,— Yahweh､ my God､ thou art exceedingly great, With honour and majesty hast thou clothed thyself,
content_old: 1 Bless､ O my soul､ Yahweh,— Yahweh､ my God､ thou art exceedingly great, With honour and majesty hast thou clothed thyself,

content: 2 Putting on light､ as a robe, Stretching out the heavens､ as a curtain;
content_old: 2 Putting on light､ as a robe, Stretching out the heavens､ as a curtain;

content: 3 Building､ in the waters､ his upper chambers,— Who maketh clouds his chariot, Who passeth along on the wings of the wind;
content_old: 3 Building､ in the waters､ his upper chambers,— Who maketh clouds his chariot, Who passeth along on the wings of the wind;

content: 4 Making His messengers､ winds, His attendants､ a flaming fire;
content_old: 4 Making His messengers､ winds, His attendants､ a flaming fire;

content: 5 He hath fixed the earth on its foundations, It is not to be shaken､ to times age-abiding and beyond.
content_old: 5 He hath fixed the earth on its foundations, It is not to be shaken､ to times age-abiding and beyond.

content: 6 With the resounding deep—as a garment hast thou covered it, Above the mountains stand the waters;
content_old: 6 With the resounding deep—as a garment hast thou covered it, Above the mountains stand the waters;

content: 7 At thy rebuke they flee, At the voice of thy thunder they hurry away;
content_old: 7 At thy rebuke they flee, At the voice of thy thunder they hurry away;

content: 8 Mountains rise､ Valleys sink Unto the place which thou hast fixed for them;
content_old: 8 Mountains rise､ Valleys sink Unto the place which thou hast fixed for them;

content: 9 Bounds hast thou set､ which they are not to pass over, They are not to return to cover the earth.
content_old: 9 Bounds hast thou set､ which they are not to pass over, They are not to return to cover the earth.

content: 10 Who hast sent forth springs､ through the torrent-beds､ Between the mountains they flow along;
content_old: 10 Who hast sent forth springs､ through the torrent-beds､ Between the mountains they flow along;

content: 11 They give drink､ to every wild beast of the field, The wild assee do break their thirst.
content_old: 11 They give drink､ to every wild beast of the field, The wild assee do break their thirst.

content: 12 Over them the bird of the heavens settleth down, From amidst the foliage they utter a voice.
content_old: 12 Over them the bird of the heavens settleth down, From amidst the foliage they utter a voice.

content: 13 Who watereth the mountains out of his upper chambers, Out of the fruit of thy works thou satisfiest the earth.
content_old: 13 Who watereth the mountains out of his upper chambers, Out of the fruit of thy works thou satisfiest the earth.

content: 14 Who causeth the grass to shoot forth for the cattle､ And the herb､ for the service of man, That he may bring forth food out of the earth;
content_old: 14 Who causeth the grass to shoot forth for the cattle､ And the herb､ for the service of man, That he may bring forth food out of the earth;

content: 15 And wine may rejoice the heart of man､ Making radiant his well-nourished face,— And food may the heart of man sustain.
content_old: 15 And wine may rejoice the heart of man､ Making radiant his well-nourished face,— And food may the heart of man sustain.

content: 16 Satisfied are The trees of Yahweh, The cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;
content_old: 16 Satisfied are The trees of Yahweh, The cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;

content: 17 Where the birds build their nests, The stork in the fir-trees hath her house;
content_old: 17 Where the birds build their nests, The stork in the fir-trees hath her house;

content: 18 The high mountains are for the chamois, The crags are a refuge for the conies.
content_old: 18 The high mountains are for the chamois, The crags are a refuge for the conies.

content: 19 He hath made the moon for seasons, And the sun knoweth his place for entering in.
content_old: 19 He hath made the moon for seasons, And the sun knoweth his place for entering in.

content: 20 Thou causest darkness､ and it becometh night, Therein creepeth forth Every wild beast of the forest;
content_old: 20 Thou causest darkness､ and it becometh night, Therein creepeth forth Every wild beast of the forest;

content: 21 The young lions roaring for prey, And seeking､ from GOD､ their food.
content_old: 21 The young lions roaring for prey, And seeking､ from GOD､ their food.

content: 22 The sun ariseth､ they withdraw themselves, And in their lairs lay them down.
content_old: 22 The sun ariseth､ they withdraw themselves, And in their lairs lay them down.

content: 23 Man goeth forth to his work And to his labour､ until evening.
content_old: 23 Man goeth forth to his work And to his labour､ until evening.

content: 24 How thy works abound､ O Yahweh! All of them—in wisdom hast thou made, The earth is full of thy possession:—
content_old: 24 How thy works abound､ O Yahweh! All of them—in wisdom hast thou made, The earth is full of thy possession:—

content: 25 This sea here is great and broad on both hands,— Wherein are creeping things､ even without number, Living things､ small with great;
content_old: 25 This sea here is great and broad on both hands,— Wherein are creeping things､ even without number, Living things､ small with great;

content: 26 There ships sail along, This sea-monster､ thou hast formed to sport therein;
content_old: 26 There ships sail along, This sea-monster､ thou hast formed to sport therein;

content: 27 All of them for thee do wait, That thou mayest give them their food in its season;
content_old: 27 All of them for thee do wait, That thou mayest give them their food in its season;

content: 28 Thou givest unto them､ they gather, Thou openest thy hand､ they are satisfied with good.
content_old: 28 Thou givest unto them､ they gather, Thou openest thy hand､ they are satisfied with good.

content: 29 Thou hidest thy face､ they are dismayed, Thou withdrawest their spirit､ They cease to breathe, And unto their own dust do they return:
content_old: 29 Thou hidest thy face､ they are dismayed, Thou withdrawest their spirit､ They cease to breathe, And unto their own dust do they return:

content: 30 Thou sendest forth thy spirit､ they are created, And thou renewest the face of the ground.
content_old: 30 Thou sendest forth thy spirit､ they are created, And thou renewest the face of the ground.

content: 31 Be thy glory､ O Yahweh､ to times age-abiding, Let Yahweh rejoice in his own works:
content_old: 31 Be thy glory､ O Yahweh､ to times age-abiding, Let Yahweh rejoice in his own works:

content: 32 Who looketh at the earth､ and it trembleth, He toucheth the mountains､ and they smoke.
content_old: 32 Who looketh at the earth､ and it trembleth, He toucheth the mountains､ and they smoke.

content: 33 I will sing to Yahweh､ as long as I live! Yea I will touch the strings to my God､ while I continue;
content_old: 33 I will sing to Yahweh､ as long as I live! Yea I will touch the strings to my God､ while I continue;

content: 34 Pleasing unto him be my meditation, I will rejoice in Yahweh.
content_old: 34 Pleasing unto him be my meditation, I will rejoice in Yahweh.

content: 1 Give ye thanks to Yahweh､ Call upon his Name, Make known､ among the peoples､ his doings;
content_old: 1 Give ye thanks to Yahweh､ Call upon his Name, Make known､ among the peoples､ his doings;

content: 2 Sing ye to him､ Make ye music to him, Speak ye of all his wonders.
content_old: 2 Sing ye to him､ Make ye music to him, Speak ye of all his wonders.

content: 3 Make your boast in his holy Name, Joyful be the heart of them who are seeking Yahweh.
content_old: 3 Make your boast in his holy Name, Joyful be the heart of them who are seeking Yahweh.

content: 4 Search out Yahweh and his strength, Seek diligently his face at all times.
content_old: 4 Search out Yahweh and his strength, Seek diligently his face at all times.

content: 5 Remember his wonders which he hath done, His portents､ and the just decisions of his mouth.
content_old: 5 Remember his wonders which he hath done, His portents､ and the just decisions of his mouth.

content: 6 O ye Seed of Abraham—his servants, Sons of Jacob—his chosen ones:
content_old: 6 O ye Seed of Abraham—his servants, Sons of Jacob—his chosen ones:

content: 7 Yahweh himself is our God, Through all the land are his just decisions.
content_old: 7 Yahweh himself is our God, Through all the land are his just decisions.

content: 8 He hath remembered､ unto times age-abiding､ his covenant, The word he commanded､ to a thousand generations;
content_old: 8 He hath remembered､ unto times age-abiding､ his covenant, The word he commanded､ to a thousand generations;

content: 9 Which he solemnised with Abraham, And his oath､ to Isaac;
content_old: 9 Which he solemnised with Abraham, And his oath､ to Isaac;

content: 10 And confirmed it unto Jacob for a statute, To Israel､ as a covenant age-abiding;
content_old: 10 And confirmed it unto Jacob for a statute, To Israel､ as a covenant age-abiding;

content: 11 Saying､ To thee will I give the land of Canaan, As your inherited portion;
content_old: 11 Saying､ To thee will I give the land of Canaan, As your inherited portion;

content: 12 While as yet they were men easily counted,— A very few､ and sojourners therein;
content_old: 12 While as yet they were men easily counted,— A very few､ and sojourners therein;

content: 13 And they wandered from nation to nation, From a kingdom､ to another people､
content_old: 13 And they wandered from nation to nation, From a kingdom､ to another people､

content: 14 He suffered no son of earth to oppress them, And reproved—for their sakes—even kings!
content_old: 14 He suffered no son of earth to oppress them, And reproved—for their sakes—even kings!

content: 15 Ye may not touch mine Anointed ones, And to my Prophets may ye do no wrong.
content_old: 15 Ye may not touch mine Anointed ones, And to my Prophets may ye do no wrong.

content: 16 Then called he a famine over the land, All the staff of bread he brake;
content_old: 16 Then called he a famine over the land, All the staff of bread he brake;

content: 17 He sent before them a man, For a slave was he sold—even Joseph;
content_old: 17 He sent before them a man, For a slave was he sold—even Joseph;

content: 18 They forced､ into a fetter､ his foot, Into the iron entered his soul;
content_old: 18 They forced､ into a fetter､ his foot, Into the iron entered his soul;

content: 19 Until the time when his word came to pass, Speech of Yahweh proved him;
content_old: 19 Until the time when his word came to pass, Speech of Yahweh proved him;

content: 20 The king sent､ and set him free, One having dominion over peoples yet loosed he his bonds;
content_old: 20 The king sent､ and set him free, One having dominion over peoples yet loosed he his bonds;

content: 21 He appointed him lord to his household, And one having dominion over all he possessed;
content_old: 21 He appointed him lord to his household, And one having dominion over all he possessed;

content: 22 That he might bind his rulers as he pleased, And his elders he might embue with wisdom.
content_old: 22 That he might bind his rulers as he pleased, And his elders he might embue with wisdom.

content: 23 So Israel came into Egypt, And Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham;
content_old: 23 So Israel came into Egypt, And Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham;

content: 24 And he made his people exceeding fruitful,— And caused them to become stronger than their adversaries.
content_old: 24 And he made his people exceeding fruitful,— And caused them to become stronger than their adversaries.

content: 25 He let them turn their heart— To hate his people, To deal treacherously with his servants;
content_old: 25 He let them turn their heart— To hate his people, To deal treacherously with his servants;

content: 26 He sent Moses his servant, Aaron､ whom he had chosen.
content_old: 26 He sent Moses his servant, Aaron､ whom he had chosen.

content: 27 He set among them his threatening signs, And his wonders､ in the land of Ham;
content_old: 27 He set among them his threatening signs, And his wonders､ in the land of Ham;

content: 28 He sent darkness､ and made it dark, But they rebelled against his words;
content_old: 28 He sent darkness､ and made it dark, But they rebelled against his words;

content: 29 He turned their waters into blood, And so caused their fish to die;
content_old: 29 He turned their waters into blood, And so caused their fish to die;

content: 30 Their land swarmed with frogs, In the chambers of their kings!
content_old: 30 Their land swarmed with frogs, In the chambers of their kings!

content: 31 He spake､ and there came in the gad-fly, Gnats､ in all their bounds;
content_old: 31 He spake､ and there came in the gad-fly, Gnats､ in all their bounds;

content: 32 He made their showers—hail, A fire flaming throughout their land;
content_old: 32 He made their showers—hail, A fire flaming throughout their land;

content: 33 And he smote their vines､ and their fig-trees, And brake in pieces the trees of their bounds;
content_old: 33 And he smote their vines､ and their fig-trees, And brake in pieces the trees of their bounds;

content: 34 He spake—then came the swarming locust,— The devouring locust, and that without number;
content_old: 34 He spake—then came the swarming locust,— The devouring locust, and that without number;

content: 35 And devoured all the herbage in their land, And devoured the fruit of their ground.
content_old: 35 And devoured all the herbage in their land, And devoured the fruit of their ground.

content: 36 Then smote he every firstborn in their land, The beginning of all their strength;
content_old: 36 Then smote he every firstborn in their land, The beginning of all their strength;

content: 37 Thus brought he them forth､ with silver and gold, Nor was there､ throughout his tribes､ one that faltered;
content_old: 37 Thus brought he them forth､ with silver and gold, Nor was there､ throughout his tribes､ one that faltered;

content: 38 Egypt rejoiced when they went out, For the dread of them had fallen upon them.
content_old: 38 Egypt rejoiced when they went out, For the dread of them had fallen upon them.

content: 39 He spread out a cloud as a covering, And fire､ to give light by night,
content_old: 39 He spread out a cloud as a covering, And fire､ to give light by night,

content: 40 They asked､ and he brought in the quail,— And with the bread of the heavens he satisfied them;
content_old: 40 They asked､ and he brought in the quail,— And with the bread of the heavens he satisfied them;

content: 41 He opened the rock､ and there gushed forth waters, They flowed along､ through parched places, as a river;
content_old: 41 He opened the rock､ and there gushed forth waters, They flowed along､ through parched places, as a river;

content: 42 For he remembered his holy word, With Abraham his servant.
content_old: 42 For he remembered his holy word, With Abraham his servant.

content: 43 Thus brought he forth his people with gladness,— With shouts of triumph his chosen ones;
content_old: 43 Thus brought he forth his people with gladness,— With shouts of triumph his chosen ones;

content: 44 And gave them､ the lands of the nations, And of the toil of the peoples took they possession:
content_old: 44 And gave them､ the lands of the nations, And of the toil of the peoples took they possession:

content: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Give ye thanks to Yahweh— For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness.
content_old: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Give ye thanks to Yahweh— For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness.

content: 2 Who can relate the mighty deeds of Yahweh? Can cause to be heard､ all his praise?
content_old: 2 Who can relate the mighty deeds of Yahweh? Can cause to be heard､ all his praise?

content: 3 How happy! They who observe justice, He that executeth righteousness at all times.
content_old: 3 How happy! They who observe justice, He that executeth righteousness at all times.

content: 4 Remember me､ O Yahweh､ when thou acceptest thy people, Visit me､ with thy salvation;
content_old: 4 Remember me､ O Yahweh､ when thou acceptest thy people, Visit me､ with thy salvation;

content: 5 That I may look upon the welfare of thy chosen ones､ That I may rejoice in the joy of thy nation, That I may glory､ with thine inheritance.
content_old: 5 That I may look upon the welfare of thy chosen ones､ That I may rejoice in the joy of thy nation, That I may glory､ with thine inheritance.

content: 6 We have sinned—with our fathers､ We have acted perversely､ we have committed lawlessness;
content_old: 6 We have sinned—with our fathers､ We have acted perversely､ we have committed lawlessness;

content: 7 Our fathers､ in Egypt understood not thy wonders､ They remembered not the abounding of thy lovingkindnesses, But rebelled by the sea—at the Red Sea.
content_old: 7 Our fathers､ in Egypt understood not thy wonders､ They remembered not the abounding of thy lovingkindnesses, But rebelled by the sea—at the Red Sea.

content: 8 Yet he saved them､ for the sake of his Name, To make known his mighty power;
content_old: 8 Yet he saved them､ for the sake of his Name, To make known his mighty power;

content: 9 So he rebuked the Red Sea､ and it dried up, And he led them through deeps､ as pasture-land;
content_old: 9 So he rebuked the Red Sea､ and it dried up, And he led them through deeps､ as pasture-land;

content: 10 And saved them from the hand of one full of hatred, And redeemed them out of the hand of the foe;
content_old: 10 And saved them from the hand of one full of hatred, And redeemed them out of the hand of the foe;

content: 11 So the waters covered their adversaries, Not one from among them was left.
content_old: 11 So the waters covered their adversaries, Not one from among them was left.

content: 12 They believed therefore in his words, They sang his praise.
content_old: 12 They believed therefore in his words, They sang his praise.

content: 13 Soon forgat they his works,— They waited not for his counsel;
content_old: 13 Soon forgat they his works,— They waited not for his counsel;

content: 14 But lusted a lust in the desert, And tested GOD in the waste.
content_old: 14 But lusted a lust in the desert, And tested GOD in the waste.

content: 15 So he gave them their request, But sent leanness into their soul.
content_old: 15 So he gave them their request, But sent leanness into their soul.

content: 16 And they became jealous Of Moses､ in the camp,— Of Aaron､ the holy one of Yahweh;
content_old: 16 And they became jealous Of Moses､ in the camp,— Of Aaron､ the holy one of Yahweh;

content: 17 The earth opened and engulfed Dathan, And covered up the assembly of Abiram;
content_old: 17 The earth opened and engulfed Dathan, And covered up the assembly of Abiram;

content: 18 Then was kindled a fire in their assembly,— A flame consumed the lawless ones.
content_old: 18 Then was kindled a fire in their assembly,— A flame consumed the lawless ones.

content: 19 They made a calf in Horeb,— And bowed down to a molten image;
content_old: 19 They made a calf in Horeb,— And bowed down to a molten image;

content: 20 Thus changed they my glory. For the similitude of an OX that eateth grass.
content_old: 20 Thus changed they my glory. For the similitude of an OX that eateth grass.

content: 21 They forgat GOD their saviour, Who had done great things in Egypt:
content_old: 21 They forgat GOD their saviour, Who had done great things in Egypt:

content: 22 Wonders in the land of Ham, Terrible things by the Red Sea.
content_old: 22 Wonders in the land of Ham, Terrible things by the Red Sea.

content: 23 Then would he have bidden to destroy them,— Had not Moses his chosen､ stood in the breach before him, To turn back his wrath from destroying.
content_old: 23 Then would he have bidden to destroy them,— Had not Moses his chosen､ stood in the breach before him, To turn back his wrath from destroying.

content: 24 And they refused the delightful land, They believed not his word;
content_old: 24 And they refused the delightful land, They believed not his word;

content: 25 But murmured in their tents,— They hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh.
content_old: 25 But murmured in their tents,— They hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh.

content: 26 So he lifted up his hand unto them, That he would let them fall in the desert;
content_old: 26 So he lifted up his hand unto them, That he would let them fall in the desert;

content: 27 And would disperse their seed among the nations, And would scatter them throughout the lands.
content_old: 27 And would disperse their seed among the nations, And would scatter them throughout the lands.

content: 28 Yet they let themselves be bound to Baal-peor,— And did eat sacrifices to the dead:
content_old: 28 Yet they let themselves be bound to Baal-peor,— And did eat sacrifices to the dead:

content: 29 So they provoked to anger by their doings, And a plague made a breach among them.
content_old: 29 So they provoked to anger by their doings, And a plague made a breach among them.

content: 30 Then stood up Phinehas､ and interposed, And stayed was the plague:
content_old: 30 Then stood up Phinehas､ and interposed, And stayed was the plague:

content: 31 So it was counted unto him､ for righteousness, To generation after generation､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 31 So it was counted unto him､ for righteousness, To generation after generation､ unto times age-abiding.

content: 32 And they provoked by the waters of Meribah,— And it fared ill with Moses､ for their sakes;
content_old: 32 And they provoked by the waters of Meribah,— And it fared ill with Moses､ for their sakes;

content: 33 For they embittered his spirit, And he spake rashly with his lips.
content_old: 33 For they embittered his spirit, And he spake rashly with his lips.

content: 34 They destroyed not the peoples of which Yahweh had spoken to them;
content_old: 34 They destroyed not the peoples of which Yahweh had spoken to them;

content: 35 But had fellowship with the nations, And learned their doings;
content_old: 35 But had fellowship with the nations, And learned their doings;

content: 36 Yea they served their idols, And they became to them a snare:
content_old: 36 Yea they served their idols, And they became to them a snare:

content: 37 Yea they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to mischievous demons;
content_old: 37 Yea they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to mischievous demons;

content: 38 And poured out innocent blood､ The blood of their sons and their daughters､ Whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, And the land was polluted with blood-shed;
content_old: 38 And poured out innocent blood､ The blood of their sons and their daughters､ Whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, And the land was polluted with blood-shed;

content: 39 And they became unclean by their works, And became unchaste in their doings.
content_old: 39 And they became unclean by their works, And became unchaste in their doings.

content: 40 Then was kindled the anger of Yahweh with his people, And he abhorred his own inheritance.
content_old: 40 Then was kindled the anger of Yahweh with his people, And he abhorred his own inheritance.

content: 41 So he delivered them up into the hand of the nations, And they who hated them had dominion over them;
content_old: 41 So he delivered them up into the hand of the nations, And they who hated them had dominion over them;

content: 42 And their enemies oppressed them, And they were bowed down under their hand.
content_old: 42 And their enemies oppressed them, And they were bowed down under their hand.

content: 43 Many times did he rescue them,— But they rebelled by their counsel, And sank low in their iniquity.
content_old: 43 Many times did he rescue them,— But they rebelled by their counsel, And sank low in their iniquity.

content: 44 Then looked he on the distress which befell them,— When he heard their loud cry;
content_old: 44 Then looked he on the distress which befell them,— When he heard their loud cry;

content: 45 Then remembered he､ for them､ his covenant, And was moved to pity､ according to the abounding of his lovingkindnesses;
content_old: 45 Then remembered he､ for them､ his covenant, And was moved to pity､ according to the abounding of his lovingkindnesses;

content: 46 And granted them compassion before all their captors.
content_old: 46 And granted them compassion before all their captors.

content: 47 Save us､ O Yahweh our God､ And gather us from among the nations,— That we may give thanks unto thy holy Name, That we may triumph aloud in thy praise.
content_old: 47 Save us､ O Yahweh our God､ And gather us from among the nations,— That we may give thanks unto thy holy Name, That we may triumph aloud in thy praise.

content: 1 O give thanks to Yahweh— For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness.
content_old: 1 O give thanks to Yahweh— For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness.

content: 2 Let the redeemed of Yahweh say, Whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the adversary;
content_old: 2 Let the redeemed of Yahweh say, Whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the adversary;

content: 3 And out of the lands hath gathered them,— From the east and from the west, From the north and from the south.
content_old: 3 And out of the lands hath gathered them,— From the east and from the west, From the north and from the south.

content: 4 They wandered about in the desert—in a waste, Way to a city to dwell in found they none;
content_old: 4 They wandered about in the desert—in a waste, Way to a city to dwell in found they none;

content: 5 Hungry—yea thirsty Their soul､ within them､ fainted:
content_old: 5 Hungry—yea thirsty Their soul､ within them､ fainted:

content: 6 Then made they outcry to Yahweh､ in their peril, Out of their distresses he rescued them;
content_old: 6 Then made they outcry to Yahweh､ in their peril, Out of their distresses he rescued them;

content: 7 And led them by a straight road, That they might journey to a city to dwell in.
content_old: 7 And led them by a straight road, That they might journey to a city to dwell in.

content: 8 Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his lovingkindness, and for his wonderful dealings with the sons of men;
content_old: 8 Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his lovingkindness, and for his wonderful dealings with the sons of men;

content: 9 For he hath satisfied the longing soul, And the famished soul hath he filled with good.
content_old: 9 For he hath satisfied the longing soul, And the famished soul hath he filled with good.

content: 10 The dwellers in darkness and death-shade, Bound with oppression and iron;
content_old: 10 The dwellers in darkness and death-shade, Bound with oppression and iron;

content: 11 Because they had rebelled against the sayings of GOD,— And the counsel of the Most High they had spurned;
content_old: 11 Because they had rebelled against the sayings of GOD,— And the counsel of the Most High they had spurned;

content: 12 And he bowed down､ with labour､ their heart, They staggered､ with no one to help
content_old: 12 And he bowed down､ with labour､ their heart, They staggered､ with no one to help

content: 13 Then made they outcry to Yahweh in their peril, Out of their distresses he saved them;
content_old: 13 Then made they outcry to Yahweh in their peril, Out of their distresses he saved them;

content: 14 He brought them forth out of darkness and death-shade, And their fetters he tare off.
content_old: 14 He brought them forth out of darkness and death-shade, And their fetters he tare off.

content: 15 Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his lovingkindness, and for his wonderful dealings with the sons of men!
content_old: 15 Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his lovingkindness, and for his wonderful dealings with the sons of men!

content: 16 For he brake in pieces the doors of bronze, And the bars of iron he hewed asunder.
content_old: 16 For he brake in pieces the doors of bronze, And the bars of iron he hewed asunder.

content: 17 The perverse by reason of their transgression, And on account of their iniquities are afflicted;
content_old: 17 The perverse by reason of their transgression, And on account of their iniquities are afflicted;

content: 18 All manner of food their soul abhorreth, And so they draw near unto the gates of death
content_old: 18 All manner of food their soul abhorreth, And so they draw near unto the gates of death

content: 19 Then make they outcry to Yahweh in their peril, And out of their distresses he saveth them.
content_old: 19 Then make they outcry to Yahweh in their peril, And out of their distresses he saveth them.

content: 20 He sendeth his word､ and healeth them, And delivereth them from their graves.
content_old: 20 He sendeth his word､ and healeth them, And delivereth them from their graves.

content: 21 Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his lovingkindness, and for his wonderful dealings with the sons of men!
content_old: 21 Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his lovingkindness, and for his wonderful dealings with the sons of men!

content: 22 Yea let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanks-giving, And recount his works with a shout.
content_old: 22 Yea let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanks-giving, And recount his works with a shout.

content: 23 Men who go down to the sea､ in ships, Doing business through mighty waters;
content_old: 23 Men who go down to the sea､ in ships, Doing business through mighty waters;

content: 24 They see the works of Yahweh, And his wonders in the deep;
content_old: 24 They see the works of Yahweh, And his wonders in the deep;

content: 25 And he speaketh､ and there ariseth a tempestuous wind, Which lifteth on high its rolling waves;
content_old: 25 And he speaketh､ and there ariseth a tempestuous wind, Which lifteth on high its rolling waves;

content: 26 They mount the heavens､ They descend the roaring deeps, Their soul by trouble dissolveth;
content_old: 26 They mount the heavens､ They descend the roaring deeps, Their soul by trouble dissolveth;

content: 27 They reel and stagger､ like a drunken man, And all their wisdom is engulfed
content_old: 27 They reel and stagger､ like a drunken man, And all their wisdom is engulfed

content: 28 Then make they outcry to Yahweh､ in their peril, And out of their distresses he bringeth them forth.
content_old: 28 Then make they outcry to Yahweh､ in their peril, And out of their distresses he bringeth them forth.

content: 29 He calmeth the storm to a whisper, And silent are their rolling waves:
content_old: 29 He calmeth the storm to a whisper, And silent are their rolling waves:

content: 30 Then are they glad､ because they are hushed, And he guideth them unto their desired haven.
content_old: 30 Then are they glad､ because they are hushed, And he guideth them unto their desired haven.

content: 31 Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his lovingkindness, and for his wonderful dealings with the sons of men!
content_old: 31 Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his lovingkindness, and for his wonderful dealings with the sons of men!

content: 32 Yea let them extol him in the convocation of the people, And in the seated company of elders let them praise him.
content_old: 32 Yea let them extol him in the convocation of the people, And in the seated company of elders let them praise him.

content: 33 He turneth Rivers into a desert, and Springs of Water､ into thirsty ground,
content_old: 33 He turneth Rivers into a desert, and Springs of Water､ into thirsty ground,

content: 34 A Land of Fruit､ into a waste of salt, For the wickedness of them who dwell therein.
content_old: 34 A Land of Fruit､ into a waste of salt, For the wickedness of them who dwell therein.

content: 35 He turneth A Desert､ into a pool of water, and A Parched Land into springs of water;
content_old: 35 He turneth A Desert､ into a pool of water, and A Parched Land into springs of water;

content: 36 And hath caused the famished to dwell there, And they have built them a city to dwell in;
content_old: 36 And hath caused the famished to dwell there, And they have built them a city to dwell in;

content: 37 And have sown fields､ and planted vineyards, And made them fruits of increase:
content_old: 37 And have sown fields､ and planted vineyards, And made them fruits of increase:

content: 38 Thus hath he blessed them､ and they have multiplied greatly, And their cattle he maketh not few.
content_old: 38 Thus hath he blessed them､ and they have multiplied greatly, And their cattle he maketh not few.

content: 40 He poureth contempt upon nobles, And causeth them to wander in a pathless waste;
content_old: 40 He poureth contempt upon nobles, And causeth them to wander in a pathless waste;

content: 39 So have they become few and been brought low, By oppression､ misfortune and sorrow;
content_old: 39 So have they become few and been brought low, By oppression､ misfortune and sorrow;

content: 41 But he hath set the needy on high from affliction, And made families like a flock:—
content_old: 41 But he hath set the needy on high from affliction, And made families like a flock:—

content: 42 The upright seeth and is glad, And all perverseness hath closed her mouth.
content_old: 42 The upright seeth and is glad, And all perverseness hath closed her mouth.

content: A Song, a Melody: David’s.
content_old: A Song, a Melody: David’s.

content: 1 Fixed is my heart､ O God, I will sing and touch the strings､ even mine honour.
content_old: 1 Fixed is my heart､ O God, I will sing and touch the strings､ even mine honour.

content: 2 Awake､ O harp and lyre, I will awaken the dawn!
content_old: 2 Awake､ O harp and lyre, I will awaken the dawn!

content: 3 I will thank thee among the peoples､ O Yahweh, And will sing praise unto thee, among the tribes of men.
content_old: 3 I will thank thee among the peoples､ O Yahweh, And will sing praise unto thee, among the tribes of men.

content: 4 For great､ above the heavens is thy loving-kindness, And as far as the skies thy faithfulness.
content_old: 4 For great､ above the heavens is thy loving-kindness, And as far as the skies thy faithfulness.

content: 5 Be thou exalted above the heavens､ O God, And above all the earth be thy glory.
content_old: 5 Be thou exalted above the heavens､ O God, And above all the earth be thy glory.

content: 6 To the end thy beloved ones may be delivered Oh save thou with thy right hand and answer me!
content_old: 6 To the end thy beloved ones may be delivered Oh save thou with thy right hand and answer me!

content: 7 God hath spoken in his holiness､ I will exult! I will apportion Shechem! And the Vale of Succoth will I measure out;
content_old: 7 God hath spoken in his holiness､ I will exult! I will apportion Shechem! And the Vale of Succoth will I measure out;

content: 8 Mine is Gilead—mine Manasseh､ But Ephraim is the defence of my head, Judah is my commander’s staff;
content_old: 8 Mine is Gilead—mine Manasseh､ But Ephraim is the defence of my head, Judah is my commander’s staff;

content: 9 Moab is my washbowl､ Upon Edom will I throw my shoe, Over Philistia raise a shout of triumph.
content_old: 9 Moab is my washbowl､ Upon Edom will I throw my shoe, Over Philistia raise a shout of triumph.

content: 10 Who will conduct me to a fortified city? Who will lead me as far as Edom?
content_old: 10 Who will conduct me to a fortified city? Who will lead me as far as Edom?

content: 11 Hast not thou､ O God､ rejected us? And wilt not go forth､ O God､ with our hosts?
content_old: 11 Hast not thou､ O God､ rejected us? And wilt not go forth､ O God､ with our hosts?

content: 12 Grant us help out of distress, For vain is the deliverance of man:
content_old: 12 Grant us help out of distress, For vain is the deliverance of man:

content: To the Chief Musician. David’s. A Melody.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. David’s. A Melody.

content: 1 O God of my praise､ do not be silent;
content_old: 1 O God of my praise､ do not be silent;

content: 2 For the mouth of the lawless one and the mouth of the deceiver against me are open, They have spoken to me with a false tongue;
content_old: 2 For the mouth of the lawless one and the mouth of the deceiver against me are open, They have spoken to me with a false tongue;

content: 3 And with words of hatred have they surrounded me, And have made war upon me without cause:
content_old: 3 And with words of hatred have they surrounded me, And have made war upon me without cause:

content: 4 For my love they have been accusing me, While I was at prayer:
content_old: 4 For my love they have been accusing me, While I was at prayer:

content: 5 Yea they have returned unto me— Evil for good; and Hatred for my love.
content_old: 5 Yea they have returned unto me— Evil for good; and Hatred for my love.

content: 6 Set in charge over him､ one who is lawless, And let an accuser stand at his right hand;
content_old: 6 Set in charge over him､ one who is lawless, And let an accuser stand at his right hand;

content: 7 When he is judged let him go out condemned, And let his own petition become a sin;
content_old: 7 When he is judged let him go out condemned, And let his own petition become a sin;

content: 8 Let his days become few, His overseership let another take;
content_old: 8 Let his days become few, His overseership let another take;

content: 9 Let his children become fatherless, And his wife a widow;
content_old: 9 Let his children become fatherless, And his wife a widow;

content: 10 Let his children wander about and beg, Let them be driven out of their ruins;
content_old: 10 Let his children wander about and beg, Let them be driven out of their ruins;

content: 11 Let the creditor take aim at all that he hath, And let strangers prey on the fruit of his toil;
content_old: 11 Let the creditor take aim at all that he hath, And let strangers prey on the fruit of his toil;

content: 12 Let him have no one to continue lovingkindness, And there be none to favour his fatherless children;
content_old: 12 Let him have no one to continue lovingkindness, And there be none to favour his fatherless children;

content: 13 Let his posterity be for cutting off, In another generation let their name be wiped out;
content_old: 13 Let his posterity be for cutting off, In another generation let their name be wiped out;

content: 14 Remembered be the iniquity of his fathers against Yahweh, And the sin of his mother let it not be wiped out;
content_old: 14 Remembered be the iniquity of his fathers against Yahweh, And the sin of his mother let it not be wiped out;

content: 15 Let them be before Yahweh continually, And let the memory of them be cut off out of the earth.
content_old: 15 Let them be before Yahweh continually, And let the memory of them be cut off out of the earth.

content: 16 Because that he remembered not to shew loving-kindness､ But pursued the man that was oppressed and needy, That the downhearted he might slay.
content_old: 16 Because that he remembered not to shew loving-kindness､ But pursued the man that was oppressed and needy, That the downhearted he might slay.

content: 17 Because he loved cursing May it have come upon him, Because he delighted not in blessing May it have kept far from him;
content_old: 17 Because he loved cursing May it have come upon him, Because he delighted not in blessing May it have kept far from him;

content: 18 Because he clothed himself in cursing as his outer garment Therefore may it have entered like water into his inward part, And like oil into his bones;
content_old: 18 Because he clothed himself in cursing as his outer garment Therefore may it have entered like water into his inward part, And like oil into his bones;

content: 19 Be it his､ as a garment he shall wrap round him, And for a girdle he shall､ at all times､ gird on:
content_old: 19 Be it his､ as a garment he shall wrap round him, And for a girdle he shall､ at all times､ gird on:

content: 20 This be the reward of mine accusers､ from Yahweh, Even of them who are speaking wrongfully against my life.
content_old: 20 This be the reward of mine accusers､ from Yahweh, Even of them who are speaking wrongfully against my life.

content: 21 But thou Yahweh､ Adonây､ deal effectually with me､ for the sake of thy Name, Since good is thy lovingkindness O rescue me;
content_old: 21 But thou Yahweh､ Adonây､ deal effectually with me､ for the sake of thy Name, Since good is thy lovingkindness O rescue me;

content: 22 For oppressed and needy I am, And my heart is wounded within me.
content_old: 22 For oppressed and needy I am, And my heart is wounded within me.

content: 23 As a shadow when it stretcheth out I am gone, I am shaken off like the locust;
content_old: 23 As a shadow when it stretcheth out I am gone, I am shaken off like the locust;

content: 24 My knees|| tremble from fasting, And my flesh faileth of fatness:
content_old: 24 My knees|| tremble from fasting, And my flesh faileth of fatness:

content: 25 So I am become a reproach for them, They see me､ they shake their head.
content_old: 25 So I am become a reproach for them, They see me､ they shake their head.

content: 26 Help me! O Yahweh my God, Save me､ according to thy lovingkindness:
content_old: 26 Help me! O Yahweh my God, Save me､ according to thy lovingkindness:

content: 27 That they may know that Thine own hand this is, Thou､ Yahweh hast done it.
content_old: 27 That they may know that Thine own hand this is, Thou､ Yahweh hast done it.

content: 28 They may curse if thou wilt bless,— Mine assailants shall be ashamed､ But thy servant shall rejoice;
content_old: 28 They may curse if thou wilt bless,— Mine assailants shall be ashamed､ But thy servant shall rejoice;

content: 29 Mine accusers shall be clothed with confusion, And shall wrap about them､ like a cloak､ their own shame.
content_old: 29 Mine accusers shall be clothed with confusion, And shall wrap about them､ like a cloak､ their own shame.

content: 30 I will thank Yahweh loudly with my mouth, Yea in the midst of multitudes will I praise him;
content_old: 30 I will thank Yahweh loudly with my mouth, Yea in the midst of multitudes will I praise him;

content: David’s. A Melody.
content_old: David’s. A Melody.

content: 1 The declaration of Yahweh to my Lord— Sit thou at my right hand, Until I make thy foes thy footstool.
