content: David’s
content_old: David’s

content: 1 I will give thee thanks with all my heart, Before the messengers of God will I praise thee in song:
content_old: 1 I will give thee thanks with all my heart, Before the messengers of God will I praise thee in song:

content: 2 I will bow down towards thy holy temple､ And thank thy Name､ for thy lovingkindness and for thy faithfulness, For thou hast magnified､ above all thy Name､ thy word !
content_old: 2 I will bow down towards thy holy temple､ And thank thy Name､ for thy lovingkindness and for thy faithfulness, For thou hast magnified､ above all thy Name､ thy word !

content: 3 In the day I cried unto thee Then didst thou answer me, And didst excite me､ in my soul､ mightily.
content_old: 3 In the day I cried unto thee Then didst thou answer me, And didst excite me､ in my soul､ mightily.

content: 4 All the kings of the earth will thank thee､ O Yahweh, When they have heard the sayings of thy mouth;
content_old: 4 All the kings of the earth will thank thee､ O Yahweh, When they have heard the sayings of thy mouth;

content: 5 And they will sing of the ways of Yahweh, That great is the glory of Yahweh:
content_old: 5 And they will sing of the ways of Yahweh, That great is the glory of Yahweh:

content: 6 Though lofty is Yahweh yet the lowly he regardeth, But the haughty—afar off doth he acknowledge.
content_old: 6 Though lofty is Yahweh yet the lowly he regardeth, But the haughty—afar off doth he acknowledge.

content: 7 Though I walk in the midst of distress thou wilt give me life,— Because of the anger of my foes thou wilt thrust forth thy hand, And thy right hand will save me:
content_old: 7 Though I walk in the midst of distress thou wilt give me life,— Because of the anger of my foes thou wilt thrust forth thy hand, And thy right hand will save me:

content: To the Chief Musician. David’s. A Melody
content_old: To the Chief Musician. David’s. A Melody

content: 1 O Yahweh! thou hast searched me､ and observed:
content_old: 1 O Yahweh! thou hast searched me､ and observed:

content: 2 Thou hast observed my downsitting and mine uprising, Thou hast given heed to my desire､ from afar:
content_old: 2 Thou hast observed my downsitting and mine uprising, Thou hast given heed to my desire､ from afar:

content: 3 My path and my couch hast thou examined, And all my ways thou well knowest.
content_old: 3 My path and my couch hast thou examined, And all my ways thou well knowest.

content: 4 Surely there hath not been a word on my tongue, But behold! O Yahweh､ thou hast observed it on every side.
content_old: 4 Surely there hath not been a word on my tongue, But behold! O Yahweh､ thou hast observed it on every side.

content: 5 Behind and before hast thou shut me in, And hast laid upon me thy hand:—
content_old: 5 Behind and before hast thou shut me in, And hast laid upon me thy hand:—

content: 6 Knowledge too wonderfulfor me! High, I cannot attain to it!
content_old: 6 Knowledge too wonderfulfor me! High, I cannot attain to it!

content: 7 Whither can I go from thy spirit? Or whither from thy face can I flee?
content_old: 7 Whither can I go from thy spirit? Or whither from thy face can I flee?

content: 8 If I ascend the heavens therethou art! If I spread out hades as my couch behold thee!
content_old: 8 If I ascend the heavens therethou art! If I spread out hades as my couch behold thee!

content: 9 If I mount the wings of the dawn, Settle down in the region beyond the sea
content_old: 9 If I mount the wings of the dawn, Settle down in the region beyond the sea

content: 10 Even therethy hand shall lead me, And thy right hand shall hold me.
content_old: 10 Even therethy hand shall lead me, And thy right hand shall hold me.

content: 11 If I say､ Surely darknessshall cover me! Then night is light about me.
content_old: 11 If I say､ Surely darknessshall cover me! Then night is light about me.

content: 12 Even darknesswill not conceal from thee,— But nightlike day will shine, So is the darkness as the light!
content_old: 12 Even darknesswill not conceal from thee,— But nightlike day will shine, So is the darkness as the light!

content: 13 For thoudidst possess thyself of my reins, Thou didst weave me together in the womb of my mother.
content_old: 13 For thoudidst possess thyself of my reins, Thou didst weave me together in the womb of my mother.

content: 14 I thank thee､ in that fearfully was my being distinguished, Wonderful are thy works, And mine own soul is observing them intently!
content_old: 14 I thank thee､ in that fearfully was my being distinguished, Wonderful are thy works, And mine own soul is observing them intently!

content: 15 My substance was not hid from thee,— When I was made in secret, When I was skilfully figured in the lower parts of the earth.
content_old: 15 My substance was not hid from thee,— When I was made in secret, When I was skilfully figured in the lower parts of the earth.

content: 16 Mine unfinished substance thine eyes beheld､ And in thy book all the parts thereof were written,— The days they should be fashioned! While yet there was not one among them.
content_old: 16 Mine unfinished substance thine eyes beheld､ And in thy book all the parts thereof were written,— The days they should be fashioned! While yet there was not one among them.

content: 17 To me then､ how precious have thy desires become､ O GOD! How numerous､ the heads of them!
content_old: 17 To me then､ how precious have thy desires become､ O GOD! How numerous､ the heads of them!

content: 18 I would recount them! Beyond the sands they multiply, I rouse myself— And am still with thee.
content_old: 18 I would recount them! Beyond the sands they multiply, I rouse myself— And am still with thee.

content: 19 Wilt thou not､ O God､ slay the lawless one? Therefore､ ye men of bloodshed､ depart from me!
content_old: 19 Wilt thou not､ O God､ slay the lawless one? Therefore､ ye men of bloodshed､ depart from me!

content: 20 For they speak of thee wickedly, Thy foes lift up their hand unto falsehood.
content_old: 20 For they speak of thee wickedly, Thy foes lift up their hand unto falsehood.

content: 21 Do I not hate them who hate thee､ O Yahweh? And loathe them who rise up against thee?
content_old: 21 Do I not hate them who hate thee､ O Yahweh? And loathe them who rise up against thee?

content: 22 With completeness of hatred I hate them, As enemies have they become to me.
content_old: 22 With completeness of hatred I hate them, As enemies have they become to me.

content: 23 Search me､ O GOD､ and observe my heart, Try me､ and observe my cares;
content_old: 23 Search me､ O GOD､ and observe my heart, Try me､ and observe my cares;

content: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.
content_old: To the Chief Musician. A Melody of David.

content: 1 Rescue me､ O Yahweh､ from the men of mischief, From the men of violence wilt thou preserve me:
content_old: 1 Rescue me､ O Yahweh､ from the men of mischief, From the men of violence wilt thou preserve me:

content: 2 Who have devised mischiefs in their heart, Every day do they stir up wars:
content_old: 2 Who have devised mischiefs in their heart, Every day do they stir up wars:

content: 3 They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent,— The poison of the aspis under their lips. Selah.
content_old: 3 They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent,— The poison of the aspis under their lips. Selah.

content: 4 Keep me､ O Yahweh､ from the hands of the lawless one､ From the man of violence wilt thou preserve me,— Who have devised､ to thrust at my steps:
content_old: 4 Keep me､ O Yahweh､ from the hands of the lawless one､ From the man of violence wilt thou preserve me,— Who have devised､ to thrust at my steps:

content: 5 The proud have hidden a snare for me､ And cords have they spread as a net beside the track, Snares have they set for me. Selah.
content_old: 5 The proud have hidden a snare for me､ And cords have they spread as a net beside the track, Snares have they set for me. Selah.

content: 6 I have said unto Yahweh､ My GOD thou art! Give ear､ O Yahweh､ unto the voice of my supplications.
content_old: 6 I have said unto Yahweh､ My GOD thou art! Give ear､ O Yahweh､ unto the voice of my supplications.

content: 7 O Yahweh､ My Lord､ my saving strength, Thou hast screened my head in the day of battle.
content_old: 7 O Yahweh､ My Lord､ my saving strength, Thou hast screened my head in the day of battle.

content: 8 Do not grant､ O Yahweh､ the desires of the lawless one, His device do not promote, They would exalt themselves. Selah.
content_old: 8 Do not grant､ O Yahweh､ the desires of the lawless one, His device do not promote, They would exalt themselves. Selah.

content: 9 As for the head of them who surround me Let the mischief of their lips cover them:
content_old: 9 As for the head of them who surround me Let the mischief of their lips cover them:

content: 10 May there be dropped on them live coals,— Into the fire may they be let fall, Into watery pits from which they shall not rise.
content_old: 10 May there be dropped on them live coals,— Into the fire may they be let fall, Into watery pits from which they shall not rise.

content: 11 As for the slanderer let him not be established in the earth,— As for the man of wrongful violence let misfortune hunt him with thrust upon thrust.
content_old: 11 As for the slanderer let him not be established in the earth,— As for the man of wrongful violence let misfortune hunt him with thrust upon thrust.

content: 12 I know that Yahweh will execute The right of the oppressed one, The vindication of the needy.
content_old: 12 I know that Yahweh will execute The right of the oppressed one, The vindication of the needy.

content: A Melody of David.
content_old: A Melody of David.

content: 1 O Yahweh､ I have cried unto thee､ Make thou haste to me, Give ear unto my voice､ when I cry to thee.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh､ I have cried unto thee､ Make thou haste to me, Give ear unto my voice､ when I cry to thee.

content: 2 Let my prayer be set in order like incense before thee,— The lifting up of my hands､ as the evening gift.
content_old: 2 Let my prayer be set in order like incense before thee,— The lifting up of my hands､ as the evening gift.

content: 3 Set thou､ O Yahweh､ a watch at my mouth, Keep thou guard over the door of my lips.
content_old: 3 Set thou､ O Yahweh､ a watch at my mouth, Keep thou guard over the door of my lips.

content: 4 Let not my heart incline to a matter of wrong､ That I should busy myself with practices in lawlessness､ with men working iniquity, And let me not eat of their dainties.
content_old: 4 Let not my heart incline to a matter of wrong､ That I should busy myself with practices in lawlessness､ with men working iniquity, And let me not eat of their dainties.

content: 5 Let a righteous man smite me— A lovingkindness that he should correct me､ An oil for the head which let not my head refuse! For yet even my prayer shall be in their calamities.
content_old: 5 Let a righteous man smite me— A lovingkindness that he should correct me､ An oil for the head which let not my head refuse! For yet even my prayer shall be in their calamities.

content: 6 Their judges have been hurled down by a crag, Now have men heard my sayings､ for they have become sweet.
content_old: 6 Their judges have been hurled down by a crag, Now have men heard my sayings､ for they have become sweet.

content: 7 As when one plougheth and furroweth the earth Scattered about are our bones at the mouth of hades!
content_old: 7 As when one plougheth and furroweth the earth Scattered about are our bones at the mouth of hades!

content: 8 Surely unto thee､ O Yahweh､ My Lord are mine eyes, In thee have I sought refuge, Do not pour out my life.
content_old: 8 Surely unto thee､ O Yahweh､ My Lord are mine eyes, In thee have I sought refuge, Do not pour out my life.

content: 9 Keep me out of The clutches of the trap they have set for me, and The snares of the workers of iniquity.
content_old: 9 Keep me out of The clutches of the trap they have set for me, and The snares of the workers of iniquity.

content: An Instructive Psalm of David. When he was in the Cave. A Prayer.
content_old: An Instructive Psalm of David. When he was in the Cave. A Prayer.

content: 1 With my voice—to Yahweh make I outcry, With my voice—to Yahweh make I supplication:
content_old: 1 With my voice—to Yahweh make I outcry, With my voice—to Yahweh make I supplication:

content: 2 I pour out before him my complaint, My distress—before him I tell.
content_old: 2 I pour out before him my complaint, My distress—before him I tell.

content: 3 When my spirit fainted concerning myself Then thou didst take note of my path,— In the course which I was about to take They had hidden a snare for me.
content_old: 3 When my spirit fainted concerning myself Then thou didst take note of my path,— In the course which I was about to take They had hidden a snare for me.

content: 4 Look to the right hand and see､ That there is none that for me hath regard,— Escape is lost to me, There is no one to care for my life.
content_old: 4 Look to the right hand and see､ That there is none that for me hath regard,— Escape is lost to me, There is no one to care for my life.

content: 5 I have made outcry unto thee､ O Yahweh,— I have said､ Thou art my refuge, My portion､ in the land of the living.
content_old: 5 I have made outcry unto thee､ O Yahweh,— I have said､ Thou art my refuge, My portion､ in the land of the living.

content: 6 Attend thou unto my loud cry､ For I am brought very low,— Rescue me from my pursuers, For they are stronger than I.
content_old: 6 Attend thou unto my loud cry､ For I am brought very low,— Rescue me from my pursuers, For they are stronger than I.

content: A Melody of David.
content_old: A Melody of David.

content: 1 Yahweh､ hear my prayer､ Give ear to my supplications, In thy faithfulness answer me､ in thy righteousness.
content_old: 1 Yahweh､ hear my prayer､ Give ear to my supplications, In thy faithfulness answer me､ in thy righteousness.

content: 2 Do not then enter into judgment with thy servant, For no one living can appear just before thee.
content_old: 2 Do not then enter into judgment with thy servant, For no one living can appear just before thee.

content: 3 For an enemy Hath pursued my soul､ Hath crushed､ to the earth､ my life, Hath made me dwell in dark places､ like the ancient dead.
content_old: 3 For an enemy Hath pursued my soul､ Hath crushed､ to the earth､ my life, Hath made me dwell in dark places､ like the ancient dead.

content: 4 Therefore hath my spirit fainted concerning myself, Within me hath my heart been confounded.
content_old: 4 Therefore hath my spirit fainted concerning myself, Within me hath my heart been confounded.

content: 5 I have remembered the days of aforetime､ I have talked with myself of every deed of thine, Of the work of thy hands I would speak:
content_old: 5 I have remembered the days of aforetime､ I have talked with myself of every deed of thine, Of the work of thy hands I would speak:

content: 6 I have spread out my hands unto thee, My soul is as a thirsty land､ for thee. Selah.
content_old: 6 I have spread out my hands unto thee, My soul is as a thirsty land､ for thee. Selah.

content: 7 Speedily answer me､ O Yahweh､ My spirit faileth,— Do not hide thy face from me, Or I shall be made like unto them who go down into the pit.
content_old: 7 Speedily answer me､ O Yahweh､ My spirit faileth,— Do not hide thy face from me, Or I shall be made like unto them who go down into the pit.

content: 8 Let me hear､ in the morning､ thy lovingkindness､ For in thee have I trusted,— Let me know the way in which I should walk, For unto thee have I uplifted my soul.
content_old: 8 Let me hear､ in the morning､ thy lovingkindness､ For in thee have I trusted,— Let me know the way in which I should walk, For unto thee have I uplifted my soul.

content: 9 Rescue me from my foes､ O Yahweh, Unto thee have I come seeking refuge.
content_old: 9 Rescue me from my foes､ O Yahweh, Unto thee have I come seeking refuge.

content: 10 Teach me to do thy good pleasure､ For thou art my God,— Thy spirit is good, Wilt thou set me down to rest in a level land.
content_old: 10 Teach me to do thy good pleasure､ For thou art my God,— Thy spirit is good, Wilt thou set me down to rest in a level land.

content: 11 For the sake of thy Name､ O Yahweh､ wilt thou give unto me life, In thy righteousness wilt thou bring forth､ out of distress､ my soul;
content_old: 11 For the sake of thy Name､ O Yahweh､ wilt thou give unto me life, In thy righteousness wilt thou bring forth､ out of distress､ my soul;

content: David’s.
content_old: David’s.

content: 1 Blessed be Yahweh､ my Rock､ Who teacheth my hands to war, my fingers to fight:
content_old: 1 Blessed be Yahweh､ my Rock､ Who teacheth my hands to war, my fingers to fight:

content: 2 My lovingkindness and my stronghold､ My high tower and my deliverer—mine! My buckler､ and he in whom I have sought refuge,— He that subdueth my people under me.
content_old: 2 My lovingkindness and my stronghold､ My high tower and my deliverer—mine! My buckler､ and he in whom I have sought refuge,— He that subdueth my people under me.

content: 3 O Yahweh! what is the earthborn, And yet thou hast acknowledged him,— The son of a mortal, And yet thou hast taken account of him:
content_old: 3 O Yahweh! what is the earthborn, And yet thou hast acknowledged him,— The son of a mortal, And yet thou hast taken account of him:

content: 4 The earthborn resembleth a vapour, His days are like a passing shadow.
content_old: 4 The earthborn resembleth a vapour, His days are like a passing shadow.

content: 5 O Yahweh! bow thy heavens and come down, Touch the mountains､ that they smoke:
content_old: 5 O Yahweh! bow thy heavens and come down, Touch the mountains､ that they smoke:

content: 6 Flash forth lightning､ that thou mayest scatter them, Send out thine arrows､ that thou mayest confound them:
content_old: 6 Flash forth lightning､ that thou mayest scatter them, Send out thine arrows､ that thou mayest confound them:

content: 7 Put forth thy hands from on high:— Snatch me away and rescue me Out of mighty waters, Out of the hand of the sons of the alien,
content_old: 7 Put forth thy hands from on high:— Snatch me away and rescue me Out of mighty waters, Out of the hand of the sons of the alien,

content: 8 Whose mouth hath spoken deceit, And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
content_old: 8 Whose mouth hath spoken deceit, And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

content: 9 O God! a new song will I sing unto thee,— On a harp of ten strings will I make music to thee:
content_old: 9 O God! a new song will I sing unto thee,— On a harp of ten strings will I make music to thee:

content: 10 Who giveth victory unto kings,— Who snatcheth away David his servant､ from the calamitous sword.
content_old: 10 Who giveth victory unto kings,— Who snatcheth away David his servant､ from the calamitous sword.

content: 11 Snatch me away and rescue me Out of the hand of the sons of the alien,— Whose mouth hath spoken deceit, And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood:—
content_old: 11 Snatch me away and rescue me Out of the hand of the sons of the alien,— Whose mouth hath spoken deceit, And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood:—

content: 12 That our sons may be like plants well grown while yet young,— Our daughters like corner pillars,—carved, in the construction of a palace:
content_old: 12 That our sons may be like plants well grown while yet young,— Our daughters like corner pillars,—carved, in the construction of a palace:

content: 13 Our garners full､ pouring out from one kind to another; Our flocks multiplying by thousands—by myriads, in our open fields:
content_old: 13 Our garners full､ pouring out from one kind to another; Our flocks multiplying by thousands—by myriads, in our open fields:

content: 14 Our oxen well-laden; No breaking in and no departing,— And no loud lament in our places of concourse:—
content_old: 14 Our oxen well-laden; No breaking in and no departing,— And no loud lament in our places of concourse:—

content: A Psalm of Praise. David’s.
content_old: A Psalm of Praise. David’s.

content: 1 I will extol thee､ my God､ O King, And will bless thy Name, to times age-abiding and beyond:
content_old: 1 I will extol thee､ my God､ O King, And will bless thy Name, to times age-abiding and beyond:

content: 2 Every day will I bless thee, And praise thy Name､ to times age-abiding and beyond.
content_old: 2 Every day will I bless thee, And praise thy Name､ to times age-abiding and beyond.

content: 3 Great is Yahweh—and worthy to be heartily praised, And his greatness is unsearchable.
content_old: 3 Great is Yahweh—and worthy to be heartily praised, And his greatness is unsearchable.

content: 4 Generation unto generation shall celebrate thy works, And thy mighty deeds shall they tell:
content_old: 4 Generation unto generation shall celebrate thy works, And thy mighty deeds shall they tell:

content: 5 The splendour of the glory of thy majesty shall they speak, And thy wonders will I utter.
content_old: 5 The splendour of the glory of thy majesty shall they speak, And thy wonders will I utter.

content: 6 And the might of thy terrible acts shall men speak, And as for thy greatness I will recount it.
content_old: 6 And the might of thy terrible acts shall men speak, And as for thy greatness I will recount it.

content: 7 The memory of thy great goodness shall men pour forth, And thy righteousness shall they shout aloud.
content_old: 7 The memory of thy great goodness shall men pour forth, And thy righteousness shall they shout aloud.

content: 8 Gracious and compassionate is Yahweh,— Slow to anger､ and of great lovingkindness.
content_old: 8 Gracious and compassionate is Yahweh,— Slow to anger､ and of great lovingkindness.

content: 9 Good is Yahweh to all, And his tender compassions are over all his works.
content_old: 9 Good is Yahweh to all, And his tender compassions are over all his works.

content: 10 All thy works､ O Yahweh､ will give thanks unto thee,— And thy men of lovingkindness will bless thee:
content_old: 10 All thy works､ O Yahweh､ will give thanks unto thee,— And thy men of lovingkindness will bless thee:

content: 11 The glory of thy kingdom will they tell,— And thy power will they speak.
content_old: 11 The glory of thy kingdom will they tell,— And thy power will they speak.

content: 12 To make known to the sons of men､ his mighty deeds, And the splendid glory of his kingdom.
content_old: 12 To make known to the sons of men､ his mighty deeds, And the splendid glory of his kingdom.

content: 13 Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages,— And thy dominion is over generation after generation.
content_old: 13 Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages,— And thy dominion is over generation after generation.

content: 14 Yahweh is ready to uphold all who are falling, And to raise all who are laid prostrate.
content_old: 14 Yahweh is ready to uphold all who are falling, And to raise all who are laid prostrate.

content: 15 The eyes of all for thee do wait, And thou givest them their food in its season.
content_old: 15 The eyes of all for thee do wait, And thou givest them their food in its season.

content: 16 Thou openest thy hand､ And fillest every living thing with gladness.
content_old: 16 Thou openest thy hand､ And fillest every living thing with gladness.

content: 17 Righteous is Yahweh in all his ways, And kind in all his works.
content_old: 17 Righteous is Yahweh in all his ways, And kind in all his works.

content: 18 Near is Yahweh to all who call upon him,— To all them who call upon him in faithfulness.
content_old: 18 Near is Yahweh to all who call upon him,— To all them who call upon him in faithfulness.

content: 19 The desire of them who revere him will he fulfil, And their cry will he hear､ and will save them.
content_old: 19 The desire of them who revere him will he fulfil, And their cry will he hear､ and will save them.

content: 20 Yahweh preserveth all who love him, But all the lawless will he destroy.
content_old: 20 Yahweh preserveth all who love him, But all the lawless will he destroy.

content: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Praise､ O my soul､ Yahweh､
content_old: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Praise､ O my soul､ Yahweh､

content: 2 I will praise Yahweh while I live! I will make melody to my God while I continue!
content_old: 2 I will praise Yahweh while I live! I will make melody to my God while I continue!

content: 3 Do not ye trust in nobles, In a son of man who hath no deliverance:
content_old: 3 Do not ye trust in nobles, In a son of man who hath no deliverance:

content: 4 His spirit goeth forth､ he returneth to his ground, In that very day his thoughts perish.
content_old: 4 His spirit goeth forth､ he returneth to his ground, In that very day his thoughts perish.

content: 5 How happy is he that hath the GOD of Jacob as his help, Whose hope is on Yahweh his God:—
content_old: 5 How happy is he that hath the GOD of Jacob as his help, Whose hope is on Yahweh his God:—

content: 6 Who made The heavens and the earth､ The sea and all that is therein, Who keepeth faithfulness to times age-abiding:
content_old: 6 Who made The heavens and the earth､ The sea and all that is therein, Who keepeth faithfulness to times age-abiding:

content: 7 Who executeth justice for the oppressed､ Who giveth food to the famishing, Yahweh who liberateth prisoners;
content_old: 7 Who executeth justice for the oppressed､ Who giveth food to the famishing, Yahweh who liberateth prisoners;

content: 8 Yahweh who opened the eyes of the blind､ Yahweh who raiseth the prostrate, Yahweh who loveth the righteous;
content_old: 8 Yahweh who opened the eyes of the blind､ Yahweh who raiseth the prostrate, Yahweh who loveth the righteous;

content: 9 Yahweh who preserveth sojourners､ The fatherless and widows he relieveth,— But the way of the lawless he overturneth.
content_old: 9 Yahweh who preserveth sojourners､ The fatherless and widows he relieveth,— But the way of the lawless he overturneth.

content: 1 Praise ye Yah､ For it is good､ to make melody to our God,— For it is delightful､ seemly is praise!
content_old: 1 Praise ye Yah､ For it is good､ to make melody to our God,— For it is delightful､ seemly is praise!

content: 2 Yahweh is building Jerusalem, The outcasts of Israel will he gather together.
content_old: 2 Yahweh is building Jerusalem, The outcasts of Israel will he gather together.

content: 3 He is healing the broken in heart,— And binding up their hurts.
content_old: 3 He is healing the broken in heart,— And binding up their hurts.

content: 4 Counting the number of the stars, To all of them—names he giveth.
content_old: 4 Counting the number of the stars, To all of them—names he giveth.

content: 5 Great is our Lord､ and of abounding strength, And his knowledge cannot be expressed.
content_old: 5 Great is our Lord､ and of abounding strength, And his knowledge cannot be expressed.

content: 6 Yahweh relieveth the humbled! Casting the lawless down to the earth.
content_old: 6 Yahweh relieveth the humbled! Casting the lawless down to the earth.

content: 7 Respond to Yahweh with thanksgiving, Make melody to our God with the lyre.
content_old: 7 Respond to Yahweh with thanksgiving, Make melody to our God with the lyre.

content: 8 Who covereth the heavens with clouds､ Preparing rain for the earth, Who causeth the mountains to sprout grass:
content_old: 8 Who covereth the heavens with clouds､ Preparing rain for the earth, Who causeth the mountains to sprout grass:

content: 9 Giving､ to the beast､ its food, To the young ravens, when they cry.
content_old: 9 Giving､ to the beast､ its food, To the young ravens, when they cry.

content: 10 Not in the strength of the horse doth he delight, Not in the legs of a man hath he pleasure:
content_old: 10 Not in the strength of the horse doth he delight, Not in the legs of a man hath he pleasure:

content: 11 Yahweh hath pleasure in them who revere him, In them who wait for his lovingkindness.
content_old: 11 Yahweh hath pleasure in them who revere him, In them who wait for his lovingkindness.

content: 12 Laud thou, O Jerusalem､ Yahweh, Praise thy God､ O Zion:
content_old: 12 Laud thou, O Jerusalem､ Yahweh, Praise thy God､ O Zion:

content: 13 For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates, He hath blessed thy children in thy midst:
content_old: 13 For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates, He hath blessed thy children in thy midst:

content: 14 Who maketh thy boundaries to be peace, With the marrow of wheat doth he satisfy thee:
content_old: 14 Who maketh thy boundaries to be peace, With the marrow of wheat doth he satisfy thee:

content: 15 Who sendeth his utterance to the earth, How swiftly runneth his word!
content_old: 15 Who sendeth his utterance to the earth, How swiftly runneth his word!

content: 16 Who giveth snow like wool, Hoar-frost—like ashes he scattereth:
content_old: 16 Who giveth snow like wool, Hoar-frost—like ashes he scattereth:

content: 17 Casting forth his ice like crumbs, Before his cold who can stand?
content_old: 17 Casting forth his ice like crumbs, Before his cold who can stand?

content: 18 He sendeth forth his word and melteth them, He causeth his wind to blow､ the waters stream along :
content_old: 18 He sendeth forth his word and melteth them, He causeth his wind to blow､ the waters stream along :

content: 19 Declaring his word unto Jacob, His statutes and his regulations, unto Israel.
content_old: 19 Declaring his word unto Jacob, His statutes and his regulations, unto Israel.

content: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Praise Yahweh､ out of the heavens, Praise him､ in the heights;
content_old: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Praise Yahweh､ out of the heavens, Praise him､ in the heights;

content: 2 Praise him､ all his messengers, Praise him､ all his host;
content_old: 2 Praise him､ all his messengers, Praise him､ all his host;

content: 3 Praise him､ sun and moon, Praise him､ all ye stars of light;
content_old: 3 Praise him､ sun and moon, Praise him､ all ye stars of light;

content: 4 Praise him､ O ye heavens of heavens, And ye waters that are above the heavens;
content_old: 4 Praise him､ O ye heavens of heavens, And ye waters that are above the heavens;

content: 5 Let them praise the Name of Yahweh, For he commanded､ and they were created;
content_old: 5 Let them praise the Name of Yahweh, For he commanded､ and they were created;

content: 6 So caused he them to stand perpetually—age-abidingly, A decree hath he given, and it passeth not beyond.
content_old: 6 So caused he them to stand perpetually—age-abidingly, A decree hath he given, and it passeth not beyond.

content: 7 Praise Yahweh､ out of the earth, Sea monsters､ and all resounding deeps;
content_old: 7 Praise Yahweh､ out of the earth, Sea monsters､ and all resounding deeps;

content: 8 Fire and hail､ snow and vapour, Stormy wind､ fulfilling his word;
content_old: 8 Fire and hail､ snow and vapour, Stormy wind､ fulfilling his word;

content: 9 Ye mountains､ and all hills, Fruit trees､ and all cedars;
content_old: 9 Ye mountains､ and all hills, Fruit trees､ and all cedars;

content: 10 Thou wild-beast､ and all ye cattle, Crawling creature､ and bird of wing;
content_old: 10 Thou wild-beast､ and all ye cattle, Crawling creature､ and bird of wing;

content: 11 Kings of earth､ and all peoples, Rulers､ and all judges of earth;
content_old: 11 Kings of earth､ and all peoples, Rulers､ and all judges of earth;

content: 12 Young men､ yea even virgins, Elders､ and children.
content_old: 12 Young men､ yea even virgins, Elders､ and children.

content: 13 Let them praise the Name of Yahweh､ For lofty is his Name alone, His splendour is over earth and heavens.
content_old: 13 Let them praise the Name of Yahweh､ For lofty is his Name alone, His splendour is over earth and heavens.

content: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Sing to Yahweh a song that is new, His praise in the convocation of the men of lovingkindness.
content_old: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Sing to Yahweh a song that is new, His praise in the convocation of the men of lovingkindness.

content: 2 Let Israel rejoice in him that made him, Let the sons of Zion exult in their king;
content_old: 2 Let Israel rejoice in him that made him, Let the sons of Zion exult in their king;

content: 3 Let them praise his Name in the dance, With timbrel and lyre let them make music to him.
content_old: 3 Let them praise his Name in the dance, With timbrel and lyre let them make music to him.

content: 4 For Yahweh is taking pleasure in his people, He will beautify humbled ones with victory.
content_old: 4 For Yahweh is taking pleasure in his people, He will beautify humbled ones with victory.

content: 5 Let the men of lovingkindness exult as they glory, Let them shout aloud upon their beds:
content_old: 5 Let the men of lovingkindness exult as they glory, Let them shout aloud upon their beds:

content: 6 The high songs of GOD be in their throat, And a two-edged sword in their hand:
content_old: 6 The high songs of GOD be in their throat, And a two-edged sword in their hand:

content: 7 To execute An avenging among the nations､ Rebukes among the peoples:
content_old: 7 To execute An avenging among the nations､ Rebukes among the peoples:

content: 8 To bind Their kings with fetters, and Their honoured ones with iron bands;
content_old: 8 To bind Their kings with fetters, and Their honoured ones with iron bands;

content: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Praise ye GOD in his sanctuary, Praise him､ in his strong expanse;
content_old: 1 Praise ye Yah､ Praise ye GOD in his sanctuary, Praise him､ in his strong expanse;

content: 2 Praise him､ for his mighty deeds, Praise him､ according to his exceeding greatness:
content_old: 2 Praise him､ for his mighty deeds, Praise him､ according to his exceeding greatness:

content: 3 Praise him､ with the blast of a horn, Praise him､ with the harp and lyre:
content_old: 3 Praise him､ with the blast of a horn, Praise him､ with the harp and lyre:

content: 4 Praise him､ with timbrel and dance,— Praise him､ with stringed instrument and flute,
content_old: 4 Praise him､ with timbrel and dance,— Praise him､ with stringed instrument and flute,

content: 5 Praise him､ with cymbals of clear tone,— Praise him､ with cymbals of loud clang:
content_old: 5 Praise him､ with cymbals of clear tone,— Praise him､ with cymbals of loud clang:
